respStmt.resp: Automatic assignment of glosses to lemmata (single tokens) within a base-text file
respStmt.name: Find_lemmas.py

editionStmt.p: From Thesaurus Palaeohibernicus, I 499–712 (glosses containing Old Irish only). Digital text prepared by Adrian Doyle.

revisionDesc.change: Automatically processed: The revisionDesc section was automatically created during lemma assignment.

Automatically processed: Glosses were assigned to lemmata in the associated base-text file by targeting the unique IDs of tokens within that file which have the highest string similarity with lemmata identified in this gloss edition.

note.gloss: .i. generaliter airisdia do cách isinchétne tuiste aliter deo meo Specialiter óre donécomnacht spiritum sanctum sibi et gratiam praedicationis
note.note: i.e. generaliter, for He is God unto every one in the primal creation. Aliter Deo meo specialiter, because He has imparted Spiritum sanctum sibi, etc.

note.gloss: .i. isdiasom domsa hóre nocretim ísu christo ut ipse dixit nemo uenit ad patrem rl.
note.note: i.e. He is God unto me because I believe in Jesus, etc.

note.gloss: .i. isairdircc ícachthír rocretsisi dodía et ismór athorbe de dúnni .i. húare ro creitset ardlathi inbetho cretfed cách iarum et intí cretfes ní ágathar ángreim
note.note: i.e. it is well known in every country that ye have believed in God, and great unto us is the profit thereof, to wit, because the chief princes of the world have believed every one will then believe, and he who shall believe is not afraid of their power.
i.e. He knows: there is no concealment from Him.

note.gloss: déde didiu nand .i. memoriam facio sine intermisione uel in orationibus meis sine in[termisione]
note.note: Two things, then, are therein, i.e. memoriam, etc.
i.e. if perchance I may have.
i.e. that I may come.

note.gloss: cid æm no.domberasa cucuibsi nianse desidero enim
note.note: But what is it that will bring me to you? Easy (to answer): desidero, etc.

note.gloss: .i. ní ógthindnacal (as)ṁbeir som óre rotectsat ní de riam andudesta didiu difoirbthetu for nirisse conrufailnither á mé
note.note: i.e. (it is) not a complete gift which he mentions, because they had previously possessed something of it (spiritual grace): what, then, is wanting to the perfection of your faith, that it may be supplied a me.

note.gloss: .i. condib dídnad domsa foirbthetu hirisse dúibsi (con)d(i)b foirb(thetu) fornirisse (dom)sa
note.note: i.e. so that perfection of your faith may be a comfort to me: so that it may be perfection of your faith unto me.
yours.
i.e. mine.
i.e. hitherto.

note.gloss: .i. hic ut ministerii sui apud deum habeat fructum .i. ardofórmaich fochricc dosom sochude docreittim triaprecept
note.note: i.e. for that a multitude has believed through his preaching increaseth the reward for him.
i.e. for all the wise Gentiles.
i.e. for the foreigners.

note.gloss: .i. dlegair domsa precept docách quia omnium linguís loquor am debitor iarum omnibus sapientibus et insipientibus
note.note: i.e. it is my duty to preach to every one, because omnium linguis loquor: I am therefore debitor, etc.
i.e. I am ready.

note.gloss: .i. ní mebul lemm precept soscéli .i. precept passionis et incarnationis christi quia secuntur uirtutes .i. resurexionem et ascentionem et ....
note.note: i.e. I am not ashamed to preach the gospel. i.e. to preach the Passio, etc.

note.gloss: ait, íte docéte omnes gentes [in marg. l.] airechas ceneóil airsiu ní airechas fidei
note.note: i.e. primacy of race therefore, not primacy fidei.

note.gloss: .i. aithgne et adrad quia non possunt non seruire
note.note: i.e. knowledge and worship.

note.gloss: .i. ætgnithi .i. isfollus doib asnoipred fir oirdnithi
note.note: i.e. understood, i.e. it is manifest to them that it is the working of a supreme being.

note.gloss: .i. elimenta .i. adcither asuthine som p.t. ... orum
note.note: i.e. their eternity is perceived.
i.e. they have not shewn the reverence due to God.

note.gloss: Pelagius: recedens a lumine ueritatis .i. ósoilsi etarcni dé
note.note: i.e. from (the) light of (the) knowledge of God.

note.gloss: .i. ní delb adrorsat actiscosmulius delbe ↄd ... diud e ... lann fr ...
note.note: i.e. it is not an image that they have adored, but it is the likeness of an image ......
i.e. so that they offer their bodies ....

note.gloss: Pelagius: inter semet ipsos .i. dum sibi in sacramentís idulorum cauteria et conbustiones infligunt. cauteria .i. aithchumbe
note.note: i.e. brandings.

note.gloss: Pelagius: propter causas commemoratas .i. óre asṅdúil foruigensat nach dúlem
note.note: i.e. because it is the creature which they have served, not the Creator
i.e. each towards another.
i.e. the shamefulness.
i.e. it is to them will be paid the recompense of their sins.
i.e. with every iniquity.

note.gloss: .i. fodordchu .i. non in faciem sed in aure loquentes
note.note: i.e. whisperers.
i.e. slander of a neighbour.
i.e. they are worthy or they are proper.
i.e. O all man, i.e. O every man!
i.e. when thou consentest.

note.gloss: asnolcc quod facit alius [in marg.] .i. qui consentis facien. non quod esset malum corripere alios sed non satis est ad iustitiam sí malus sis (et corripis) malum .i. nam(mi)tter .i. diacairigther et lasse dongní so iarum ... ri essin té ipsum contempnás .i. is follus addrogduinesiu lasse (n)omidter et nocairigther anolcc diacocéitbani
note.note: That quod facit alius is wicked ... i.e. thou judgest him, i.e. if thou reprovest and when thou dost afterwards ....... i.e. it is manifest that thou art a bad man when thou judgest and blamest the evil to which thou consentest.
i.e. punishment.

note.gloss: .i. ní bocomitesti dó acht baléicthi iudici iusto
note.note: i.e. he should not be indulged, but he should be left iudici iusto.
i.e. thou thinkest, or a question.
i.e. is not?

note.gloss: .i. dothudidin domenman doaidgniu dobeir cachmaid duit
note.note: i.e. to lead thy mind to knowledge He giveth thee every good thing.
i.e. they who.

note.gloss: .i. [in marg. l.] Pelagius: quia sancti fulgebunt sicut sól Né putemus eandem esse gloriam didiu uenite rl. honor possedite uel honor filiorum dei per quem angelos fugitiuos iudicabunt
.i. foditiu cech imnid in praesenti oc asgnam gloriae et honoris in futuro
note.note: i.e. endurance of every tribulation in praesenti while striving after glory and honour in futuro.
i.e. tribulation.
i.e. most greatly.

note.gloss: .i. ní na persan ateclimm actisoperum .i. nísnain ciasberat níntánicc recht
note.note: i.e. not of the persons is the acceptance, but it is of the works, i.e. it will not protect them that they say ‘the Law has not come to us.’

note.gloss: .i. amal nád robe mesrugud forsindimmarmus níbia mesrugud forsindígail
note.note: i.e. as there has not been moderation as to the sin, there will not be moderation as to the punishment.
i.e. legal punishment upon them.
i.e. the Law which they have outraged, it is through it they will perish.
a bond.
i.e. their conscience is a witness to them.

note.gloss: .i. imrádat imráti cid maith asdéntí et nertit adénum inmaidsin connessat immurgu ingníim nolcc et arangairet
note.note: i.e. they think thoughts as to what good is to be done, and they encourage the doing of that good thing: they contemn, however, the evil deed and forbid it.

note.gloss: .i. nibamaith rúun occulti hominum in die illa
note.note: i.e. not good will be the secret occulti hominum, etc.

note.gloss: .i. istri ísu predchimse ɫ. iudicabit deus pater per iesum christum .i. ismacc míastar in die iudici ut omne iudicium dedit filio
note.note: i.e. it is through Jesus I preach: uel iudicabit, etc., i.e. it is the Son who will judge in die, etc.
i.e. thou dost not trust thyself with any one else.
i.e. denial of God.
i.e. thou dishonourest.

note.gloss: Pelagius: dicis té beatum quod noueris dei uoluntatem dum sensum legis qui de christi incarnatione est praeteriris deum inhonoras ɫ. isindí nadcreitid christum quem praedicat léx
note.note: in that ye believe not Christ, etc.

note.gloss: .i. aingid imdibe arbibdamnact rectto arbabibdu báis leusom intí nád imdibthe
note.note: i.e. circumcision protects from the condemnation of the Law, for with them he who is not circumcised was guilty of death.

note.gloss: .i. rúna rechto ut léx profetauit christum
note.note: i.e. mysteries of the Law ut, etc.
i.e. it is the same as not circumcised.
i.e. the non-circumcision.
i.e. whosoever he be that may have iustitia Legis.
i.e. it is the same to him as though he were circumcised.

note.gloss: .i. ditróscibea a iudidi .i. bid ferr oldái
note.note: i.e. he will surpass thee, O Jew, that is, he will be better than thou art.
i.e. in presence of every one.

note.gloss: .i. a iudeis .i. nitorbe do animdibe adchi cách
note.note: i.e. no profit to him is the circumcision which every one sees.

note.gloss: .i. másu and is amplius inimdibiu quae utilitas rl. [in marg. at vv. 28–29 of chap. ii.] Ní fortorbe nimdibi tra dotéit som act is formolad iudeorum
note.note: i.e. if it is therein that it is amplius, in circumcision, quae utilitas, etc.? So he (Paul) touches, not upon the profit of circumcision, but upon the praise of the Jews.

note.gloss: multum .i. is indil asferr iudeus quam gentilis frecre inso dar cenn ind iudidi dongeintlidiu
note.note: i.e. it is greatly that Judaeus is better than Gentilis: this is an answer on behalf of the Jew to the Gentile.
i.e. for why?
i.e. our sins.
i.e. so that He is the more righteous.
i.e. in my evil.
if veritas Dei be the greater.
i.e. why is a sinner made of me?

note.gloss: .i. cani amal non ǽicndichtherni .i. iscosmil nade isamlid
note.note: i.e. is it not as we are slandered? i.e. it is like, nay, it is so.
i.e. as they say of us.

note.gloss: [in marg.] dicire .i. asmberamni .i. líit fornn aépirt sicut paulus dixit ubi habundauit peccatum superhabundauit gratái, etc.
note.note: i.e. that we say, i.e. they accuse us of saying it.

note.gloss: .i. ni derscigem nech dialailiu bit bibdid huili
note.note: i.e. we do not excel each the other: they all will be guilty.
i.e. for all the Gentiles.

note.gloss: .i. doracartmar cois caích niferr nech alailiu and
note.note: we have argued the cause of every one, none is better than another therein.
i.e. being without wisdom causes un-righteousness.

note.gloss: .i. huaire nád riarfact furuar buid cenengne etcenfírinni
note.note: i.e. since he has not sought Him it has produced the state of being without understanding and without righteousness.
i.e. because they have not sought after God.
i.e. without exception.

note.gloss: cid cossin nóin ɫ. cosin nóin .i. co crist ar nifarnic sede nach maid arachiun isindomun
note.note: as much as one (ἕως ἑνός), or until the one, that is, until Christ, for He found not anyone good before Him in the world.
i.e. instead of the stony so that it is a spiritual circumcision and not destruction of (the) Law.
he is our father according to the flesh, quia, etc.

note.gloss: .i. islúud leu teistiu fuile ut gentes, etc.
note.note: i.e. they have an impulse to pour out blood ut gentes, etc.
i.e. destruction.
i.e. they deem it a misfortune to every one (else) although the misfortune of it is (really) their own.

note.gloss: .i. connách moidea nech arbed áarilliud nod nícad
note.note: i.e. so that no one may boast that his merit saved him.
i.e. into bodies and souls peccatorum.
i.e. it is through belief in Jesus Christ that every one is righteous.

note.gloss: [in marg. l.] .i. altum quod non sapitur .i. isósib atá
note.note: i.e. it is over them He is.

note.gloss: .i. per fidem solam .i. hires creitme iesu christi
note.note: i.e. the faith of belief in Jesus Christ.

note.gloss: .i. ishésom doradchiúir ⁊ ishé dano astaidchricc .i. per sanguinem
note.note: i.e. it is He that has redeemed and it is He also that is (the) ransom.

note.gloss: .i. arrudérged írúnaib innadeacte ut propitietur eís qui credunt sé sanguine eius libiratos esse
note.note: i.e. it has been set forth in the mysteries of the Godhead ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. trihiris incháich cretes áhíc tria fuil
note.note: i.e. through the faith of every one who believes in his salvation through His blood.
i.e. thou hast nothing for thee to boast in.
i.e. through deeds of (the) Law.
i.e. no: i.e. it is the same as though it were not boasting.
i.e. it is through it that gloriatio is.

note.gloss: .i. numquid solós creauit nonné omnes creauit homines frecre inso do menma(in) iudeorum
note.note: i.e. numquid, etc., an answer, this, to (the) mind Iudaeorum.

note.gloss: .i. isnesa dogeintib .i. quia ante legem sancti deo placuerunt ut ábial, séth, enóc, nóe
note.note: i.e. He is nearer to Gentiles, i.e. quia, etc., ut Abel, Seth, Enoch, Noah.

note.gloss: .i. ciasbiursa deus iudeorum et deus gentium unus est deus rl.
note.note: i.e. though I say Deus, etc.
i.e. of him who believes without material circumcision.
i.e. do we destroy? i.e. quando, etc.
i.e. we destroy not.

note.gloss: .i. dum probamus uerum esse quod promissit ut dabo uobís (cor) carnium .i. tarési lapidei condid imdibe spirtálde et ni ... coscrad legis
note.note: i.e. instead of the stony so that it is a spiritual circumcision and not destruction of (the) Law.

note.gloss: .i. secundum circumcisionem carnis ɫ. ishé arnathir iarcolinn quia de genere abrachae fuerunt
note.note: he is our father according to the flesh, quia, etc.
i.e. it is through faith that he has been justified, not through deeds of the Law.

note.gloss: .i. mad fochricc som nípa deoladacht acht bid fiach istrideoladacht didiu ronóibad ní archomalnad recto
note.note: i.e. if it is a payment it will not be grace, but it will be a debt: it is through grace, then, that he has been sanctified, not for fulfilling (the) Law.
to him that believes.
i.e. his faith justifies him.
i.e. it is gratis, not per opera.
i.e. blessed is their life.
i.e. it abides not, i.e. as regards Abraham

note.gloss: .i. cain ronóibad abracham trihiris intree ǽm didiu fanacc
note.note: i.e. hath not Abraham been sanctified through faith? is it through it then indeed or not?
i.e. is it when he has been in circumcisione?

note.gloss: .i. inintain rombói in praeputio [in marg.] Isderb linn is ní nimdibiu atruirmed hiresche do
note.note: i.e. is it when he has been in praeputio? We are sure that it is not in circumcision that faith has been imputed to him.

note.gloss: .i. ↄrobad innachorp ní inchoissised tóbe uitiorum assa anmin
note.note: i.e. so that there might be in his body something to signify (the) excision of vitia from his soul.

note.gloss: .i. recapitulatio de signo .i. inroimdibed intain rofirianiged ahíress
note.note: i.e. has he been circumcised when his faith has been counted as righteousness?
i.e. through noncircumcision.

note.gloss: .i. nidunaibhí fodaimet animdibe colnide tantum manicomolnatar animdibe rúnde uitiorum
note.note: i.e. not unto those who suffer the carnal circumcision tantum unless they fulfil the mystical circumcision of vitia.

note.gloss: acht is athir som innaní techte foirbthetith fidei ut habuit abracham
note.note: but he is father of them that possess perfection fidei ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. dorairngred dano rombad oirdnide achland ut in semine tuo rl.
note.note: i.e. it has been foretold, then, that his children would be distinguished, ut, etc.
i.e. it is through his faith that he has had every good.

note.gloss: .i. iudei filii abrachae .i. matuhé ata horpamin indí rochomalnisset recht
note.note: i.e. if they are heirs who have fulfilled (the) Law.
i.e. which Abraham had before fulfilling (the) Law.

note.gloss: .i. duroilged quod promisum est abrachae .i. possui té patrem rl.
note.note: i.e. quod promissum has been abolished, etc.

note.gloss: .i. arnibiad rath dílgotho et nibiad promisio dosom madtrerecht duairngerthe arisdígal arisdígal manicomollnither side
note.note: i.e. for there would not have been grace of forgiveness and there would not have been promissio to him if it was through (the) Law that the promise was given, for it (the Law) is vengeance, for it is vengeance, unless it be fulfilled.
i.e. it is no transgression of (the) Law unless (the) Law forbid.

note.gloss: .i. non ei qui ex lege .i. óre isdeolid bid fír atairngire
note.note: i.e. because it is a grace the promise will be true.
i.e. if his faith be like unto Abraham’s faith.

note.gloss: .i. ataat danorpe rogab abracham .i. orpe colnide per circumcisionem .i. tír tairngiri et ished rogab isaác etis patersom omnis gentis trisódin et orpe spirtálde trihiriss (et) is pater som multarum gentium triso(d)in
note.note: i.e. there are two heritages which Abraham has obtained, to wit, a carnal heritage per circumcisionem, that is, the Land of Promise,–and it is this that Isaac has obtained, and thereby he is pater omnis gentis–and a spiritual heritage through faith, and thereby he is pater multarum gentium.

note.gloss: Pelagius: non gentis israhelis tantum sed omnium .i. hiressach mundi
note.note: i.e. of (the) faithful ones mundi.
i.e. that Sara would conceive.

note.gloss: .i. ba contra spem dó epert friss rombad pater multarum gentium et difficerunt muliebria sarre et ipse ualde senex fuit sed tamen credidit ut fieret
note.note: i.e. it was contra spem to him that it should be said to him that he should be pater, etc.

note.gloss: .i. nipo lobur ahires cepu friaicned quod dictum est
note.note: i.e. his faith was not weak, though quod dictum est was contrary to nature.
this I deem his temptation.
i.e. for his faith strengthened him to believe.

note.gloss: .i. niarabracham tantum scriptum est hoc testimonium in genessi acht isdiar foirbthetuni roscríbad
note.note: i.e. not for Abraham tantum, etc.; but it is to perfect us that it has been written.
i.e. this is the scriptum.
i.e. that we may follow his customs in fide.
i.e. it is to us.
it is to believe in His Godhead.
i.e. what has been counted unto Abraham, even righteousness through faith.

note.gloss: .i. a persona credentium ut institiam credentium confirmaret .i. isfollus dunni triahesséirgesom asfirdia
note.note: i.e. it is manifest to us through His resurrection that He is very God.

note.gloss: .i. robtar impii omnes ut non est qui faciat bonum rl.
note.note: i.e. they have been impii omnes, etc.

note.gloss: .i. isuix asbiur etní non: nam pro bono
note.note: i.e. it is vix I say and not non.

note.gloss: .i. frisaig .i. attroilli dúnn delegi a nobís .i. dum ausus est quod nullus alius .i. tam facile né illi iniuria sit cum enim aliquid indebite praestatur tunc maxime caritas commendatur ut qualiter sé exhibere debiant recognoscant
note.note: i.e. He commends, i.e. He deserves of us diligi a nobis.

note.gloss: .i. multo magis suos scire non patitur qui semet ipsum pro impio dedit .i. hóre ronsóirni híc a peccatis nostris condanfírianichthi úadib mór ní besnadblamu foir arsóirad ab ira futura
note.note: i.e. since He saved us híc a peccatis nostris, so that we are justified from them, how much readier will He be to save us ab ira futura.

note.gloss: .i. córe fridia per fidem christi etc.
note.note: i.e. peace with God per, etc.
i.e. without warning and without perception.

note.gloss: .i. nipoirgnae ↄtanic lex arba habens humanum genus sub suo dominatu
note.note: i.e. it was not evident till (the) Law came, for it was habens etc.
i.e. though I say non, etc.

note.gloss: .i. frecre inso mentibus heriticorum dicentium sí adæ dilictum non peccantibus nocuit ergo christi iustitia non credentibus prodest
note.note: i.e. this is an answer mentibus, etc.
innumerable.

note.gloss: [in marg.] iudicium .i. tri óenpheccad la adam gratia ex multís dilictís la ísu dodóinib
note.note: iudicium, i.e. (came) through one sin by Adam, gratia ex multis delictis (came) by Jesus for human beings.

note.gloss: .i. hodesid forlán triafoilsigud tri recht tanicc iarum gratia iesu christi eo quod lex neminem ad perfectum rl. [in marg.] Non inputabatur som riam fullus fiadchách indectsa
note.note: i.e. when it (sin) had been superabundantly established through its manifestation by (the) Law, then came gratia, etc. it non imputabatur previously: (it is) manifest before every one now.

note.gloss: .i. ba in mortem paene et corporis
note.note: i.e. it was in mortem poenae, etc.
i.e. it will be in vitam.

note.gloss: .i. istriit atá gratia et ueritas et uita aeterna
note.note: it is through Him is gratia, etc.
i.e. so that it may be the more abundant to us.

note.gloss: .i. a iudeu et a geinti hireschu
note.note: i.e. O Jews and O faithful Gentiles!

note.gloss: .i. iar cosmilius abáis som arincorp marbde frissaroscarsom in passione nifil taidchur do dochum inchoirpsin acht isicorp spirtáldae indeséirgi cenfrescsin báis na hirchri nabíd taidchur dúnni dano donchorp marbdu peccati sicut enim corpus constat ex membrís ita peccatum constat ex uitiis
note.note: i.e. according to the resemblance of His death. For (as to) the mortal body from which He has parted in Passione, there is no return for Him to that body, but it is into the spiritual body of the Resurrection without expectation of death or decay. Let there not, then, be a return for us to the mortal body of peccatam, etc.

note.gloss: .i. intain diagmani fobaithis iscosmulius aadnacuil acus abáis dúnni
note.note: i.e. when we undergo baptism it is a similitude to us of His burial and His death.
i.e. it is therefore that it has been overcome.
i.e. but He will be ever-living.

note.gloss: .i. oinecht appecad amal noinect rombebe colinn crist
note.note: i.e. once out of sin as once Christ’s flesh has died.

note.gloss: .i. isbithbeo corp crist post resurrectionem in gloria dietatis
note.note: i.e. Christ’s body is ever-living post, etc.

note.gloss: .i. adib mairb arainn pecctha badbii immurgu inísu crist
note.note: i.e. ye are dead as regards sin: be ye alive, however, in Jesus Christ.

note.gloss: .i. badbithbíi inísu crist hore adabaill dosom quia ipse uiuus est semper
note.note: i.e. be ye ever-living in Jesus Christ because ye are members of His, quia, etc.
i.e. in your mortal desires which cause death unto you.

note.gloss: .i. combed hed nobed and ubi praedicit qui mortui sumus peccato quomodo iterum uiuemus
note.note: i.e. so that that should be there.
i.e. ye shall not display your members in conflict before the Devil.
i.e. pardon has been given you per gratiam.

note.gloss: .i. sechiphé imdodia imdopheccad madudia .i. doirladugud adibmogæ indísin
note.note: i.e. whosoever it be, whether to God or to sin, if to God, i.e. to obey, ye are servants of Him.
i.e. of poena: that is its reward.
i.e. life eternal, this is its reward.
i.e. I give thanks to God, that though ye were under sin, ye are not.

note.gloss: .i. cibcenél tra diaroscribad indepistil so doadbadar fomáam quoniam dicit serui rl.
note.note: i.e. whatever be (the) nation to which this epistle has been written, it is shewn (to have been) under a yoke quoniam, etc.
i.e. it is not necessity that has constrained you, but it is your desire.

note.gloss: .i. gratia dei .i. ni triib fadéisne sed per deum et per gratiam suam
note.note: i.e. not through yourselves, sed, etc.

note.gloss: quasi dixiset ní dochumacht dúib aforcital forndobcanar rl.
note.note: not feeble to you is the teaching by which ye are taught.
i.e. to every kind of impurity.
i.e. to every kind of iniquity.
i.e. all your members.
i.e. to justify yourselves.

note.gloss: .i. ced ed tra fodeud amal foruigensid dopeccad fognid dofírinni et beded noibde
note.note: i.e. what is it then finally? As ye have served sin serve righteousness, and be sanctified.

note.gloss: .i. isdedbir dúib cidmebul lib ataidmet nam finis rl.
note.note: i.e. it is reasonable that ye should be ashamed to call them to remembrance, nam, etc.
i.e. that will be unto sanctification to you.

note.gloss: [In summo marg.] ɫ. fochricci et ni cumme són ... fri ...... firinne stipendium didiu ainm indlóge doberr domiledaib armílte
note.note: i.e. wages, and not the same (is) that ... righteousness. Stipendium, then, is the name of the pay that is given to soldiers for military service.

note.gloss: .i. trichretim inísu ɫ. isinbeothu itáa ísu iarnesséirgu
note.note: i.e. through belief in Jesus, or in the life wherein Jesus is after resurrection.
i.e. do ye doubt this?

note.gloss: .i. accaldam auctor indrecto inso .i. ismaith intóis éula doaccaldam
note.note: i.e. this (is) an address to the teachers of the Law, i.e. it is good to address the wise folk.
i.e. be it it long, be it it short.
i.e. it is to him (the husband) I compare it (the Law).
i.e. her lawful husband.
i.e. to an unlawful husband.
so that she should be adultera.
i.e. though she be.
i.e. of service.
i.e. it is not adultery for you.
i.e. he joins Himself to them now.

note.gloss: .i. robtar hesid aidmi oipretho pectho intainsin
note.note: i.e. they have been instruments of committing sin then.

note.gloss: .i. in nouo hore nádmair peccad diaforgénsam cose is heside dorárricc báas dúnni
note.note: i.e. in novo, since sin which we have served hitherto remains not: it is this that has caused death to us.
i.e. in a new way of life, after confession of faith, without sin.
i.e. not in the old way of life under sin.
i.e. is it sin? non.
i.e. that it be sin.

note.gloss: .i. isairi asberar lex peccati hóre donadbat pecthu ex persona uiuentis sub lege dicit pelagius peccatum esse non sensi
note.note: i.e. therefore lex peccati is said, because it manifests sins ex persona, etc.

note.gloss: .i. isindectsa rafetarsa aspeccad comaccobor hore adrograd
note.note: i.e. it is now I know it, that concupiscence is sin because it has been forbidden.

note.gloss: .i. mandati .i. ropofochonn gnímo donpeccad a nirgaire
note.note: i.e. the prohibition has been the cause of the doing by sin.
i.e. the mandatum has been violated in it.

note.gloss: .i. ishé inpeccad rogéni anuile comaccobor [in marg.] .i. na comaccobor ararograd irect ragéni peccad in mé et rosariged mandatum legis occa
note.note: i.e. it is sin which has wrought every concupiscence, i.e. any concupiscence which had been forbidden in (the) Law sin has wrought it in me, and the mundatum Legis has been violated in it.

note.gloss: .i. doménarsa ba marb peccad hore nán rairigsiur
note.note: i.e. I thought that sin was dead because I had not perceived it.

note.gloss: .i. doménarsa ropsa beo intain nádrairigsiur peccad ↄdanicc recht
note.note: i.e. I thought that I was alive when I had not perceived sin, till (the) Law came.
i.e. it would have been life to me if I fulfilled it.
i.e. transgressing it has caused death to me.
i.e. I do it after it has been forbidden, i.e. non, etc.

note.gloss: .i. brithemnact inso etfrecre dondi asrobrad quid ergo dicemus rl.
note.note: i.e. a judgment, this, and an answer to that which has been said quid ergo, etc. [c. vii, v. 7].
i.e. is it?

note.gloss: .i. ined fodera báas domsa atimne sainemail sin
note.note: i.e. is what causes death to me that excellent commandment?
i.e. non mandatum which causes death to me.
i.e. it is more after being perceived quam ante.
i.e. in transgression of the commandment of (the) Law sin is committed.

note.gloss: .i. holuid adam tarréir Pelagius: carnaliter uiuere consueui
note.note: i.e. since Adam transgressed (God’s) will.

note.gloss: .i. ab adam ɫ. romrir mothol cholnide condumfel fomám pectho
note.note: i.e. from Adam: or my carnal desire has sold me, so that I am under the yoke of sin.
i.e. from desire of my flesh.
i.e. though if I do it.
i.e. it is not the flesh that he censures, but it is the longing.

note.gloss: .i. ni síratrab act is cuit fresligi
note.note: i.e. not a continual dwelling, but a mere adjacence.

note.gloss: .i. ished aperficire lessom forbe indagimrata centetarcor drogimrato
note.note: i.e. this he deems perficere, the completion of the good intention without interposing an evil intention.

note.gloss: .i. opus tairmthecto et nidiaforbu act iscuitir imraito
note.note: i.e. opus of transgression, but it is with respect to meditation and not to completing it.
the deed carne, etc.
i.e. it is a mere finding however; it gets not leadership.

note.gloss: .i. is suaichnid sund tra asrect maid asmbeir do airiuc túas
note.note: i.e. it is obvious here, then, that it is a good law, which he says above he has found.

note.gloss: .i. issí indainim asairlam dochomalnad recto dé ní incorpp
note.note: i.e. it is the soul that is ready to fulfil God’s law, not the body.
i.e. ready to do evil.

note.gloss: .i. accobor lammenmuin maid doimradud act nandléicci concupiscentia carnalis
note.note: i.e. my mind has a longing to intend good, only that concupiscentia carnalis does not allow it.

note.gloss: .i. isidorus quasi dixiset in lege sua .i. hirect fognamo dopheccad
note.note: i.e. Isidorus: quasi, etc., i.e. in (the) law of service to sin.

note.gloss: .i. ishé gaibes airechas in membris meis
note.note: i.e. it is it (the law of sin) that gets leadership in membris meis.
i.e. (no power,) unless God’s grace should help me: it will do it, however.
i.e. here nor there (i.e. beyond the grave).
i.e. it is they who believe in Jesus.

note.gloss: .i. spiritalis léx .i. doáirci bethid dúnni trichretim inísu crist
note.note: i.e. it causes life to us through belief in Jesus Christ.
i.e. the law of the spirit has delivered me from the law of sin.

note.gloss: .i. mosi istrisuide doárbas peccad trisambí baás
note.note: i.e. (the law) of Moses: ’tis through it has been shown sin through which is death.
i.e. complete accomplishment of that justification.
i.e. into likeness of flesh wherein has been sin.
i.e. in confession of suffering by His flesh.
i.e. any justification which was made in the Law.
i.e. that it might be fulfilled in us.
i.e. it is in that wise we shall be holy.
i.e. for not easy is it (to make) saints of them.
i.e. it is they, however, who shall be saved.

note.gloss: .i. mali uicem reddere issí didiu trebaire chollno cecha dethidnea domundi doimradud cen imradud nanemde
note.note: this then is ‘prudence of the flesh,’ to consider all mundane cares without considering the heavenly.
i.e. it will be life.
i.e. it will be peace towards God.
i.e. it is hatred to God.

note.gloss: .i. atá dethiden fuiri cene .i. imradud inna réte domunde
note.note: i.e. there is care on it, besides, to wit, consideration of the mundane things.

note.gloss: .i. fobésad cech dachpreceptoro molid et álgenigid resíu rocúrsacha
note.note: i.e. according to the practice of every good preceptor, he praises and soothes before he reprimands.
i.e. it is in your power, not base is your life.

note.gloss: .i. isamlid cammaib ataidsi in spiritu et isasse dúib maid do denum
note.note: i.e. it is thus, however, that ye are, in spiritu, and it is easy for you to do good.
i.e. that it may not commit sin.

note.gloss: .i. ciabeid crist indibsi trefóisitin hirisse in babtismo et isbeo indanim trisodin is marb incorp immurgu trisnasenpecthu cerudglanta tribathis níta cumacc do cháingním condid diusgea inspirut nóib
note.note: i.e. though Christ be in you through confession of faith in baptismo, and the soul is thereby alive, the body nevertheless is dead through the old sins. Though it should have been cleansed through baptism, it is not able to do well until the Holy Spirit awake it.
i.e. for that guest-house of the Spirit will not be base.

note.gloss: .i. nitat pecthi collnidi híccatar and indechtso cebtar hé riam
note.note: i.e. it is not fleshly sins which are paid for there now, though it was they before.

note.gloss: .i. congnemmis gnímu colno ut ante fecimus
note.note: that we should do the deeds of flesh ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. cenutad suíre dlegtir féich dúib et dún huili atcomlasom friu ardislemnethu de dohícc innafíach
note.note: though ye are at ease(?), debts are owed by you and by us all. He adds himself to them that they may be the willinger to pay the debts.

note.gloss: .i. báas péne .i. ɫ. quando caro moritur
note.note: i.e. a penal death.
i.e. killing them therefore were not regrettable.

note.gloss: .i. uita aeterna .i. bidsamlid bid bidbethu mamarbitir facta carnis
note.note: i.e. thus it will be life eternal if facta carnis be slain.

note.gloss: .i. conirchloiter .i. madhé áluum ut di filio dicitur agebatur a spiritu
note.note: i.e. are driven, i.e. if He be their pilot, ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. ished inso didiu testimonium quod sumus
note.note: i.e. this then is the testimonium, etc.
i.e. so that we may part His heritage with Christ.

note.gloss: .i. qui similis ei erimus .i. isamlid bamicoeheredes máconfodmam amal crist uel cum Christo uel inuicem
note.note: i.e. it is thus we shall be co-heirs if we suffer together like Christ, vel, etc.

note.gloss: .i. indindocbál doratad docrist condartar dúnni less ut scimus quoniam cum apparuerit similis ei erimus
note.note: i.e. the glory which has been given to Christ that it may be given to us by Him. ut, etc.
i.e. that it is expectation in which it (the creature) is.
i.e. unless for necessity.
i.e. to serve filiis Dei.
i.e. for it is in invisible things that spes is wont to be.
i.e. for that which the eye sees is not hope.
i.e. needful is patience in it.

note.gloss: [in marg.] isand didiu fortéit spiritus arnénirtini intain bes ninun accobor lenn .i. lacorp et anim et laspirut. coir irnigde tra inso act níchumcamni ón mani thinib inspirut. isamlid tra islobur arnirnigde ni matréte frecndirci gesme et ninfortéitni inspirut ocsuidiu ished didiu forthéit inspirut intain guidmeni inducbáil diarcorp et diarnanimm iarnesséirgiu
note.note: so it is then that Spiritus helps our weakness when we have the same desire, to wit, body and soul and spirit. This, then, is the right way of prayer, but we cannot do that unless the Spirit inspire it: thus then our prayer is feeble if they be present things which we ask, and the Spirit helps us not herein: then doth the Spirit help when we beseech glory for our body and for our soul after resurrection.

note.gloss: .i. (ferid inne)tirchorsa inspirut nóib is heside as eola
note.note: i.e. the Holy Spirit makes this intercession, it is He that knows.

note.gloss: .i. qui enarrari non possunt .i. nád ↄtagad inaisndis sed occulta conpungtione cordis
note.note: i.e. which ...... in speech sed, etc.

note.gloss: .i. asbeirsom anaccobor donspirut hóre doninfet anaccobor donduini
note.note: i.e. he ascribes the desire to the Spirit, because It inspires the desire to man.

note.gloss: .i. aní asmaith ladia doguidi ished tinfetsom dianóibaib
note.note: i.e. that which God would have (us) pray for is that with which He inspires His saints.

note.gloss: .i. quaecumque fecerimus propter dilectionem dei .i. dí sóinmechaib et dóinmechaib
note.note: i.e. of prosperous things and calamitous.
i.e. we shall have glory for it.
i.e. these whom.

note.gloss: Pelagius: primogenitus ex mortuis et in gloria primgeinde som dohireschaib inheséirgiu et ináiritiu indocbále
note.note: first-born (is) He of the faithful in resurrection and in the reception of glory

note.gloss: .i. isuisse asercc dorat mór dimaid duún
note.note: i.e. it is just to love Him: He has given us much of good.

note.gloss: .i. hóre attá innarleid cia conicc ní dúun isfollus ispro nobís ní contra
note.note: i.e. because He is with us, who can do aught unto us? It is manifest He is pro nobis not contra.
i.e. He was not dear to Him in our case(?).

note.gloss: .i. ni ar oénfer na diis rocess sed pro omnibus cerudbói iudas etcerudbatar iudei occathindnaculsom nímariccfed manitindnised intathir nemde
note.note: i.e. not for one man or two did He suffer, but pro omnibus. Though Judas was, and though Iudaei were, delivering Him up, it would not have succeeded had not the heavenly Father given Him.

note.gloss: .i. india indoichside do náde nídoich ar qui iustificat isdochu do quam contempnere
note.note: i.e. is it God? is it likely of Him? nay, (it is) not likely, for qui iustificat is more likely to do that (iustificare) quam contemnere.
i.e. who will contemn God’s elect?

note.gloss: .i. inísu crist .i. imba immalei do occartaithchricc et occarnáinsem náte níbahed nisí arsercc less
note.note: i.e. is it Jesus Christ? i.e. will He be at the same time redeeming us and accusing us? Not so: it will not be that: that is not the love He hath for us.

note.gloss: .i. isnessa doinni lemm oldaas bidarnáinsem .i. díarfírianugudni són ní diarnáinsem
note.note: i.e. I deem it nearer to the meaning than should be our accusation, i.e. to our justification (is) that, not to our accusation.
i.e. He hath taken his station.

note.gloss: .i. doetarcuirethar .i. indóinecht araróit som ónni ferid itge frissindeacht arnachérbalamni
note.note: i.e. intercedes, i.e. the Manhood which He hath assumed from us makes prayer to the Godhead that we perish not.
i.e. as he (Paul) has proved it.

note.gloss: .i. ammi irlaim hicachláo do dul martre
note.note: i.e. we are ready every day to go to martyrdom.

note.gloss: .i. isdílmain lacách arnorcunni Pelagius: non licet nós defendere
note.note: i.e. every one thinks himself free to slay us.

note.gloss: .i. praesens nobís promísa .i. angelus mentiri quam separatio mea .i. isdochu indalanái oldaas anaill
note.note: i.e. one of the two (an angel lying, my separation from Christ) is likelier than the other.
i.e. the rank that is lower than angels.

note.gloss: issruith indairm indid epiur quia membrum christi sum
note.note: venerable is the place wherein I say it, quia, etc.
i.e. my conscience deceives me not, for it is in the Holy Spirit that I attest it.
i.e. I grieve that you are without belief.

note.gloss: .i. ishósiun conuie dam farsercc obtabam enim rl.
note.note: i.e. it is from old to new that I have had love for you, optabam, etc.
i.e. a captive.

note.gloss: .i. israhelitarum .i. doróigu dia immaccu do ut est primogenitus meus israhel
note.note: i.e. whom God hath chosen as sons of His, ut est, etc.
i.e. of whom are the fathers of the men who are nunc.
i.e. it is impossible to contemn them, (for) Christ is (sprung) from them.
i.e. it is He who is the chief of all.
i.e. He is God, blessed for ever.
i.e. the whole of them are not Israelites.

note.gloss: .i. innahí rochinset hosíl abrache nitat huili itmaicc tairngiri
note.note: i.e. those who have descended from Abraham’s seed, the whole of them are not children of (the) promise.

note.gloss: .i. is ho isaác dofuisémthar asíl nairegde non inismaíl
note.note: i.e. it is from Isaac will be begotten the chief seed, not in Ishmael.

note.gloss: .i. ut ismáil et increduli israhelite .i. nigebat incomarbus hóre nandat filii promisionis
note.note: i.e. they will not take the inheritance because they are not filii promissionis.
i.e. at the end of a space.
i.e. of one seed have been born two sons of him.

note.gloss: [in marg. ɫ.] propossitum .i. intairdérgud arrudérgestar dia togu indalanái per misericordiam damnad alaili per debitum iudicium
note.note: i.e. the purpose which God hath purposed, to choose one of the twain per misericordiam, to condemn the other per debitum iudicium.
i.e. he who is elder, i.e. Esau.

note.gloss: .i. per debitum iudicium ar ba miscuis atroillisset diblínaib manithised trocaire .i. non natura hodit
note.note: i.e. per debitum iudicium, for it was hatred which they both had deserved if mercy had not come thereto.

note.gloss: .i. hóre doroigu indalafer cenairilliud et romiscsigestar alaile, indoich bid indirge dodia insin
note.note: i.e. because He hath chosen one of the two men without desert and hath hated the other, is it likely that that would be unrighteousness to God?
i.e. nay, He is not unjust!
i.e. I shall be free as regards my word.
i.e. He pities whomsoever He pleases.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. nitorbe doneuch anaccobor manithobrea dia do anaccobor similiter neque currentis intí dianairchissi dia isdo istorbe
note.note: i.e. the desire is no profit to any one unless God give him the desire: similiter, etc., he whom God spareth, to him is profit.

note.gloss: .i. dothabairt díglae foir nípo dia airchissecht
note.note: i.e. to inflict punishment upon him, it was not to spare him.
i.e. through inflicting punishment upon him.

note.gloss: .i. apersin innaní asbeirtis ni neich inpeccad ni dlig dígail arní asse tuidecht fritoil dé .i. hóre is cui uult rl. ni linni didiu atá
note.note: i.e. in the person of those who used to say sin is no one’s: he deserves not punishment, for resistance to God’s will is not easy, that is, because it is cui vult, etc., not with us then is it.

note.gloss: .i. cia tussu díxnigedar .i. cid nombetha im etarceirt amessa imdia
note.note: i.e. who art thou? i.e. on what account shouldst thou be about disputing his judgment with God?
i.e. to him who has formed it.
i.e. not well hast thou made me.
i.e. it is carefully he has made one of the two vessels.
i.e. it is more carelessly that he makes the other.
though He be desirous.

note.gloss: .i. adroneestar .i. nifochetóir dorat digail foraib cepued adroilliset
note.note: i.e. He has endured, i.e. it is not at once that He hath inflicted punishment upon them, although they had deserved it.
i.e. (they were) proper to have punishment (inflicted) upon them.

note.gloss: .i. níarmaith friu arforchelta act is corpad mithig lessom inducbál dianóibaib
note.note: i.e. it is not for good to them that they have been cared for, but it is until He should deem timely (the) glory for His saints.
i.e. those for whom He has intended mercy.
i.e. their salvation, though they deserved it not.

note.gloss: .i. nípat hé indíi betathuicsi diiudeib nammá beite isindinducbáil sin acht bieit cit geinti hiressich. tairchechuin farmbráthir fadisin ossæ áiudeiu airitiu et togu geinte
note.note: i.e. it will not be they who shall be chosen from the Jews only who will be in that glory: but there will be even faithful Gentiles. Your own brother Hosea, O (ye) Jews, foretold (the) reception and election of (the) Gentiles.

note.gloss: .i. dogéntar (toich) diétoich and .i. bid tuad domsa monebthuad
note.note: i.e. rightful shall be made there of unrightful, that is, my non-people shall be a people unto me.

note.gloss: .i. isindairmm .i. scripturae ɫ. uocabitur ɫ. nipa farnainmsi bias forib .i. plebs dei
note.note: i.e. in the place, i.e. etc., it will not be your name that shall be upon them, i.e. plebs Dei.

note.gloss: .i. geinti narbo pleps dei cosse bit filii dei anainm indectso ní dígu anme són ǽm
note.note: i.e. gentiles who were not plebs Dei hitherto: their name now will be filii Dei: that, truly, is not an unchoice name.

note.gloss: .i. acaltam geinte inso .i. doarchet do israhel húathad ṅdóine dochretim diib cit sochudi
note.note: i.e. this is an address to gentiles, i.e. it had been foretold to Israel that of them, though they are multitudes, few persons would believe.

note.gloss: .i. cit sochudi bid huathad creitfes diib
note.note: i.e. though they are multitudes, it will be few of them that will believe.

note.gloss: .i. bieid nach dréct diib hícfider cinbathuili articfea indsom briathar foirbthigedar induine indírgi cáingníma
note.note: i.e there will be some portion of them that will be saved, though it be not all, for into it will come the Word which perfects man in righteousness of well-doing.
i.e. they who shall so believe, it will be in righteousness (that they shall believe).
i.e. he prophesied before it came to pass.
i.e. we should perish and none of us should remain(?).

note.gloss: .i. níarilset geinti afírianugud tadbat som tra darect et difírinni infra
note.note: i.e. the Gentiles have not deserved to be justified: he shows forth, then, two laws and two righteousnesses infra.
i.e. it is not (the) righteousness of (the) Law.
i.e. the works of the Law they deem enough to justify them.
they struck many blows against it.

note.gloss: .i. as nomen do crist lapis offensionis
note.note: i.e. that lapis offensionis is a nomen for Christ.

note.gloss: .i. in belzefuth [in marg.] isbéss didu indliacc berir ilbeim friss et intí dothuit foir ↄboing achnámi intí foratuitsom immurgu atbail side síc christus lapis angularis
note.note: i.e. the Belzebub: it is the manner, then, of the stone that many blows are given to it, and he who falls upon it breaks his bones: he, however, on whom it falls, he perishes: sic Christus, etc.

note.gloss: .i. níceilsom tra asné crist inlie asrubart
note.note: i.e. so he conceals not that Christ is the stone he has mentioned.

note.gloss: .i. frigenti asbeir som anisiu arnatomnitis nád carad som iudeiu etnad duthrised anícc
note.note: i.e. unto the Gentiles he says this, lest they should think that he did not love Jews and did not desire their salvation.
i.e. this is my prayer unto God.
i.e. that God might save them.
i.e. proper were prayer for them: piteous were their perishing.

note.gloss: .i. bid fírian cach oén creitfess hí crist
note.note: i.e. just will every one be who shall believe in Christ.
i.e. guilty under (the) Law.
i.e. he says, what may be the righteousness (which is) of faith?
i.e. to ask for other testaments.

note.gloss: .i. proprium pauli .i. dobeir pól gluáis fortestimin nafetarlicce
note.note: i.e. Paul puts a gloss on the text of the Old Law.
i.e. it is not necessary: He hath come already.

note.gloss: .i. ní ecen athodiusgud asreracht cene a mortuis, islour dún didiu creitem incholnichtho et esséirgi
note.note: i.e. it is not necessary to arouse Him: He has already arisen a mortuis: it is enough for us, then, to believe in Incarnation and Resurrection.
i.e. if it is quis ascendit? i.e. if it is a doubt.
i.e. Christ is at hand with His gospel.
i.e. to Gentiles after His coming.
i.e. therefore it is prope.
i.e. belief in the heart maketh a man righteous (or, a righteous man).

note.gloss: .i. indfoisitiu ingiun imfolngi induine slán istrissandedesin biid duine slán etfírian combi bidslán et bidfírian
note.note: i.e. the confession in the mouth maketh the man sound (or, a sound man). Through those twain it is that a man is sound and righteous (or, that there is a man sound and righteous), so ever-sound and ever-righteous.

note.gloss: .i. apersin indiudidi asbeirsom anisiu magthad lasuidiu cretem do geintib hóre nadtairchechnatar fáthi doib
note.note: i.e. in the person of the Jew he saith this: they marvel that the Gentiles believed, because prophets have not prophesied to them.
i.e. the teachers.
i.e. they have not been sent to them at all.
i.e. it is of those teachers it has been said.

note.gloss: .i. is hecen sainecoscc leosom for accrannaib innaní prechite pacem et immechuretar cori horígaib aranepertar isdoimmarchor chóre dotíagat indfirso signum són araroib saingné fornaib gnímaib inna preceptore
note.note: i.e. they deem it necessary (to have) a special appearance on the sandals of those that preach pacem and carry peace from kings, so that it may be said: ‘it is on an errand of peace that these men come.’ That is a signum that there should be a special form on the deeds of the teachers.
i.e. of those who preach mysteria divina.

note.gloss: .i. ní sochude rochretti doneuch rochualammarni huaitsiu adé sechra pridchaisem dochách aliter doneuch rochuale cách huanni
note.note: i.e. not many have believed what we have heard from Thee, O God, although we have preached it to every one; aliter, what every one has heard from us.

note.gloss: .i. canigóo dúib si anasberid aiudeu conicloitis geinti tairchital crist nate rachualatar
note.note: i.e. is it not a lie of yours what ye say, O Jews? that (the) Gentiles could not hear prophesying of Christ? Nay, they have heard it!
i.e. save that (Israel) conceals it.

note.gloss: Pelagius: gentes esse uocandas ad fidem .i. isáiniu dúibsi anasbiursa rafitir cid israhel cretim dogeintib
note.note: i.e. it is nobler for you what I say, Israel knows it also, that the Gentiles would believe.
i.e. your own leader says it at first.
i.e. O Jews!

note.gloss: [in marg.] in hétt .i. bid héet libsi geinti dobith inhiris ɫ. do intamil .i. atasamlibid si ináiritiu hirisse
note.note: into jealousy, i.e. ye will be jealous that (the) Gentiles are in (the) faith. Or to imitate, that is, ye will imitate them in receiving (the) faith.

note.gloss: .i. hinephchenéil .i. napochenéel domsa cosse ante quam crederet
note.note: i.e. into a no-kindred, that is, which was not a kindred of mine hitherto ante quam crederet.

note.gloss: .i. ro laimetharside epirt neich quia non timet populum iudeorum
note.note: i.e. he (Esaias) ventures to say anything, quia, etc.

note.gloss: .i. dochoscc innanisrahélde asbeir som aní siu arnachamóidet cid doib doarrchet
note.note: i.e. to correct the Israelites he says this, that they may not boast though they were prophesied unto.
i.e. that is your name.

note.gloss: .i. isfollus isindí nachimrindarpaise noch ǽm amísrahélde
note.note: i.e. it is manifest in that He has not cast me away, although indeed I am an Israelite.
i.e. that is my clan’s stock.
i.e. he of them who should believe.

note.gloss: .i. innádcualaidsi ageinti in librís regum ubi scriptum est de helia
note.note: i.e. have ye not heard, O Gentiles! in libris, etc?
i.e. to inflict punishment upon them.
this is a slandering of his folk to God.

note.gloss: .i. rumúgsat ɫ. rocechladatar etdorigéensat adrad hídal and
note.note: i.e. they have smothered, or they have dug, and they have worshipt idols there.

note.gloss: .i. nifil nech and occtadrad so acht meisse móinur
note.note: i.e. there is no one therein a-worshipping Thee save me alone.
i.e. that even this one should not he at it.
i.e. to worship me.
i.e. not thou alone, though thou say it.
i.e. to worship Baal.
i.e. if it is grace, works have not preceded.
i.e. ye say, why do I say it to thee?
i.e. if works go before it, sed drbitum.

note.gloss: .i. intí dorroigu dia per gratiam non per opera legis ut gentes
note.note: i.e. He whom God has elected per gratiam, etc.
i.e. they attained not truth through grace.

note.gloss: .i. interioris hominis .i. roléiced anintliucht foaréir fadésne et nifarmaid rosnuicc
note.note: i.e. their reason has been left under their own control, and it has not brought them to good.
i.e. to (the) day of Paul or to (the) day of their death.
i.e. even David conceals it not.
i.e. the altar whereon offering is made to idols.
i.e. of punishment.
i.e. bow (dorsum) down, O God!

note.gloss: .i. combad tothim cen éirge nobed and absit ni tha diaméit
note.note: i.e. that falling without rising should be there? absit: it is not so great.

note.gloss: .i. cair insí ameit friscomartatar condositis huili a fide christi? non; donertad iude tra in so lessom
note.note: i.e. query, have they offended so greatly that all should fall a fide Christi? Non: to strengthen the Jews, then, this he hath.

note.gloss: .i. isairi doroigu dia geinti hore nárbubae laiudeu creitem act doroigatar ancretim
note.note: i.e. therefore hath God chosen the Gentiles because the Jews liked not belief but chose unbelief.
i.e. of the people of the Gentiles.
i.e. these are the mundus above (mentioned).
i.e. if it were all (the Jews) and not the apostles only.
i.e. because it is to you I preach.
i.e. it is I that am (the) apostle of (the) Gentiles.
i.e. in whatsoever manner I may be able to do it.
i.e. my fleshly kindred.

note.gloss: .i. trisinintamail sin .i. combad ǽt leu buid domsa iniriss et duús in intamlitis
note.note: i.e. through that imitation, that is, so that they may have emulation of my being in (the) faith, and if perchance they might imitate.

note.gloss: .i. imforling hícc ambeicc rochreti ab illís
note.note: i.e. it has wrought (the) salvation of the few of them that believed ab illis.

note.gloss: ɫ. uita .i. bíi in hiris ex mortuis .i. in peccato antea
note.note: i.e. alive in faith ex, etc.
i.e. the first-fruit.
i.e. the whole folk.
i.e. of the fruitful olive-tree.

note.gloss: .i. ó gentiles .i. nolí gaudere quod illi fracti sunt in perditione hore isnanaicci atái
note.note: since it is near them that thou art.

note.gloss: .i. is inse ṅduit nitú nodnai(l) acht ishé not ail
note.note: i.e. it is impossible for thee; it is not thou that nourishest it, but it that nourishes thee.

note.gloss: .i. adsumit persona gentilis indoich epert detsiu isairi ↄnabrúi(thea) ingésci . . dag dula det . . taranési
note.note: perchance thou mayest say, that therefore the branches have been broken that thou mayest go in their place.

note.gloss: .i. cani airi .i. badochu lem són is(hed) rombod doib
note.note: i.e. is it not for this? i.e. that seems to me more likely, that is why it was ill with them.

note.gloss: .i. quia gratis et non secundum meritum insertus es .i. bacoscc carat limm dit agentlidi níptha labar et nípadro(mór) notbocctha et armtairismech inhiris
note.note: i.e. it were a friend’s advice for thee, O Gentile, thou shouldst not be talkative(?), and thou shouldst not boast overmuch, and that thou shouldst be constant in faith.

note.gloss: .i. arnachitrindarpither frisinfírini per superbiam amal indclaínn bunid
note.note: i.e. lest thou be cast away from the righteousness per superbiam, like the original clan.

note.gloss: .i. indat iudei itirroscar(sat) fri hiris nabarche
note.note: i.e. who are(?) Iudaei who have separated from Abraham’s faith.

note.gloss: .i. cani doich ɫ. coníecmi nádnairchissa act iscoarcessea
note.note: i.e. is it not likely? or that it may not happen that He spare not, but it is that He may spare?
i.e. it is thus that it will be bonitas tibi.
i.e. better is (thy) mind towards Him.

note.gloss: .i. nipadíless duit aní hitái mani cáinairlither
note.note: i.e. that in which thou art will not belong to thee, unless thou take good heed.
i.e. maybe they may attain that out of which they have been cut.
i.e. for God can do it.
i.e. after their severance.

note.gloss: .i. cosmulius tra dombeir som híc aris bésad leusom infid dothóbu etfid aile do esnid and
note.note: i.e. a similitude, then, which he puts here, for they have a custom to cut a tree and to insert another tree therein.
i.e. it were more natural for them to be there.
i.e. they have learned to be there.

note.gloss: [in summo marg.] .... nu dubgoithesi ... bad ... ba inárpitissom
.i. isdreecht díib nadrochreit etmuscreitfet cithésidi. Aliter cecitas .i. burpe ex parte .i. o aimsir bicc ex parte contigit .i. tempore tantum ut Pelagius
note.note: i.e. it is a portion of them that have not believed, and even they will soon believe. Aliter caecitas, i.e. stupidity, ex parte, i.e. for a little time.

note.gloss: .i. ↄríctar huili genti ɫ. drécht caichceniúil
note.note: i.e. till all the Gentiles are saved, or a portion of every nation.
i.e. that Israel will be saved.

note.gloss: .i. dosnicfa cobir cidmall bithmaith immurgu intain dondiccfa
note.note: i.e. help will come to them, though it be slow: it will, however, be good when it will so come.

note.gloss: .i. gentiles nímcharatsa indfir hore pridchim soscele dogentib
note.note: i.e. gentiles. The men love me not because I preach (the) gospel to Gentiles.

note.gloss: .i. itcarit domsa immurgu .i. noscarimse iscland tuicse dodia
note.note: i.e. they are friends of mine, however, that is, I love them, it is a clan chosen unto God.
i.e. forgiveness of sin.
i.e. what He has promised He will not repent of.

note.gloss: .i. robói aimser nadrochreitsid ↄdubtanicc misericordia dei
note.note: i.e. there was a time that ye have not believed, until misericordia Dei came unto you.
i.e. they have denied and have crucified Christ.

note.gloss: .i. bid missericordia dano dodaessarrsom nípa meritum ɫ. opus legis intain creitfite
note.note: i.e. it will be misericordia then that will save them when they shall believe: it will not be meritum or opus Legis.

note.gloss: [in marg.] conclusit Pelagius inuenit omnia in incredulitate Pelagius non uí sed ratione .i. arduetarrid .i. nitella doneuch and moidem aarilte ↄdarícc missericordia dei
note.note: i.e. for He seized, i.e. there is no room for any one there to boast of his merits, so that misericordia Dei has saved them.

note.gloss: .i. isfudumuin indrúnso ícc indomuin et omnium hominum per misericordiam iarsindí batir inricci dubáas huili
note.note: i.e. profound is this mystery, the salvation of the world et omnium, etc., after they all were worthy of death.
i.e. no one knows them.

note.gloss: [in marg.] Ceist cateet diuitiae sund et sapientiae et scientiae et cateet inscrutabilia iudicia et cateet inuestigabiles uiae et cate sensus Domini; nianse isdo tiagait indrétaisin huili dont lathur diasndísiu robói hirúnaib innadeacte octuiste dúile hitossuch. ní asse linn ǽm léim dindbéstatu etdind tinchosc innandóine foraisṅdíis di thuiste dúile ismenand isdindinsci riam lenid etished adamrigethar híc fudumne indfiss hoarícc dia ácenele ṅdoine per misericordiam
.i. nímchubandom attach trócaire frib istree rob hícad
note.note: i.e. (it is) not much trouble to me to entreat mercy from you(?): it is through it that ye have been saved.

note.gloss: .i. castam et alienam a peccato .i. ab omnibus uitiís aris irlam indanim do thuil dée todiusgadar dana indanim dodénum maith
note.note: for the soul is ready to (do) God’s will: let the soul, then, be roused to do good.

note.gloss: .i. ut (o)pperabatur in lege ante ostium templi cenchaile nachdatho cenchaile pectho
note.note: i.e. ut, etc., without a spot of any colour, without a spot of sin.
i.e. let every prayer that ye make in God’s will be lawful (rationabile).

note.gloss: .i. renouate sensum .i. padglicc far nintliucht non ut fuit ante
note.note: i.e. let your mind be astute, non, etc. i.e. God’s will, then, is this, that is this triad, i.e. bona, etc., and it is the same as the triad which he has mentioned before, i.e. hostia, etc.

note.gloss: .i. issí thol dée didiú anísiu .i. átredeso .i. bona et placens et perfecta et isinunn et atréde remiérbart .i. hostia uiua et sancta et placabilis rl.
.i. ished aplús sapere lessom na ní ararogartsom madugnether ished immurgu asapere ad prudentiam cach réit ararogartsom donebdénum et aforchongair dochomalnad
note.note: i.e. this is the plus sapere according to him, if anything which he has forbidden should be done: this, however, is the sapere ad prudentiam, to avoid doing anything which he has forbidden and to fulfil what he orders.
i.e. as He gives it to every one according to his faith.

note.gloss: .i. Non potest enim uisus nisi in occulís fieri et rl. .i. óingním immurgu immefolngat omnia membra .i. óintimthrecht
note.note: i.e. a single work, however, omnia membra perform, that is, a single service.

note.gloss: .i. ammi corp docrist etiscenn som duunni
note.note: i.e. we are a body to Christ, and He is a head to us.
i.e. sunt, i.e. every one severally.
i.e. est, i.e. every one is a member to another.

note.gloss: .i. ished fodera in inchongnam sin huaire issain dán cáich
note.note: i.e. it is this that causes that mutual co-operation, because every one’s gift is different.

note.gloss: .i. amal rombói cuit cáich dinrath diadu
note.note: i.e. as has been each one’s portion of the divine grace.
i.e. different (is) every one’s gift.

note.gloss: .i. bad iárṅdligud hirisse .i. ut non seodoprofete qui trans fidem profetabant
note.note: i.e. be it according to (the) rule of faith, non ut etc.
i.e. let it be in ministry, that is, in oboedientia to every one.

note.gloss: .i. robo intí forchain .i. unusquisque in quo uoca(tus est) rl. ɫ. precept dochách .i. hominibus post babtisma .i. bad hiforcitul .i. achomalnad condib desimrecht dochách
note.note: either he that teaches, i.e. unusquisque, etc., or preaching to every one, i.e. hominibus post baptisma, i.e. let it be in teaching, that is, to fulfil it so that he may be an example to every one.
i.e. let him encourage every one.
i.e. be it in simplicity.

note.gloss: .i. bad iroithinchi .i. hilarem enim datorem delegit deus
note.note: i.e. be it in cheerfulness.

note.gloss: .i. censectti .i. níp sain anasberthar hogiun et ambess hicridiu
note.note: i.e. without simulation, that is, what is uttered by mouth and what is in heart must not be different.

note.gloss: .i. bad fuairrech cách frialaile ondesercc brathardi
note.note: i.e. let every one be gentle to the other from brotherly love.

note.gloss: .i. taibred cách airmitin dialailiu et nách taibred do feisin
note.note: i.e. let every one give honour to the other and not give it to himself.
i.e. so that the ardour of the love of the Spirit may be in us.
i.e. let it be God whom we serve.
i.e. gloria futura strengthens our hope.
i.e. be ye patient.

note.gloss: .i. baán tairismich doirnigdi ut tribulatio possit tolerari
note.note: i.e. let us be constant in prayer, ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. ní lour inbendachad diammaldachae, ní lour dano innebmaldachad manibendachae
note.note: i.e. not enough is the blessing if thou curse: not enough, also, is the non-cursing if thou bless not.
i.e. let every one’s joy be a joy unto you.
i.e. let every one’s grief be a grief unto you.

note.gloss: .i. infáilti sin ɫ. inbrón amal bid dúib doecmoised
note.note: i.e. that joy or the grief as if unto you it had happened.
i.e. every lowly deed, let it be it that ye do.
i.e. evil for evil.
i.e. for that is the true prudence.
i.e. whatever good there is let it be it which ye do.

note.gloss: .i. ut uideant opera uestra rl. .i. cáingním doib
note.note: i.e. a well-doing by them.
i.e. if it be in your power.

note.gloss: .i. cipcruth bíid páx libsi fricách ciabethir ocfar ningrim
note.note: i.e. howsoever it be, let there be pax with you towards every one, though they be a-persecuting you.

note.gloss: .i. ná bad fornert dofema né uós ira deprechendat uel sí quis té percusserit rl.
note.note: i.e. let it not be your strength that defends you, ne uos, etc.

note.gloss: .i. farṅdígalsi .i. bid adas farmbáich rosmbia alóg
note.note: i.e. vengeance for you, that is, ... they shall have payment for it.
i.e. (it is) likely that it will be true.

note.gloss: .i. commarí farṅdígal huaimse iscoru dúib si ón quam uindictam reddere.
note.note: i.e. in order that vengeance for you may happen from me, that is meeter for you quam, etc.

note.gloss: .i. ní dene comrud friss inulcc arnabad huilcc diblínaib
note.note: i.e. thou shouldst not make contest(?) with him in evil lest both of you become evil.

note.gloss: .i. Pelagius: ille uicisse dicitur qui alterum ad suam duxit partem .i. dognésu maith frissom et bid maidsom iarum
note.note: i.e. thou shouldst do good to him, and he will be good afterwards.
i.e. for the wicked power he counteth not for a power.
i.e. unless it be of God.

note.gloss: .i. nacumactte is dia rodordigestar ɫ. nacumachte file a deo itordigthi
note.note: i.e. each power, it is God that has ordained it, or the powers that are a Deo they are ordained.

note.gloss: .i. hóre ronortigestar dia cedono tuidecht friss
note.note: i.e. since God has ordained, why then go against Him?

note.gloss: .i. ros mbia lóg asithichtho is dianimortun fésine nimathi nech doib
note.note: i.e. they shall have (the) reward of their resistance(?): it is to their own disgrace(?) that He does not forgive any of them.
i.e. punishment, that is, they receive.
i.e. bomim opus fears them not, i.e. its fear.

note.gloss: .i. badeidbiriu dodrogníim [in marg.] hóre ismórad daggnímo dogní ettroethath droggnímo
note.note: i.e. it were more reasonable for an evil deed (to fear them), because it is a magnifying of well-doing which he doth, and an abating of ill-doing.

note.gloss: assindet sunt tra citné cumacte diandid cóir infognam .i. indí ↄsechat hulcu etmórate mathi
note.note: he (Paul) declares here, then, what are the powers unto which the service is proper, to wit, they that correct the evil and magnify the good.

note.gloss: .i. rotbia less lóg dodaggníma. Origenes: .i. laudem a deo accipies si sis subditus regibus propter deum .i. ishé dobeir lóg deit tarhési do dagnímo
note.note: i.e. thou shalt have with Him reward of thy well-doing ... i.e. it is He that gives thee a reward for thy well-doing.
i.e. it is so that is reasonable for thee to fear him.

note.gloss: .i. isdeidbir haáigthiu arisdothabirt díglae berid inclaideb sin
note.note: i.e. reasonable it is to fear him, for it is to inflict punishment that he bears that sword.

note.gloss: .i. niarichthi occo arisdiráith dée dobeir dígail fort
note.note: i.e. he is not to be blamed therein, for it is for God that he inflicts punishment upon thee.
i.e. not on any other.

note.gloss: i. hore dofeich cach nolcc et mórid cachmaith
note.note: i.e. because he punishes every evil and magnifies every good.
i.e. because he can punish them.

note.gloss: .i. hore rofitis is occ maid atáa .i. hore isminister deo
note.note: i.e. because ye know that he is engaged in good, that is, because he is minister Deo.
i.e. it is thus it is.
i.e. give ye their due to them.
i.e. it is proper to give it to them.
i.e. they are not negligent therein.

note.gloss: .i. nídlegar ní dúib .i. deponite debita omnia ut liberi sitis caritati
note.note: i.e. nothing is owed by you.
i.e. besides this.

note.gloss: .i. isaimser benefaciendi ɫ. noui testamenti ɫ. ascomalnad recto dilectio proximi
note.note: i.e. it is a time benefaciendi vel, etc., or that dilectio proximi is fulfilment of (the) Law.
i.e. it (induamur) is construed both actively and passively.

note.gloss: .i. amal isilóu badsochrud arnimthecht hore isfride imtiagam et adciam arconair [marg. sup.]
note.note: i.e. as it is in (the) day let our going be decent, because it is by day that we travel and we see our way. [in marg.]
i.e. in copulations.
i.e. every kind of strife.
i.e. in jealousy, i.e. in envy.

note.gloss: .i. bedimthugesi domino corroaitreba indiib ɫ. bedimthuge dúibsi crist
note.note: i.e. be ye raiment Domino so that He may dwell in you, or let Christ be raiment unto you.
i.e. let it not be subject to your flesh that ye abide.
i.e. let it not be to judge him.

note.gloss: .i. nabad indebthib .i. nabad hé fornimbradud nách maith aní itáa
note.note: i.e. let it not be in disputations, that is, let it not be your opinion that his state (of mind) is not good.
i.e. it is to them is said ‘sumite.’
i.e. strong is his faith: he deems every food pure.
i.e. he who is weak of faith.

note.gloss: .i. bairgen tantum etis ferr són lessom ut fuit dániel et trés pueri
note.note: i.e. bread tantum, and he prefers that, ut fuit, etc.
i.e. let him not put reprobation upon him.

note.gloss: .i. quia gratia uocatus est. Pelagius: ita illum uocábi ut té .i. ní laugi abríig less quam tú
note.note: i.e. He cares for him not less than for thee.
i.e. what sort of person art thou?
i.e. not unto thee is he servant, it is unto God.
i.e. there will be a time that he will not be feeble.
i.e. he is wont to have a particular day.

note.gloss: .i. níbí sainláa lasuidib act is abstanit doib semper
note.note: i.e. they are not wont to have a particular day, but it is abstinence for them semper.

note.gloss: .i. anas maith lacách dénad si pro deo
note.note: i.e. what each deems good let him do, si pro Deo.
i.e. he that fasts.

note.gloss: .i. ní lanech huáin alaile ammi dée huili nícol dó cid less armbéo et armmarb isairi rocées rl.
note.note: i.e. not to any of us does another belong: we all belong to God. It is no crime of His though we are His, alive and dead: it is therefore He has suffered, etc.
i.e. that we might all be His.

note.gloss: .i. ní latt aní ararethi etní lat incách forsammitter
note.note: i.e. not thine is that which thou assailest, and not thine is every one on whom thou passest judgment.
i.e. he may be a good man, though he eat not every food.
i.e. he may be a good man, though he eat his food.

note.gloss: .i. aratá brithem and cenutsu .i. deus ishéside dano aséola and ní cumme et tuss(u)
note.note: i.e. for a judge is there apart from thee, to wit, Deus: it is He, also, that is wise therein, not even as thou.
i.e. that day of judgment has been foretold.
i.e. all shall give their confessions on that day.
i.e. every one shall answer for himself.

note.gloss: .i. léicid iudicium deo .i. brithemnacht bes hua ... nísṅdenaith nisi ne ponatis rl.
note.note: i.e. leave ye iudicium Deo, that is, further judgment do not ye pass it nisi, etc.
i.e. that judgment will be left to you.

note.gloss: .i. bad sissi coneit don ...... barfirinne bas infirmus quia omne quod non ex fide ......... .i. nitaibrid fornech ní nádaccobra
note.note: i.e. let it be ye that shall be indulgent to the ...... your righteousness, who is infirmus, etc., i.e. force no one to what he desires not.

note.gloss: .i. diltuth ut manducet quod non uult
note.note: scandal, ut, etc.
i.e. it is in Him I confide.
i.e. it is common, however, to him.
i.e. it is common.
i.e. unless thou be indulgent to him with his weakness.

note.gloss: .i. léic uáit innabiada mílsi ettomil innahí siu dommeil do chenél arnáphé som conéit détso
note.note: i.e. cast from thee the sweet foods, and consume these which thy nation consumes, so that it may not be he who is indulgent to thee.

note.gloss: .i. ismó rochéess crist airi .i. báas olisamein léic uáit innatuari nocari
note.note: i.e. it is more that Christ has suffered for him, to wit, death: therefore cast from thee the foods which thou lovest.
i.e. it is not this that brings thee into heaven, that thou shouldest be a glutton.
i.e. this, however, is regnum.
i.e. indulgence to the folk that consume not every food.
i.e. non-indulgence to it.
i.e. makes denial.
i.e. his abstinence is weakened.

note.gloss: .i. rofitemmar isfoirbthetu hirisse attotaig doneoch dogní
note.note: i.e. we know it is perfection of faith that impels thee to what thou doest.
i.e. not with any one who sees it, sed fide.
i.e. as regards himself, i.e. who does not pass it (judgment) on any other.

note.gloss: .i. nítabarthi dímess doneoch fornach nénirt arafoirbthetu fadesin
note.note: i.e. contempt is not to be shewn by any one to any feeble person because of his own perfection.

note.gloss: .i. qui iudicat sé ipsum arlobri a hírisse .i. ara anfoirbthetu
note.note: for (the) weakness of his faith, i.e. for his imperfection.
i.e. he is guilty.
i.e. we who are firmer.
i.e. to be indulgent to them.
i.e. it is this that is good for you.
i.e. dilectio proximi is the upbuilding caritatis.

note.gloss: Pelagius: non sibi placuit quod passus est sed nobis profuit .i. ní ansu deit quam christo arrocées side móor nimnith doaurlatu patri
note.note: i.e. it is not harder for thee quam Christo, for He had suffered much tribulation to obey the Father.

note.gloss: .i. act is amal roscribad .i. in isaia
note.note: i.e. but it is as it hath been written.
i.e. saith Jesus.

note.gloss: .i. arniráncatar som less ascríbint mainbed díar nertad ni hifochidib
note.note: i.e. for they have not needed to be written unless it were to strengthen us in sufferings.
i.e. that every one may love the other.

note.gloss: .i. iar timnu ísu ɫ. amal dondrigéni ísu crist
note.note: i.e. according to Jesus’ commandment; or as Jesus Christ has done it.

note.gloss: .i. óinmenme lib occo et óingním .i. gním desercce
note.note: i.e. one mind with you therein, and one deed, even a deed of charity.

note.gloss: .i. íroimed cách achéele per caritatem .i. domaith friss
note.note: i.e. let every one receive the other per caritatem, that is, for good unto him.

note.gloss: .i. aris tri humaldóit robói indaritiu hísin
note.note: i.e. for through humility was that receiving.

note.gloss: .i. dothaidbsiu asfírdia et asné tairrchet a patriarchís combad adramail inmacc conróbad écoscc acheneóil foir
note.note: i.e. to show forth that He is very God, and that it is He who had been foretold a patriarchis, that the Son would be like the Father, that the mark of His nation should be on Him.

note.gloss: .i. adrat dia ismaith inchommáin dorat doib .i. misericordia
note.note: i.e. let them worship God: good is the obligation which He has imposed on them, to wit, misericordia.

note.gloss: .i. doarrchet dichéin nombiad adrad dǽ lagenti
note.note: i.e. it had been foretold long ago that there would be worship of God among the Gentiles.
i.e. as it is not hard for you.

note.gloss: .i. christi secundum carnem uel radix .i. christus quia ipse est radix iesse secundum diuinitatem ipse iesse condidit et is iesse asbunad dossom immurgu iárcolinn
note.note: it is Jesse, however, who is origin to Him according to (the) flesh.

note.gloss: .i. inneurt inspirto nóib .i. is hé nodonnertani cofedligmer isinfrescsin foirbthi
note.note: i.e. in the strength of the Holy Ghost, that is, it is He that strengthens us so that we may abide in perfect hope.
i.e. (as) there is scientia with you.
i.e. let each be fit to instruct another.

note.gloss: .i. docendi ɫ. praedicandi aris do arroiéitsa gratiam doprecept dochách
note.note: for it is for this I have received gratia, to preach to every one.
i.e. except what Christ says per me.

note.gloss: .i. ipse in me loquebatur et signa faciebat
.i. hiliricum .i. regio inter italiam et greciam .i. frigrecia aníar et frietáil anáir
note.note: i.e. to the west of Greece and to the east of Italy.
i.e. save my own labour.

note.gloss: .i. isdíimsa tairrchet adcichitis genti per mé
note.note: i.e. it is of me it has been prophesied that per me Gentiles should see.
of Him.
i.e. I have long had a desire to come unto you.
i.e. so that I may make a visitation to you I will visit you (and Tertius) with me.
i.e. I shall be brought in Hispaniam.

note.gloss: Pelagius: hoc sibi utile esse .i. isinteúir léu
note.note: i.e. as seemed to them (ἐν τῃ̑ παῤ αὐτοι̑ς θεωρίᾳ).

note.gloss: .i. rogabad gabáal dóib leu [in marg.] túercómlássát cómtínól
note.note: i.e. a taking has been taken for them (the poor at Jerusalem) by them (the Macedonians and Achaians): they have put together a contribution.
i.e. they are under an obligation, that is, it is their duty ministrare.
i.e. (when) I shall assign.
i.e. I know that I shall not be delayed with you for any long time.
i.e. so that you may help me through beseeching for me in your prayers.

note.gloss: doadbadar híc ascoir dochách guide dée liachéle
note.note: it is shown here that it is proper for every one to beseech God on behalf of the other.

note.gloss: .i. ishuáichnid isin iudeam ↄrodastar som techt
note.note: i.e. it is well-known that it is in Iudaeam that he has settled(?) to go.
i.e. that they may be thankful.

note.gloss: .i. anadchodadossa trithorad moprecepte berir sanctis qui sunt in hierusalem
note.note: i.e. what I have acquired through (the) fruit of my teaching is brought sanctis, etc.
i.e. so that I may stay on a visit with you.

note.gloss: .i. inchruth ascoir et asinricc sanctis .i. indinricc donaib nóibaib airitiu neich cuccuib is in domino fein æm
note.note: i.e. in the way that is proper and worthy sanctis, that is, worthily of the saints, to receive any one unto you, it is in Domino Himself indeed.

note.gloss: .i. amal as ṅ inricc sanctis fáilte frinóibu .i. in domino
note.note: i.e. as it is worthy sanctis to welcome saints.
i.e. whatsoever she may need, that ye should give it to her.

note.gloss: .i. airde cáinchumricc et chóre dogrés ubi fit salutate .i. badchore dúib friu et berar animchumarcc huáib
note.note: i.e. a sign of benevolence and peace always ubi, etc. that is, peace be to you from them, and from you let a salutation to them be taken.

note.gloss: .i. forrusuidigsetar .i. in persecutionibus .i. robtar irlim dothecht martre darmchen(n)
note.note: i.e. in persecutionibus, that is, they were ready to go to martyrdom for my sake.
i.e. to Priscilla, etc.
i.e. they to whom I have preached (the) faith.
i.e. Priscilla and Aquila’s household.

note.gloss: .i. primit .i. in credendo in assia uel in ipsa assia primisia sua in credendo dedit christo
.i. óthossuch .i. is hé céetne fer cetaruchreti diáis assiæ hicrist ɫ. a principio .i. hóairegas .i. óin diairchinchib assiæ insin rochretset hicrist
note.note: i.e. from (the) beginning, that is, he is the first man of the folk of Asia, that had first believed in Christ. Or a principio, i.e. from leadership, that is, he is one of the leaders of Asia (Asiarchs) who have believed in Christ.

note.gloss: ó romani .i. ocnertad neich ropricad dúibsi
note.note: i.e. confirming everything that had been preached unto you.

note.gloss: .i. genere ɫ. is sóir anapstalact hore donarnactar crist et hore romtar óis teglig nicumme et messe ɫ. adiuuantes apostolos
note.note: noble is their apostolate because they had approached Christ, and because they had been folk of (His) family; not the same as I.

note.gloss: .i. bad chore dúib friu huili et gaibid desimrect diacáingnímaib
note.note: i.e. let there be peace to you from them all, and take example from their beautiful deeds.

note.gloss: .i. hore pridchas commaith et comalnas insoscéle
note.note: i.e. because he preaches well and fulfils the gospel.
i.e. in every tribulation.
i.e. proven in faith.
i.e. Aristobulus’ household, let there be peace to you from them.
i.e. fulfilling (the) gospel.
i.e. all their household, that is, of Philologus and Julia.
i.e. they beseech you, that is, they bless you.
i.e. that is not what ye have studied in Euangelio.

note.gloss: Pelagius: per blandimenta et adolationes compossita sermone .i. alind áóiph inforcitil nemnech immurgu ainne
note.note: i.e. delightful (is) the beauty of the teaching: poisonous, however, (is) its quality.

note.gloss: Obaedentia .i. is irdircc dúibsi irlatu domaith etulcc pro qua causa conantur uós subiecire in suam doctrinam ɫ. isirdircc farnirlatusi dohiris et soscélu ideo rogo uós
note.note: i.e. conspicuous for you is (your) obedience to good and evil, pro qua, etc., or evident is your obedience to faith and (the) Gospel, ideo, etc.

note.gloss: .i. hóre is irdircc farclúu ɫ. hoc dicit ne offenderet eos quod dixit eos obidentes id est uolubiles ad seductionem
note.note: i.e. because your renown is conspicuous.

note.gloss: .i. brister immairecc fairsom et maided fair lib lase dombeir dia cobrith nocco
note.note: i.e. let him (Satan) be crushed in conflict, and let him be routed by you, when God gives help therein.
i.e. this, now, (is) his household.
i.e. in preaching (the) gospel.

note.gloss: .i. nuie tanicc cuccumsa uel fuit in hospitio cum illo paulus
note.note: i.e. he has newly come to me, uel, etc.

note.gloss: .i. intuile comthirchomracc sanctorum hitalam .i. inchatlach innafer asrubart et intoéntu inna ǽccalsa déde insin et hésom triuss
note.note: the whole congregation sanctorum on earth: that is, the universe of the men he has mentioned (v. 21) and the unity of the church, that is two, and he himself as the third

note.gloss: .i. scrinire ɫ. fer tige sǽt qui facit árcas ɫ. qui custodit ɫ. dispensator ciuitatis prius, non nunc, sed fidem custodit
note.note: i.e. a treasurer, or a man of a treasure-house, qui, etc.
i.e. so that ye may fulfil what is preached unto you.

note.gloss: .i. farnícce si ɫ. incarnatio Christi. [marg.] (qu)osdam ad fidem prosilitos admit(ten)dos .i. ailithir(ge)nti in fide 13 .i. airitiu colno dond macc do hícc inchéneli dóine
note.note: i.e. of your salvation, i.e. foreign Gentiles (proselytes) in fide.
i.e. so that (the) Gentiles may be obedient to (the) faith.

note.gloss: .i. ishé rofitir aurlatu et hiriss cáich ɫ. isdo indocbáal aris húad cach necne
note.note: i.e. He it is that knows every one’s obedience and faith, or unto Him glory is proper, for from Him proceeds every wisdom.

note.gloss: .i. per incarnationem Christi roirladigsetar genti do hiriss
note.note: i.e. per incarnationem Christi the Gentiles have become obedient to (the) faith.
i.e. of Corinthians: this is the multifarie which he has said.
i.e. superstitions of (the) Law.

note.gloss: .i. absque corinto uel iccach lucc imbet cristidi olchene
note.note: in every place besides wherein are Christians.

note.gloss: precamur ished aridlabrathar hóre isdias rodfóidi .i. paulus et susthenes
note.note: precamur: this is why he saith it, because it is two persons that had sent it, i.e. Paulus et Sosthenes.

note.gloss: .i. is amre lim rad ṅdé lib
