note.gloss: .i. it primiti .i. nomen plurale isprimitsom morad in(esseir)giu et a(i)ritiu indocbále
note.note: i.e. they are first-fruits i.e. nomen plurale, He is first-fruit, magnifying in resurrection and receiving glory.
i.e. a similitude with dissimilitude then (is) this.

note.gloss: .i. resurget .i. ní dodechur úirt in esséirgu inso arbid immalle asseírset omnes mortui
note.note: i.e. not to distinguish order in resurrection (is) this, for it will be together that omnes mortui will arise.

note.gloss: .i. inúrt airiten fochricce do fíríanaib et inurt airiten pían dophecthachaib
note.note: i.e. in order of receiving reward by the righteous and in order of receiving punishments by the sinners.

note.gloss: .i. bieid crich fortimtherecht cacha dúlo arniricfider alless postea
note.note: i.e. there will be an end to the service of every creature, for postea it will not be needed.

note.gloss: .i. isand ǽm bieid finis lasse donindin inmacc dondathir innahíi irrufollnastar siú
note.note: i.e. then indeed will be finis when the Son shall deliver to the Father these things wherein He has reigned here.
i.e. He will put them under the power of the Son.

note.gloss: .i. antiqua nomina demonibus arimrumadir cachṅgrád andsom
note.note: for every grade hath sinned therein.

note.gloss: .i. sechihed bás són imbás etarscartha coirp et anme et bás pǽne rl.
note.note: i.e. whatsoever death that maybe, whether death of separation of body and soul and (leg. or) penal death.
i.e. lest it should be supposed that (the) Godhead is subject to the Manhood.
i.e. it is He alone who will be aught.

note.gloss: .i. peccatis immefohṅget bás ɫ. [peccatoribus qui ante mortem habebant baptismi] uoluntatem
note.note: i.e. peccatis which cause death, uel etc.

note.gloss: .i. cedtorbe doib etarscarad etir friatola et a pecthu
note.note: i.e. what profit is it to them to separate at all from their desires and their sins?

note.gloss: .i. cedtorbe dúnni acésme dicachimniud et dicachgúassacht inbetho
note.note: i.e. what profit to us is what we suffer of every tribulation and of every danger of the world?
i.e. I am ready to go to martyrdom every day.
i.e. for bringing you into glory.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (ma)ssu dóinecht (crist) nocretim (ma)nid chretim (aess)éirge et mo(esséir)ge féinn (.i. mas)su bethu frecṅ(dirc) tantum nomthá
note.note: if it is (only) Christ’s Manhood I believe (and) if I believe not in His resurrection and my own resurrection, that is, if it is a present life tantum that I have.
i.e. if it is for the present life tantum that I do it.

note.gloss: .i. is hed aslinn andumelam (mass)uamnin ataam ammicosmili frisincethir dianérbart [ies]ias inninsci so
note.note: i.e. this (only) is ours, what we consume. If it is thus that we are, we are like unto the beast of which Isaiah hath uttered this saying.

note.gloss: .i. a seodoprofetis niérbarid autem uerba asbeir intóis anfoirbthe
note.note: i.e. a pseudoprophetis: ye should not utter autem uerba which the imperfect folk utters.

note.gloss: Mininder comicus dixit hoc testimonium .i. poeta de corintís
note.note: Menander etc.

note.gloss: .i. astualang deacht todiusgud crist et omnium mortuorum
note.note: i.e. that the Godhead is able to raise up Christ et etc.
i.e. it is unworthy to indulge them.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (reu)erantiam (.i. corop) occu .i. canim(ebol) lib ambuid (li)b cenprecept doib (rúne) ind hesséirgi (.i. ar) imprucæ et ar ... gid ignorare dicitur
note.note: i.e. that it be with them, i.e. have ye not shame that they are with you without teaching to them the mystery of the resurrection, that is, that it may be a shame et ... etc.
i.e. is it likely that any of you should say this?
i.e. an unbelieving question, this.
i.e. in what kind of body will they arise?

note.gloss: .i. nindías biis archiunn focheirt in terram sed granne désse tantum
note.note: i.e. it is not the ear which is to come thou castest in terram, but a grain of an ear tantum.
i.e. clean or bare.
i.e. so that the single grain becomes a great ear.

note.gloss: .i. isachorp fessin arafoím cachsíl .i. madgrainne cruithnechte foceirr isdiass cruithnechte rl.
note.note: i.e. it is its own body which every seed receives, that is, if thou cast a grain of wheat, it is an ear of wheat etc.

note.gloss: [in marg.] Ata tréde tadbatsom híc .i. dechur eter corpu nemdi et corpu talmandi et dechur eter corpu nemdi immanetar et dechur eter corpu talmandi immanetar andechor feil etercorpu nemdi (s)ignificat andechur (et)er indocbáil inna nóib innim andechor (in)na corp talmande significat dechor inna pían bete donaib pecthachaib inifurnn

note.note: i.e. different.
i.e. different.
i.e. different.
i.e. in decaying and dissolving.
i.e. without decaying, without dissolving afterwards.
i.e. baseness of their being mixed with mould.

note.gloss: .i. ataat tra réte híc niréid ambrith fricorpu peccatorum sed iustorum
note.note: i.e. there are three things here (glory, power, spirituality) which it is not easy to refer to the bodies peccatorum etc.
i.e. animal.
i.e. its soul (is) alive tantum.
i.e. the spirit now quickens the body.
i.e. what is perishable has been put first.

note.gloss: .i. anassuthin immurgu ished rolaad fodeid .i. spiritale
note.note: i.e. what, however, is perennial has been placed last.
i.e. the son (is) like (his) mother.
i.e. he (is) like (his) Father, a Son, however.
i.e. like unto Adam in works and desires.
i.e. like unto Christ himself (is) His heavenly Father.
i.e like to Christ in operibus etc.

note.gloss: .i. indleire doratsam frisechim gníme adim hipecdib taibrem frisechim gníme crist in iustitia et bemmi caelestis iarum
note.note: i.e. the diligence we have bestowed on following Adam’s works in sins, let us give to following Christ’s deeds in iustitia, and we shall be caelestes then.

note.gloss: .i. isí inso indrún inso .i. esseírge innanuile marb
note.note: i.e. this is the mystery, to wit, the resurrection of all the dead.

note.gloss: .i. ní nádmbia cid cumscugud donaib pecthachaib ni áirmisom ón archumscugud arisabás imbás dosuidib comscugud immurgu iustorum abás imbethith són adindrímisom
note.note: i.e. not that there will not be even a change for the sinners; but he (Paul) does not count that as a change, for in their case it is out of death into death. (It is) the change, however, iustorum out of death into life that he so reckons.

note.gloss: .i. isintsenmim dedenach arnibia senim terchomric iarsin ɫ. praedicatione nouissima ɫ. uoce archangeli
note.note: i.e. in the last call, for there will not be (any) call to assembly after that.

note.gloss: .i. nibia lobad na legad doib iarsin
note.note: i.e. there will not be decaying or dissolution to them after that.

note.gloss: .i. isuisse intoichther andruailnitheso honnebdruailnithiu nibu degming donetadsom achorp fadesin issuidiu
note.note: i.e. it is just that this corruptible should be clothed with the incorruptible. It were not difficult for him to go to his own body then.

note.gloss: .i. cid fogním cid fochésad dorróntar in hoc uerbo dicit enim consentius cid fo ó. cid fo .r. iscésad
note.note: i.e. in hoc uerbo one can express oneself both in the active and the passive, dicit enim Consentius that whether it be (i.e. whether induo ends) in o or in r it is passive.
i.e. when he puts on him.
i.e. what the prophet hath said will be verified.

note.gloss: .i. cote inrinnd diaruba uitam omnis hominis
note.note: i.e. where is the sting wherewith thou hast struck uitam etc.?
i.e. because it is through transgression of (the) Law that sin has been manifested.

note.gloss: [in marg.] ɫ. léx .i. inrect comaccobuir file imballaib caích doaccobor pectho doforchossol cách inrecht sin ho adam
note.note: i.e. the law of concupiscence which is in every one’s members, to desire sin, every one since Adam has overstepped that law.
i.e. through belief in Jesus Christ.
i.e. so that your deeds may be more and more perfect.
i.e. that ye may do the deeds which Christ hath done.
i.e. ye are sure.
i.e. ye will have glory for it.

note.gloss: .i. tecmallid dia domnich beos arnaptrom lib atecmallad
note.note: i.e. collect ye on Sunday still so that their collection may not seem to you onerous.
i.e. so that he may collect them.
i.e. so that its amount may seem appropriate to him.
i.e. if ye think fit to bring me with him.
i.e. my own household and some one of you.
i.e. when I shall visit.
i.e. I will visit.

note.gloss: .i. ní ba cuit adíll cucuibsi acht ainfa lib arnidad foirbthisi, it foirbthi immurgu macidonii
note.note: i.e. it will not be merely a passing visit to you, but I will tarry with you, for ye are not perfect. The Macedonians, however, are perfect.
i.e. it is this I intend.
i.e. if it please God.

note.gloss: .i. fristait sochuide domsa and .i. heretici et seodoapostoli
note.note: i.e. a multitude opposes me therein.
i.e. if he go to you before me.
i.e. of sin or of nonfulfilment of this epistle.
i.e. in not being subject to his control.
i.e. send ye him hither before I go.
i.e. with his household, who have gone with him.
i.e. I give testimony for him.
i.e. it should not be alone.
i.e. he did not desire.
i.e. this time.
free.

note.gloss: .i. lasse bas nuáin do ɫ. nípa ainmithiu intain ronicfea
note.note: i.e. when he shall have leisure, or it will not be unseasonable(?) when he shall come.
i.e. each the other.

note.gloss: .i. nafridoirced nech dialailiu et do dia
note.note: i.e. let no one offend against another and God.
why do ye not imitate it?
i.e. it is they who first of them have believed.

note.gloss: .i. ataat octimthirecht apastolorum dei nicumme et sissi
note.note: i.e. they are a-serving Apostolorum Dei, not like you.
i.e. to obey them.
i.e. to your teachers and to your soul-friends.
i.e. they have as excess what is wanting to you.
i.e. it seems marvellous to me.
i.e. profit, however, to you.
i.e. to do whatever they say.
i.e. it seems dear to her that ye should do good.

note.gloss: .i. sit ǽm no(ca)rimse ísu ... car .... dano s . .
note.note: i.e. sit indeed caritas wherewith I love Jesus; then sit caritas.

note.gloss: .i. augtortas apstalachte inso tra aainm fessin dosuidigud itossoc(h) naepistle
note.note: i.e. this then is the authority of apostleship to put his own name at the beginning of the epistle.
i.e. to send me was the Father’s will.

note.gloss: .i. preceptóir et forcetlid doib som Timotheus et bráthir inhiris nípu decming cid i coli(nn)
note.note: i.e. a preacher and teacher of theirs (was) Timothy, and a brother in the faith–it were not impossible even in flesh.
i.e. to the holy congregation which is in Corinth.

note.gloss: .i. ni luct corint nammá dianduthraccarsa amaithsi acht daduthraccar donaib huilib nóibaib file in achaia
note.note: i.e. it is not only to the folk of Corinth that I wish this good; but I wish it to all the saints who are in Achaia.

note.gloss: .i. precamur ego et Timotheus multipliceter is hed fodlína
note.note: it is this that supplies it (the sentence).
i.e. the Godhead.
i.e. that is, the Father.

note.gloss: .i. eter imnetha inbetho frecṅdirc et pæna todóchidi
note.note: i.e. both troubles of the present world and (fear of) future punishments.

note.gloss: .i. tre precept doib ɫ. isdessimrecht comdíthnatha etsóire dochách arsóireni
note.note: i.e. through instruction to them; or our freedom is an example of consolation and of freedom to every one.
from the oppression.

note.gloss: .i. corronertamni cách hifoditin fochide amal nonnertarni hodia
note.note: i.e. so that we may strengthen every one in enduring sufferings even as we are strengthened by God.
i.e. even we ourselves.

note.gloss: .i. méit donindnagar fornni fochith issí méit insin donindnagar indíthnad nitabir dia fornni didiu fochith nádfochomolsam cid indfochith follongam dober díthnad darahéssi
note.note: i.e. in proportion as suffering is bestowed upon us, so is the consolation that is bestowed. God, then, putteth not upon us suffering which we cannot endure. Even the suffering which we endure, He giveth consolation for it.

note.gloss: .i. arimp díthnad et hícc dúibsi foditiu fochide dúnni .i. andugníat ar magistir isferr dún adénum
note.note: i.e. that our endurance of afflictions may be a consolation and salvation to you: that is, what our masters do it is better for us to do it.
i.e. the salvation will be through the endurance of the sufferings.
i.e. we know that your faith will be firm in the sufferings.
i.e. I wish that ye should know it.
i.e. greatly.

note.gloss: .i. tuárgabad fornn aire fochide nádtuárgabar nert
note.note: i.e. a burden of sufferings has been raised upon us, so that (proportionate) strength is not raised up.

note.gloss: .i. ropo tochomracht linn buid imbethu ut mori omni disiderio cuperemus
note.note: i.e. it seemed to us a weariness to be in life, ut etc.
i.e. for our nearness to death.

note.gloss: .i. bás crist doprecept ɫ. parati sumus morti pro Christo ɫ. fis scél ó bás. Aliter roposcíth linn uiuere ceist cid dorigénsam nianse sed responsum mortis rl. .i. guide et tomoltód armbáis is hed dorigénsam sed non inuenimus
note.note: i.e. to teach Christ’s death, uel parati etc., or tidings from death. Aliter, we were weary of life. Question, what have we done? Easy (to answer), sed etc., that is, praying and urging (?) for our death, this is what we have done, sed etc.

note.gloss: .i. torisnich in nobís .i. in nostra prudentia
note.note: i.e. confident in nobis etc.
i.e. His help will still be with us.
i.e. when ye help.

note.gloss: .i. gigestesi dia linn arafulsam ar fochidi
note.note: i.e. ye will beseech God for us that we may endure our sufferings.

note.gloss: .i. afortéitsi ǽm ut ex multarum rl.
note.note: i.e. when ye assist indeed ut etc.
i.e. who will believe in us.
i.e. so that they may be driven.
i.e. to save a multitude through teaching after our deliverance.

note.gloss: .i. nigóo dún friarcubus ní arlóg na aithi pridchimmi soscéle
note.note: i.e. it is not false for us as to our conscience; not for reward or recompense do we preach the Gospel.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (in) semplicitate .i. ní ar (ló)g na aithi dun (fési)ne acht is (art)hairciud sochuide in gloriam (cum) deo in pasionibus gloriamur (non) lucri causa (praedi)camus
note.note: i.e. not for reward or recompense to ourselves, but it is for bringing a multitude in etc.

note.gloss: .i. issí diuitte dǽ precept soscéli cenlóg cenaithi
note.note: i.e. this is ‘simplicity of God’ to teach the Gospel without reward, without recompense.
i.e. for this reward is sought and glory.

note.gloss: .i. rofitis mobésgnese frib .i. nád cuintgim lóg armoprecept
note.note: i.e. ye know my habit as regards you, that is, that I seek no reward for my teaching.
i.e. I am certain.
i.e. to the end of perfection.

note.gloss: .i. rann uáibsi ɫ. rann diar forcitulni
note.note: i.e. a part of you or a part of our teaching.

note.gloss: .i. is triunni dúibsi indindocbál nobtá in futuro
note.note: i.e. it is through us that ye have the glory which is in store for you in futuro.

note.gloss: .i. amal istrebartabirtsi dochum nirisse ronbiani indocbál in die domini nostri
note.note: i.e. as it is through bringing you to the faith we shall have glory in die, etc.

note.gloss: .i. hore nondobmolorsa et nom móidim indib
note.note: i.e. because I praise you and boast myself in you.

note.gloss: .i. pænitentiam.: (Cei)st cote prima gra[tia] nianse rad dilgutha (pe)cthe tre baithis (is)hed arrath ta(n)ise dilgud pectho (t)re aithirgi
note.note: Question: what is prima gratia? Easy (to answer: the) grace of forgiveness of sins through baptism. This is the second grace: forgiveness of sin through repentance.

note.gloss: .i. atomanaste .i. cachled dochoidsom sund isdoprecept et forcitul
note.note: i.e. that I should be brought, that is, every side that he went here it is to instruct and teach.

note.gloss: .i. arisbés uáilbe issain aní asberar indi et dogníther
note.note: i.e. for it is a usage of pride, that what is said in it and what is done are different.

note.gloss: .i. araní immeraither iarcolinn isgnáth gáo et fír nand ni íar colinn didiu moimradudsa sed secundum deum et non est mendacium in illo
note.note: i.e. for that which is cogitated according to the flesh, false and true are usual therein. Not, then, according to the flesh is my cogitation, sed etc.

note.gloss: .i. cobeid .i. combed andedesin imlabradsa .i. gáu et fír .i. combad sain anasberin obélib et aní immeradin óchridiu
note.note: i.e. so that there may be, i.e. so that those two things should be in my speech, even false and true, that is, so that what I say with lips and what I think with heart might be different.

note.gloss: fochenéle lugi (i)ssiu rodbo chosmi(liu)s .i. amal nafil india (an)isiu .i. fír et gáu (acht) isfír tantum fil (an)d isamlid isfír fil indiunni
note.note: as a kind of oath herein it (is used), or a similitude, to wit, as this is not in God, even True and False, but it is True tantum that there is in Him, so it is True that there is in us.
i.e. True tantum, it is this which is in us.
i.e. which is preached to you.
i.e. False and True simul.
i.e. who is Est, i.e. True.

note.gloss: .i. bainse dún epert gue airintí labrathar indiunni .i. iesus cristus is firíon side
note.note: i.e. it were hard for us to utter falsehood, for He that speaketh in us, even Jesus Christus, He is Just.
i.e. it is myself I mention first.

note.gloss: .i. nírrobe iniesu christo est et non .i. fír et gáu acht is est nammá robói and .i. fír .i. biddixnugud fírinne
note.note: i.e. in Iesu Christo there were not Est and Non, that is, the True and the False, but it is Est only that was in Him, that is the True, even eternal existence of truth.

note.gloss: .i. indfír .i. dorairngert dia rofírtha hi crist
note.note: i.e. truly, i.e. God has promised: they have been verified in Christ.

note.gloss: .i. iesum .i. istriit doécomnacht dúnni gratia uirtutum et doctrina
note.note: i.e. through Him has been imparted to us gratia etc.

note.gloss: . . indocbal dún . . rlin nopridch .... inna fil acht .... mi andsom
note.note: ... glory to us ...
i.e. it is He that stablisheth us with you.
i.e. with the Holy Spirit.

note.gloss: .i. ishe dia.... .i. icosmuilius fris ignímaib et béssaib
note.note: i.e. it is God (who has sealed us) i.e. in likeness to Him in deeds and morals.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (.i. do)rrat gell (.i. fo)rgell asfíu .... intain dicit ... derin fíach (uita) æterna et reg(num) caeleste tri... bieid arngell ... fiach linn ... christus et inspi(ru)t nóib
note.note: i.e. He has given a pledge, even a testimony worthy ... when dicit .... debt uita etc. through ... our pledge will be .... a debt with us ... Christus and the Holy Spirit.
i.e. I have here an oath.

note.gloss: .i. is ar airchíssecht dúibsi nidechudsa cucuib statim dothabirt dígle et doaidbiur foirib sech cotaneccarsa són ut petrus ....annaniam et saphiram
note.note: i.e. it is for the sake of sparing you that I went not to you statim, to punish and to reprimand you, though I had power (to do) that, ut Petrus etc.
i.e. we are not potent over your faith.

note.gloss: .i. congniam fribsi octáircud raith spirito dúib conid hed fodera fáilti dúibsi et dúnni
note.note: i.e. we work with you in preparing spiritual grace for you: so that this causes joy unto you and to us.

note.gloss: .i. ished ǽm foruar fáilti dúnni formbuithsi iniriss et intairissem donairissid indi
note.note: i.e. this verily has caused joy to us, your being in faith and the steadfastness with which ye abide in it.

note.gloss: .i. na badécen forcúrsagad infechtsa cúrsagad et taidbsiu pectho isindepistil tóisich dilgud et comdídnad isindedenich
note.note: i.e. that it should not be needful to reprove you this time. Reproval and setting forth of sin in the first Epistle: forgiveness and consolation in the last.

note.gloss: .i. tíchtin inna epistle adrímisom arathíchtin fessin
note.note: i.e. the coming of the Epistle he counts as the coming of himself.

note.gloss: .i. consilium .i. arnafóirinse doguilsi dúibsi isintécht tánisi
note.note: i.e. lest I should cause grief to you on the second coming.
i.e through reproving your sin.
i.e. through reproof from me.
i.e. uerbum uel opus of the reproof above.
i.e. of your being in sin.
i.e. of the tribulations which I suffer in Asia.
i.e. it is of you.

note.gloss: .i. ba uissiu fáilte domsa úaibsi oldaas brón
note.note: i.e. joy from you to me were more fitting than grief.

note.gloss: .i. isderb limsa mofáiltese bid fáilte dúibsi
note.note: i.e. I am sure that my joy will be your joy.
i.e. for your joy is joy to me.

note.gloss: .i. cia rodbatar tirbithi aili fornn robodiliu linn dethiden díbsi
note.note: i.e. though there have been other troubles upon us, dearer to us was care for you.
i.e. not to put sadness upon you is this.
i.e. so that ye might know the greatness of the love for you that I have.

note.gloss: .i. coníarimse peccad libsi uili ɫ. aratartsa fortacht dúibsi arnap trom fuirib fornóinur
note.note: i.e. so that I may not count sin with you all, or so that I may give aid to you lest it be heavy on you alone (by yourselves).
i.e. it is a multitude that has inflicted the reproof.

note.gloss: .i. act bahé cúrsagad maid madachoisged dílgud ní maid dúibsi didiu cendílgud post increpationem
note.note: i.e. but that were a good reproof if forgiveness should follow it. It is not good for you, then, not to forgive post increpationem.
i.e. with despair.

note.gloss: .i. arnách róllca derchoiniud dílgid dó et dandonid
note.note: i.e. lest despair swallow him up, forgive him and console him.
i.e. show your charity towards him.

note.gloss: .i. duús incomalnid arrupridchad dúib isoscélu .i. dílgud dochách
note.note: i.e. if perchance ye fulfil what has been preached to you in the Gospel, even forgiveness to every one.
i.e. to him to whom ye forgive it, I also will forgive it.

note.gloss: .i. aní doluigimse airibsi iscrist dodlugi lim
note.note: i.e. what I forgive for you, it is Christ that forgives it with me.
i.e. it is in Christ’s person I do that.

note.gloss: .i. conintorgáitar .i. tre dérchóiniud arisgliccsom ocaslug inphectho ↄforbanar adslig derchóiniud iárna forbu
note.note: i.e. that we be not deceived, that is, through despair: for he (Satan) is cunning in tempting to sin till it is completed: after its completion, he persuades (the sinner to) despair.

note.gloss: .i. amminéulig and tra indorsa adgenammar aséis sechip hé nodapridcha et lassambé
note.note: i.e. so we are acquainted with him now, we know his meaning, whosoever he be that preaches it and with whom he may be.

note.gloss: .i. ropo irlam sochuide and dochretim níruanus fris immurgu hóre nád robe tit armochiunn
note.note: i.e. a multitude was ready therein to believe: however, I have not remained for that, because Titus was not (there) when I came.

note.gloss: .i. doadbadar sunt furóil serce hopool doibsom issindí nadran ocprecept dondsochuidi arlainni fesso scel ontechtairiu dochoid cuccusom
note.note: i.e. here is shown the abundance of love from Paul to them, in that he remained not preaching to the multitude, because of the eagerness for tidings from the messenger who had gone to them.
i.e. when I had bidden farewell.
i.e. because we inspire the knowledge of Christ in every one.
i.e. through knowledge of the faith.

note.gloss: .i. niboltigetarside bolad fidei per nos et pridchidir doib cibcruth
note.note: i.e. the savour fidei they savour not per nos, and, howbeit, it is preached unto them.

note.gloss: .i. condid odor uitae in uitam et ↄdid odor mortis in mortem
note.note: i.e. so that it is odor uitae in uitam, and so that it is odor mortis in mortem.
i.e. it is not every one.

note.gloss: .i. nidan chosmili frisna preceptori atobsegatsi artimchellni nidiamóidem dosom act arna arroímatsom nach naile
note.note: i.e. we are not like the preachers who go to you behind our backs. This is not to boast of himself, but lest they should receive any one else.

note.gloss: .i. non aliud corde aliud ore loquimur .i. nicuingem lóg arprecepte
note.note: i.e. we seek no pay for our teaching.
i.e. to us, the teaching which we preach.
i.e. it is Christ that we preach.

note.gloss: .i. intinscanfam .i. inbiam fris tra iár narnetargnu dúib itossuch caníralsid súil torunn
note.note: i.e. shall we begin? i.e. shall we be at that, then, after our being known by you at first? have ye not cast an eye over us?
I affirm: we need not.

note.gloss: .i. inbértar epistli uaín dothabirt testassa dínn
note.note: i.e. shall epistles be brought from us to bear testimony of us?
i.e. we ourselves shall, then, be able to name ourselves without it.

note.gloss: .i. ni reccar ales dano epistle uáibsi arrofitemmar cene
note.note: i.e. there is no need, then, of a letter from you, for we know without it.
i.e. your believing bears witness of us.
i.e. what is in our heart ye fulfil it.

note.gloss: .i. ronfitirni cach trechretim dúibsi .i. dobeir teist hore adibcretmigsi
note.note: i.e. every one knows us through your belief, that is, the fact that ye are believers bears testimony.

note.gloss: .i. hore nocomalnid timne crist dum christus est in cordibus uestrís
note.note: i.e. because ye fulfil Christ’s commandments dum etc.
i.e. in (the) table of (the) heart.

note.gloss: .i. epert adibscripthisi ón spirut inoentid fri crist
note.note: i.e. to say, ye are written by the Spirit in unity with Christ.
i.e. it is not from ourselves that we are messengers to you.
i.e. our sufficiency to teach and instruct every one.

note.gloss: .i. torisse leis arfóit fortechtairechta ɫ. ishé fodruar
note.note: i.e. he deems it meet to send us on missions: or it is He that has caused it.

note.gloss: .i. isindí dofich apeccad forcách et bís pén in futuro trethairmthecht isairi didiu asbeirsom litera occidit hore is hed robói indi morte moriatur
note.note: i.e. in that it punishes every one for his sin and there is punishment in futuro through transgression. Therefore, then, does he say littera occidit, because it is this that has been in it: morte moriatur.
i.e. punishment.

note.gloss: .i. dogníthe anasbered moysi ɫ. doárbas gloria octindnacul legis
note.note: i.e. what Moses used to say used to be done: or gloria has been displayed in giving Lex.

note.gloss: .i. is hed asbeirsom híc aratartar airmitiu féid donaib preceptorib .i. aracomalnither quod dicunt
note.note: i.e. it is this he says híc, that honour be given to the teachers, i.e. that quod dicunt be fulfilled.

note.gloss: .i. nifoílsitis deícsin agnúsa iar mbid dó ocaccaldim dé octindnacul recto dó
note.note: i.e. they would not have endured to behold his face after he had been conversing with God, when the Law was given to him.

note.gloss: .i. is hed dosaig anúas óthá quod sí ministratio rl.
note.note: i.e. this goes with it (adit) from above, from quod si etc.

note.gloss: .i. preceptori nuiadnissi mór ní as dénti ní airriu
note.note: i.e. teachers of the New Testament, how much the more is somewhat to be done for them.
i.e. to Moses.
i.e. of the glory of the whole Old Testament.
i.e. to do aught that the Law orders. i.e. the glory of the whole New Testament.
i.e. in teaching.

note.gloss: .i. do inchosc nadtuicset filii israel rúna et rombói fíal amirisse eteracride
note.note: i.e. to signify that filii Israel understood not mysteries, and that there was a veil of unbelief between their hearts (and him).
i.e. (the day) of writing this book.

note.gloss: .i. isindí nádcrette crist amal rofiugrad irrúnaib recto
note.note: i.e. in that Christ used not to be believed as He had been figured in the mysteries of the Law.

note.gloss: .i. nobís .i. nifil fiál etronn et crist ɫ. non reuelatum est .i. illís iudeis .i. nitucsat quoniam in christo rl.
note.note: i.e. there is no veil between us and Christ: uel non reuelatum est, i.e. illis Iudaeis, i.e. they understood not quoniam etc.

note.gloss: .i. ol rofásiged uelamen litere trechretim hicrist ceist cid doronad friu nianse sed usque in hodiernum diem rl.
note.note: i.e. since uelamen litterae has been done away with through belief in Christ. Question, what hath been done to them? Easy (to answer): sed usque etc.
i.e. through belief in Christ.

note.gloss: .i. nithucat beos ruín indrechto .i. atairchet etanrofiugrad dicríst
note.note: i.e. they do not yet understand the mystery of the Law, i.e. what has been prophesied and what has been figured of Christ.

note.gloss: [in marg. sup.] .i. isr(l. ɫ. induili) cretfite dimíli déec di illis rl. ɫ. sechié cretes de illis (tucfa) rúna legis
note.note: i.e. the Israelites, or all who will believe, twelve thousand de illis. Or whosoever de illis believes will understand (the) mysteries Legis.

note.gloss: .i. quasi dixisset fricorpthadid et stoiridetid doberat iudei tóib tantum noche . . ispirtálde dominus et isspirdide annuiedniss uile
note.note: to corporeality and materiality Iudaei trust tantum, however Dominus is spiritual and the whole New Testament is spiritualized.
i.e. without serving (the) Law.
i.e. unveiled, i.e. we put a veil from us.
i.e. knowledge of the Godhead.

note.gloss: .i. similiter christo in moribus ɫ. imago intairmchrutto isléib tabór
note.note: or, imago of the Transfiguration on Mount Tabor.
i.e. as from the Spirit.
i.e. God’s mercy has caused faith unto us.
i.e. let us cut off.

note.gloss: .i. imbrecairecht ut alii adulterantes in euangelium
note.note: i.e. in craftiness ut alii etc.
i.e. not for pay or wage do we preach.
i.e. in the manifestation.
i.e. every one’s conscience knows our kind.

note.gloss: .i. maso dorchide lanech apridchimmeni nilanech nodchomalnadar act islanech nadid chreti
note.note: i.e. if what we preach seems dark to any one, it is not so to one that fulfils it, but to one that does not believe it.
i.e. in which gloria Christi is preached
i.e. a natural image secundum diuinitatem.

note.gloss: .i. isairi is indocbál crist pridchimme arnipridcham arnindocbáil fanisin
note.note: i.e. therefore it is Christ’s glory we preach, for we preach not our own glory.
i.e. therefore truly we preach to you.

note.gloss: .i. ignis spiritus sancti condan éolich irrúnaib deachte
note.note: so that we are skilled in mysteries of the Godhead.

note.gloss: .i. scientie .i. etargne deachte et raith inspirto
note.note: i.e. knowledge of the Godhead and of the grace of the Spirit.
we are not sad.
i.e. we refuse.
i.e. we are not at all forsaken.
i.e. because quod dicimus is true.

note.gloss: .i. crucem ɫ. amal rombo marb ísu donbiuthso sic et nós
note.note: as Jesus was dead to this world, sic etc.
i.e. when we lead.
i.e. so that we may have the glory wherein Christ is in heaven.

note.gloss: .i. ambás tiagmeni doáirci bethid dúibsi .i. is arbethid dúibsi tiágmini bás
note.note: i.e. the death to which we go causes life unto you; that is, it is for the sake of life to you that we go to death.
i.e. it is for your sakes.
i.e. the variety of the gifts which are bestowed on every one.
i.e. of the graces.
i.e. that all be to the magnifying of God.
i.e. better and better.
i.e. the momentary.
i.e. greatly
i.e. of reward to us.
i.e. we love not things present.
i.e. it is not worth while to love them.
i.e. proper, however, is attention to these.
i.e. it irks us the severance of body and of soul.
i.e. that a house of immortality be let down around us from heaven.
i.e. after the eternal life.

note.gloss: .i. corpore ɫ. istrom linn etarscarad coirp etanme
note.note: sore seems to us the severance of body and of soul.
i.e. that Vita might come over that body.
i.e. it is God.
i.e. it is not knowledge to us.
i.e. we consent to it.

note.gloss: .i. is assu linn scarad friarcorp massudiing anrogadammar .i. techt innar corp fornem
note.note: i.e. it seems easier to us to separate from our body if what we have prayed for is exceeding difficult, that is, to go in our bodies to heaven.

note.gloss: .i. hore iscuci rigmi isferr dún placere illi
note.note: i.e. since it is to Him we shall go, it is better for us placere illi.
i.e. meet for us is its fair wage out of our body.

note.gloss: .i. opera .i. ni imdidnibter ainech and octabirt coibsen allae sin
note.note: i.e. no person will be protected there in giving confession on that day.

note.gloss: .i. ronfitir side quod timorem eius habemus
note.note: i.e. He knows us quod etc.
i.e. I am certain.
i.e. that even you also know us.

note.gloss: .i. ni recam ales rolasid súil torunn itossich
note.note: i.e. we need it not, ye have cast an eye over us at first.
i.e. we cause it to you.
i.e. let them not pass you.
in word.

note.gloss: .i. combadsníni formoidemsi .i. ↄérbaridsi anatdenat armagistir nidignemni cena pridchidsi
note.note: i.e. so that we might be your boast, that is, so that ye may say: ‘what our masters do not, we will not do, though ye preach it.’
i.e. from meditating on God.
i.e. to you.

note.gloss: isdúibsi proficit bacoir dúibsi ciado berthe testas dinni
note.note: it is to you proficit. It were proper for you to give testimony of us.

note.gloss: .i. excedere ɫ. non cogitare tola et accobra inbetha act cach lasel dún for imrádud dé insel aile forprecept ar seirc dǽ dogníam cechtarde
note.note: or non cogitare the wishes and desires of the world, but that we should be at one time meditating on God, at another time preaching. For love of God we do each of the twain.
i.e. we are certain.

note.gloss: .i. non disiderio carnali .i. arnaconroib dethiden forneuch act tol dǽ dodénum
note.note: i.e. that no care be on any one save to do God’s will.

note.gloss: .i. ni aírmithi ar aithis ambás nisin arasreracht
note.note: i.e. that death is not to be counted as a reproach, for He has risen again.

note.gloss: .i. hóre dorrigeni crist anuileso erunn ni uisse doneuch iarum buith inaccobor colnidiu Aliter neminem nouimus christum móri iterum pro pecatoribus
note.note: i.e. since Christ has done all this for us, it is not just for any one consequently to be in carnal desire.
i.e. Christ has been in (the) flesh.
i.e. that is resurrexit etc.
i.e. Godhead, i.e. it was not Manhood without Godhead.

note.gloss: .i. techtairecht ut sicut misit me pater et ego rl.
note.note: i.e. ambassage ut etc.

note.gloss: .i. niar nert indomuin guidmit act isarchrist
note.note: i.e. not for the sake of the might of the world do we pray, but it is for the sake of Christ.
i.e. he who.

note.gloss: .i. idbart ar ba ainm leosom peccatum dundidbairt adoparthe dar cenn peccati darcenn peccati didiu síl adim adropredsom combouisse ciasberthe peccatum di
note.note: i.e. an offering: for ‘peccatum’ was a name among them for the offering that used to be offered because of sin. Because therefore of the peccatum of Adam’s seed He has been offered, wherefore it is just that it (Christ’s sacrifice) should be called ‘peccatum.’
i.e. much of marvel has been wrought therefrom.
every one’s life-time.

note.gloss: .i. airiten irisse dochách et airiten caich ódia
note.note: i.e. (the time) of acceptance of faith by every one and of every one’s acceptance by God.
i.e. of salvation of every one through faith.
i.e. when we give not to any one.

note.gloss: .i. tacir dún ut inpleamus quod predicamus
note.note: i.e. meet for us ut etc.
i.e. if we fulfil what we preach, we shall not be blamed afterwards.
i.e. in dangers.
cold and hunger.
i.e. going from country to country.

note.gloss: fochidi arécin cossin fochidi othuil anisiu sis
note.note: so far it is compulsory tribulations: what follows is voluntary tribulations.
i.e. in knowledge without pride(?).
i.e. in affability.

note.gloss: .i. sine simulatione quia spiritus sanctus efugit fictum atá didiu spiritus sanctus in nobís
note.note: Spiritus Sanctus, then, is in nobis.
on lips tantum.
i.e. of working miracles.
i.e. arms of righteousness to defend us.

note.gloss: .i. nachin rogba úall de prosperís nachinrogba derchoíniud in aduersís
note.note: i.e. that pride de prosperis may not seize us: that despair in aduersis may not seize us.

note.gloss: .i. generis .i. cenonmolid cenon airid nitabir uáil nataris fornn
note.note: i.e. whether ye praise us, whether ye blame us, brings neither pride nor sadness upon us.

note.gloss: .i. amal ninfessed cách et ronfitir calléic ɫ. ignoti ab hominibus et cognoti apud deum
note.note: i.e. as though every one knew us not, and yet he knows us.
i.e. ready to go to death every day.
i.e. God protects us from every tribulation.
i.e. God protects us still.
i.e. nevertheless verily we are joyful even in tribulationibus.
i.e. truly.

note.gloss: .i. misteria spiritalia ɫ. alimenta per operationem nostram ↄnabiam ingorti nanochti ut est totus mundus uiri fidelis est
note.note: so that we shall not be in hunger or in nakedness.
i.e. that we shall not be in hunger or in nakedness.
i.e. we have a desire to teach you.
i.e. not straitly is it that our teaching is given to you.

note.gloss: .i. iscumung fuiribsi immurgu occanairitin naforcetal sin
note.note: i.e. straitened, however, are ye in receiving those teachings.

note.gloss: .i. diambad mathi ropia indfochricc dobérthar dúnni
note.note: i.e. if ye be good, ye shall have the reward which will be given to us.
i.e. as unto children: that is, according to teaching.

note.gloss: .i. badlethan formenme et forcride ocairitin indforcitil sa
note.note: i.e. let your mind and your heart be enlarged in receiving this teaching.
i.e. let not the yoke in which ye are be the same.

note.gloss: .i. istempul asberar doib hóre isóendia atreba indib
note.note: i.e. they are called a ‘temple,’ since it is one God that dwells in them.

note.gloss: .i. trianman tra dobeir doib .i. templum dei et filii et carissi[mi]
note.note: i.e. three names, then, he gives to them.

note.gloss: .i. atcomla friu ut mós est bonís doctoribus
note.note: i.e. he joins himself to them ut etc.
i.e. so that your body and your soul be clean.

note.gloss: .i. corrop nóib fornanim in hómun dǽ
note.note: i.e. so that your soul be holy in fear of God.
i.e. we have deceived no one.

note.gloss: .i. ni arindí doróntæ si anísiu .i. lessionem rl.
note.note: i.e. not that ye should have done this.

note.gloss: [in marg.] niáir doneuch molad alaili ciasbersa inso nitobartatháir si act is do bar tinchosc arandernaid andogniam ni et arnadernaid annad denamni
note.note: no reproach to one is praise of another. Though I say this, it is not to reprimand you, but to instruct you, that ye may do what we do, and that ye may not do what we do not.
i.e. through fulfilment and imitation of whatever we do.
i.e. I am bold to give evidence for you.

note.gloss: .i. hore dongniithsi arnintsamil ni hi cacha bésaib de uera bonitate
note.note: i.e. because ye do imitate us in all usages de etc.

note.gloss: .i. hore adib foirbthisi ni ↄairigursa na imned
note.note: i.e. seeing that ye are perfect, I feel not any tribulation.
i.e. since we know not tidings from you.

note.gloss: .i. hereticorum et aliorum bite im muntaras et nístabir acride
note.note: who are in my communion–and (yet) their heart brings them not (to me).

note.gloss: .i. isgnáth do cobir cach lobir hifochidib
note.note: i.e. He is wont to help every feeble one in tribulations.
i.e. with tidings from you.

note.gloss: .i. indfáilte robói dó libsi .i. hore fonairnicc arachiunn disiderium et merorem et emulationem
note.note: i.e. the joy that he had with you, that is, because he found when he came desiderium etc.
i.e. Titus.
i.e. your zeal against false apostles for my sake.
i.e. though it be for a season, that is, merely an hour.
i.e. besides I had no regret.
i.e. it is not your grief that causes joy to me.

note.gloss: .i. ni indráigne dúib cininfil lib aridibmaithi cene
note.note: i.e. it is no detriment to you, though we are not with you, for ye are good already.
i.e. that tristitia worketh salutem.

note.gloss: .i. imdethidnea sæculi .i. doguilse dineuch adbaill et dineuch nád etar et dineuch bís la nech nad bí lat so
note.note: i.e. concerning (the) anxieties saeculi, even grief for what perishes, and for what is unattained, and for what some one hath which thou hast not.
i.e. greatly.
i.e. on Devil and desires, i.e. bonum opus after it.
i.e. with anxiety.
i.e. it is for thinking of you.

note.gloss: .i. dorondonadni quod uos castos esse probatis
note.note: i.e. we have been comforted quod etc.
i.e. it is not sadly that he has returned.

note.gloss: .i. nirbomebul domsa epert frissom rondbiad fáilte libsi etrobtismaithi formbésasi arachiunn
note.note: i.e. it was no shame to me to say to him that he would have welcome with you and that he would find your morals good.
i.e. all true sicut dixi.
i.e. beyond every one.
i.e. who remembers.
i.e. desire without grudging.

note.gloss: .i. imforling anu dúnni apaupertas som etasemplicitas
note.note: i.e. their paupertas and their simplicitas have produced riches for us.
i.e. this I marvel at.

note.gloss: .i. isde dobiur forcell dineurt innadeserce robói indibsom
note.note: i.e. hereof I bear witness, of the strength of the charity which was in them.

note.gloss: .i. elimoysinam quae per nós sanctis datur ɫ. conrobad cuit doibsom occatimthirecht
note.note: so that there be a share for them in ministering to them.
i.e. before that alms.

note.gloss: .i. isuáichnid tra cid diandechuith tit .i. querere elimoysinam
note.note: i.e. it is obvious, therefore, why Titus went.
i.e. ye have all this.
i.e. that you may give it better than any one (else).
i.e. to prove your charity.

note.gloss: .i. istoich ciadorattid si ní diamuintir itmaithi aarilti frib
note.note: i.e. it is right that ye should give somewhat to His (Christ’s) household, He deserves well of you

note.gloss: .i. opere dei ished aschomairlle limm athabart
note.note: this is my advice, to give it.
i.e. because ye desire it.
i.e. that uelle.
i.e. the desire.

note.gloss: .i. níbécen lóg na airlicud act taibrid afil lib
note.note: i.e. buying or borrowing should not be necessary: but give what ye have.
i.e. if it is desired.
i.e. according to the power that ye have.

note.gloss: .i. famis .i. nicoir dídnad dondalalucht ettroscud dondlucht ailiu
note.note: i.e. it is not right that the one set should be consoled and that the other set should fast.
i.e. the giving of the alms.
i.e. the superabundance that ye have of the riches.
i.e. so that they may beseech God for you.
i.e. so that there may be no defrauding of one by another.

note.gloss: .i. ni pu imdu do inmann cidtrén octecmallad
note.note: i.e. the manna was not more plentiful to him though he were mighty at gathering (it).
i.e. not less was his portion, though he was weak at gathering.
i.e. teaching the gospel so that every one praises him.

note.gloss: .i. istorise lacách abuith ocailli a almsine ɫ. isuisse abuith icoimthecht dagdóine
note.note: i.e. every one deems it proper for him to be blessing his alms, or it is just for him to be in the society of good men.
i.e. we desire, then, that it should be done by you.

note.gloss: .i. itecht mudu elimoy. ɫ. itoimtiu nábad do hierúsalem .i. opes nobertis ɫ. ingabál lóge ar precepte amal náṅgabimmse didiu nigaib lucas
note.note: i.e. for the loss of the alms, or for thinking that it was not to Jerusalem that they were brought, to wit, opes, or for taking pay for our preaching. As I do not take it then, Luke does not take it.

note.gloss: .i. pridchite indocbáil dǽ in omnibus æclesís
note.note: i.e. who preach God’s glory in etc.
i.e. so that every church may see it.

note.gloss: .i. gaibthir tra déde isintestiminse sís .i. rodbo isprecept béstatad dochorintib uilib arniepur frib innalmsin berar dohierusalem arrofetar isirlam lib ade. Aliter isindalmsan arafocair anúas actisfor óis tuaithe arfocarar archuit indóissa gráid et ind áissa foirbthi ní écen airócre
note.note: i.e. two things, then, are treated of in this text below, or it is the teaching of morality to all the Corinthians–for I do not mention to you the alms that is taken to Jerusalem, for I know that this is ready with you.–Aliter, it is the alms that he suggests above, but it is to the laity it is announced: as regards those in orders and the perfect folk it is needless to suggest it.
i.e. I am glorying on your behalf to (the) Macedonians.
i.e. this is what I glory.
i.e. a warning reached you before me.
i.e. lest my glorying be a shame to me.
i.e. it seems to me more grievous that the outland folk should know it.
i.e. that it may not be a shame to you and to us.

note.gloss: .i. dobeirsom ainm bendachtan dondalmsin hóre islabendachtin doindnagar
note.note: i.e. he gives the name of ‘benison’ to the alms, because it is given with a benison.
i.e. when they enrich you.

note.gloss: mad condiuiti doindnasatar atluchfam buidi dodia darahéssi
note.note: i.e. if they be given with sincerity, we will give thanks to God for it.

note.gloss: .i. tre atlogud buide donaib nóibaib diatabarr indalmsan
note.note: i.e. through thanksgiving by the saints unto whom the alms is given.
i.e. good (is) your confession.
i.e. frequent is their supplication on your behalf.
i.e. I have believed that ye will do it.
i.e. through confidence of power.
i.e. that I dare.
i.e. who have deserved it.
i.e. we should have been able to punish it.
i.e. primum to any one who sent to you.

note.gloss: .i. hóre rommoidisom cumachte less cosse asbeir infect so asmug et nancoimdiu
note.note: i.e. since he has boasted hitherto that he had power, he now says that he is a servant and not a lord.

note.gloss: .i. asbeir itossug asmug imrádi iterum conderna gnímu moga .i. [in marg.] natomnathar nech nibes mó quam serui et cid intain ronmoitsem ní bo arseirc móidme act ↄrobad torbe dúibsi triit .i. ↄrochretesi et ↄro intsamlithe mobésusa et ↄná ruchrete si doneuch act nech dogned nagnimusin
note.note: i.e. he says at first that he is a servant: he considers iterum that he should do a servant’s works, that is, let no one think aught that is more quam serui, and that even when we have boasted it was not for love of boasting, but that ye might have profit thereby, that is, that ye might believe, and imitate my morals, and that ye might not believe in any one save one who did those deeds.

note.gloss: .i. amal ni cuimsin hifrecṅdirc anasberinn per epistolas
note.note: i.e. as though I could not do in (your) presence what I said per epistolas.

note.gloss: .i. itmóra nabretha scribatar and in æpistolis
note.note: i.e. important are the judgments which are written therein, in epistolis.
i.e. he is weak, however, when he is here.

note.gloss: deroil .i. nisulbir inbríathar .i. ní dron act is diuit etisglé
note.note: of no account, that is, the word is not eloquent, i.e. it is not strong, but it is simple, and it is clear.
i.e. we are potent in our word.

note.gloss: .i. ni irbágam nádernam iarríchte ní barscéuil si
note.note: i.e. we boast not what we cannot do after arriving.......
i.e. it will be proved in our work after arriving.
i.e. we dare not.

note.gloss: .i. niáil dún arcondelc friú .i. ni dignem andogniat som
note.note: i.e. it is not proper for us to compare ourselves with them, that is, we will not do what they do.

note.gloss: frinn fanisin cotondelcfam .i. amal doncoisin nínmóidfem inneuch nád denam ut uós facitis ó seodoapostoli
note.note: i.e. with ourselves we will compare ourselves, that is, as we are. We will not boast in aught that we do not, ut etc.
i.e. exceeding greatly, or in measure with any one.
i.e. we will liken ourselves to ourselves.
i.e. which He has granted to us.
i.e. in equality to you.
i.e. so that we are apostles to you.
i.e. as if we were not equal to you.
i.e. we do not exalt (ourselves).
i.e. it is not the fruit of any other’s teaching that I appropriate(?).
around you on every side.

note.gloss: .i. bithé naprecepta cétni nopridchob doib ɫ. nibarsaithar nachaili tiagu.
note.note: i.e. these are the same teachings which I shall preach to them; or it is not any other’s labour that I appropriate(?).
i.e. who praises himself.
i.e. whom He cares for or magnifies.

note.gloss: .i. sustinete me .i. fodaimid nech asmessa dúib .i. seodoapostolos
note.note: i.e. ye bear with one who is worse for you, even pseudoapostolos.
jealousy.

note.gloss: .i. isinunn arnét et dia circa uós
note.note: i.e. our jealousy concerning you is the same as God’s.
i.e. I have betrothed you.

note.gloss: .i. cen imrádud nach aili nisi christi
note.note: i.e. without thinking of any other nisi Christi.

note.gloss: .i. isco euam dodechuid serpens nícoadam hóre as lobro mulier quam uir niamre limsa didiu aís lobor dodénum diibsi
note.note: i.e. it is to Eve not to Adam that serpens has gone, because mulier is weaker than uir: I wonder not, then, that feeble folk were made of you.
i.e. a cutting-off.
i.e. which we have not preached to you.

note.gloss: .i. isdíriug dúib cretem do amal sodain ɫ. pateremini nós recte exaudire manidinnonn forcital linn et manid niméte dúibsi nicoitsi frinni
note.note: i.e. in that case it is right for you to believe in him: or pateremini etc., unless our teaching is the same, and unless it is, it is not much to you that ye listen not to us.

note.gloss: .i. tremintsamilse quia qui sé humiliat exaltabitur.
note.note: i.e. by imitating me.
i.e. so long as I have preached to them the Macedonians have sustained me.
i.e. I was not burthensome to any one.
i.e. of not receiving aught a uobis.
i.e. it will not go back.
i.e. since they boast in preaching, let them be like unto us.
i.e. who say they are apostles of Christ.
i.e. not difficult is transfiguratio etc.
i.e. he (Lucifer) attempts even equality with God.
a marvel.

note.gloss: .i. mainba æcne lib act conda anecne
note.note: i.e. if I be not wise in your opinion, but so that I am unwise.

note.gloss: .i. amal nát anse dúib arisgním anecni dogníu .i. móidem
note.note: i.e. as is not hard for you, for it is a work of an unwise man which I do, even boasting.

note.gloss: .i. arnitacair lasuide móidmiche do neuch innachthallond non de uirtutibus dei gloriabor
note.note: i.e. for boastfulness to any one in any talent he deems unmeet.
boasting.
i.e. in nobility of race.

note.gloss: .i. secundum carnem .i. niansu domsa adenum quam illís quia de una gente sumus
note.note: i.e. it is not harder for us to do it quam illis etc.
i.e. it is baseness to you to endure all this.
i.e. as if we should not have been able to do it.
i.e. it is ... doubly he dares tolerare se.
i.e. it is foolishness for me that I make boast.
i.e. this is true, however.

note.gloss: .i. hóre isco burpi asbéram naaill diarṅgnímaib
note.note: i.e. because it is unto stupidity that we shall say something else of our deeds.
i.e. great is their frequency.
i.e. for their greatness; or I had to tolerate them.
forty each.

note.gloss: .i. minus una .i. lora .i. tesarbæ oínloman de madaessoir et is una minus amal sodin. Aliter quadragenas .i. inna builnni .i. bémen dígle minus una nímmalle act iscachæ foleith .i. coiccethorchuit béimmen
note.note: i.e. one cord was wanting from it according to the natural exposition, and it is una minus in that case. Aliter quadragenas, i.e. the stripes, i.e. blows of punishment minus unâ, not at the same time, but each of them separately, i.e. five forties of blows.
i.e. a special kind of scourge wherein are forty thongs.
i.e. drowning threatened me thrice.

note.gloss: .i. inter fluctus ɫ. secundum ueritatem et rananacht dia
note.note: God saved him.
i.e. tribulation to me to whatever side I went.
i.e. thinking of the fratres fideles.
i.e. lest false apostles should come to them (the churches).

note.gloss: .i. niepeirsom arandíltad lasuidib sed uri tantum
note.note: i.e. he saith not that he should deny (the faith) along with them, sed etc.

note.gloss: .i. is hé rofitir inneuch rochéssusa náchgáo dom anasbiur
note.note: i.e. it is he that knows in what I have suffered, that what I say is not untrue for me.
i.e. the steward of the king Aretas.
i.e. that he might take me.
a basket: a hamper.
i.e. it is thus that I have escaped from him.

note.gloss: .i. ciadcobrinn móidim dodénum ni bói adbar híc
note.note: i.e. though I should have desired to boast, there were no cause híc.
i.e. there is no profit therein.

note.gloss: .i. isdeidbir móidem disuidib mad comoidim etir
note.note: i.e. it is meet to boast of them if it be unto boasting at all.
i.e. because quod dicam will be true.
i.e. a gloss on what is before.

note.gloss: .i. nomisligur ɫ. doimdibnim né insipiens sum quia quae uidi non in totum nume(ra)ui ne auditores mé honorent
note.note: i.e. I abase myself, or I abridge (my story).
i.e. that he should not suppose me to be a human being sed deus.
i.e. beyond that which I am.

note.gloss: .i. cenngalar [in marg. dolor capitis] ɫ. persequtio ɫ. secundum isidorum incentiua carnis
note.note: i.e. headache.

note.gloss: .i. ani tra aschotarsne frihícc nietar ciagessir
note.note: i.e. what, then, is contrary to salvation is not obtained although it be prayed for.
i.e. Dei to endure this suffering.
i.e. I prefer weakness to health.

note.gloss: .i. niↄfil bas sciith lim actrop ar crist
note.note: i.e. there is nothing which irks me, provided it be for Christ.
brittle.
i.e. so that it may be you that bear witness of me.
i.e. it will not be difficult for you.
greatly.
i.e. those who have been in praesentia Christi.
i.e. though I seem insignificant to any one.
i.e. of grace or of instruction.
i.e. except only.
is it likely that this should be an offence in your eyes?
i.e. I have not consumed your food or your raiment.
forgive ye.

note.gloss: .i. darolged dom tra infrithorcuin sin .i. non grauare uós
note.note: i.e. ye should, then, forgive it to me, that offence.
i.e. it will be the same as before.
i.e. I will expend my power for your sakes.
i.e. is it likely that it would be in order to cheat you?
i.e. is it not the same rule with us?
i.e. in preaching (the) gospel and in enjoining (the) faith.

note.gloss: .i. diarniráil furibsi et cona bad fír anasbermis
note.note: i.e. to commend ourselves to you, although what we say is untrue.
i.e. opera which I do.
i.e. vainglories.
enmities.
i.e. betrayals.
i.e. before I came.
i.e. for he is praesens when his epistola is read out.
i.e. knowledge.
i.e. it is Christ.
i.e. under a resemblance to His Manhood (are) we.
i.e. from the strength of the Godhead.
that resurrection in you.
i.e. let each look to his deeds.
i.e. unless ye fulfil what has been preached to you.
i.e. ye are sure.

note.gloss: .i. ní uainni duib si arnitan reprobini rafitidsi quid nabisamlid dúibsi
note.note: i.e. not from us are you, for we are not reprobi: ye know it: why is it not so with you?
i.e. through inflicting punishment upon you.
i.e. punishment will not be inflicted upon you in that case.
i.e. through not inflicting punishment upon you.

note.gloss: .i. innepthabirt dígle super eos qui habent ueritatem
note.note: i.e. in not inflicting punishment super etc.
i.e. when I myself shall come.
i.e. in fulfilment of (the) gospel.
i.e. if ye be in that wise.
for the salutate is a signum pacis with him.
i.e. for this shall not be in deceit.

note.gloss: .i. iscore doib fribsi similiter et uós
note.note: i.e. it is peace to them towards you similiter et uos.
i.e. of forgiveness of sin.

note.gloss: .i. serc dǽ dúibsi et farserc si do dia
note.note: i.e. God’s love to you and your love to God.
i.e. so that the Holy Ghost may be in you.
i.e. may it be given to you all.

note.gloss: Pelagius: neque per aliquos homines ni ó iacob na iohain nida apstal apstil
note.note: not from James or John: I am not an apostle’s apostle.
i.e. to the holy congregation.
which is in Galatia.
may there be!

note.gloss: .i. isdo isuisse gloria nidodóinib ni do dulib
note.note: i.e. to Him gloria is just: not to human beings, not to creatures.

note.gloss: .i. ismachthad limm athrete dorérachtid máam firinne et sosceli .i. isuaignid nirubtar gáitha for comairli isdían dorreractid maám indsoscéli
note.note: i.e. I marvel at the readiness wherewith ye have abandoned the yoke of righteousness and gospel: that is, it is obvious that your counsels have not been wise: it is swiftly that ye have abandoned the yoke of the gospel.
which is nothing.

note.gloss: .i. nifil folad naill fora sernte insoscéle issin act crist aris heside rofiugrad irrecht et adfiadar isoscelu
note.note: i.e. there is no other substance on which that Gospel could be built save Christ; for it is He that hath been figured in the Law and is declared in the Gospel.
i.e. to bring you from the Gospel into the superstitions of the Law.

note.gloss: .i. berit insoscéle do imthrenugud ueteris noch bauissiu indfigor do imthrenugud ueritatis .i. noui
note.note: i.e. they bring the Gospel to confirm Vetus (Testamentum), and yet meeter were the figure to confirm Veritas, i.e. Novum (Testamentum).

note.gloss: .i. ni fíu dúibsi insin doé(it)secht [in marg ] .i. cid aingel di anglib nime pridchas duibsi ni cretid dó nonech diapostolis manip innon et apridchimmeni dúib arniba maith a áidlea dúib anétsecte arbid anathema aforcen
note.note: i.e. it is not worthy for you to hear that, i.e. though it be one of heaven’s angels that preaches to you, believe him not–or one of the apostles–unless it be the same as what we preach to you: for not good will be the consequence to you of listening to them, for their end will be anathema.
i.e. I say it again.
i.e. so that I should preach for men’s desire.

note.gloss: Hieronymus non gratiam sed conuersationem nirbsa dagduine itossuch
note.note: I had not been a good man at first.
i.e. I grew, that is, I have been a leader in that science.
i.e. beyond my coevals.
i.e. beyond every one.

note.gloss: .i. dochosnam insmachta 1 . .i. doprecept soscéli isairi asbeirsom inso fobith inna soebapstal asrubartatar rombo descipulsom apstal
note.note: i.e. to contend for the rule.
i.e. to teach also.
i.e. we have heard of one another, we had not seen one another.

note.gloss: .i. attaat scela linn pól ingrentid ispreceptóir nunc fidei
note.note: i.e. we have tidings: Paul a persecutor is nunc a teacher fidei.
i.e. not very near was the return.

note.gloss: .i. de iudéib dobarnaip digeintib dothit rofitir indiassin ni do legund and docoadsa discipuli iesu quia simul in apostolatum gentium electi sunt
note.note: i.e. of the Jews was Barnabas, of the Gentiles was Titus: those two knew that it was not to study there that I had come.

note.gloss: .i. narraui eis .i. doairfenus doib dús imbed comrorcon and et ni ro be
note.note: i.e. I have declared (it) to them if perchance there might be error therein, and there was not.
i.e. not before every one.

note.gloss: .i. ataat dichétbuid híc imdibe tit ɫ. anebimdibe et is hedón asfír sed neque conpulsus circumcidi aristiamthe immeruidbed et niroimdibed tit
note.note: i.e. there are two senses híc: Titus’ circumcision or his non-circumcision; and it is this that is true, sed etc., for it is Timothy who had been circumcised and Titus had not been circumcised.

note.gloss: .i. nibo mór ambríg linn ɫ cidcohóir ut petrus ad horam cessit pro humilitate sua manducans cum gentibus
note.note: i.e. we did not deem their worth much: or even for an hour, ut etc.
i.e. provided it be steadfast with us at first.
i.e. Peter and James and John.

note.gloss: ɫ. innam muisea .i. documenta ɫ. persona
note.note: or my own things.

note.gloss: .i. niairegdu apersansom oldaas persan nanabstal olchene cetothóisegu iniriss quia deus personam rl. .i. quia deus personam non praeuidet
note.note: i.e. not more eminent are their persons than the persons of the rest of the apostles, though they are prior in faith, quia etc.

note.gloss: .i. nírbosár leu arcocéilsine [in marg.] Pelagius: consuerunt (.i. conoígset) nos docere debere in pace et cooperatione siue quia subscripsimus epistolam de questionibus
note.note: i.e. they did not deem our fellowship an outrage. [in marg.] they sewed.
i.e. we teachers of the Gentiles.

note.gloss: .i. congabtis gabala linn dondóis foiss inhierusalem
note.note: i.e. so that collections be taken by us to the folk that abide in Jerusalem.
i.e. even though it should not be said to us.

note.gloss: .i. nilegend rollegusa lapetor act iscúrsagad rondcúrsagusa dichomitecht et condarcilli fri iudeu
note.note: i.e it is not a reading which I have read with Peter, but a reprimand with which I have reprimanded him for indulgence and connivance towards the Jews.
i.e. to reprimand him.

note.gloss: .i. bauisse aingabail laús sanctae humilitatis in petro et iustitiae zeli in paulo
note.note: i.e. it was just to censure him.
i.e. this is why they were angry with him.
i.e. of not dining with Gentiles.
i.e. although his faith was perfect.
i.e. through regarding them as unclean.
i.e. that they judaize.

note.gloss: .i. ciapudono dún indarpe geinte inchruthsin arisinnon iress nodonfirianigedar
note.note: i.e. why should we then expel the Gentiles in that manner, for it is the same faith that justifies us?
i.e. even we credentes etc.

note.gloss: .i. ciabeimmi ni in fide christi peccatores sumus si opera legis credamus
note.note: i.e. though we be in fide etc.
i.e. so that I am dead as to the desire of the flesh, like Christ.
i.e. I affirm; it is not I that am alive.

note.gloss: .i. isairi ambeosa hore atá crist in mé
note.note: i.e. therefore I am alive because Christ is in me.

note.gloss: .i. ciasu icolinn ambéosa isiress crist nombeoigedar
note.note: i.e. though it is in the flesh I am alive, it is Christ’s faith that quickens me.
i.e. if it is the Law that justifies every one.

note.gloss: .i. ní airic ní césad crist amal sodin
note.note: i.e. Christ’s Passion profiteth nought in this wise.
i.e. sad is that, O foolish Galatians!

note.gloss: .i. ropridchad dúib céssad crist amal adcethe ɫ. forócrad dúib amal bid fíadib nocrochthe
note.note: i.e. Christ’s Passion hath been preached to you as though it were seen; or it has been announced to you as if He had been crucified before you.
i.e. a question I have for you.
i.e. so great is your folly.
i.e. in (the) beginning quando etc.
i.e. in vain, i.e. ye have no profit thereof.
i.e. if so, greater may be the knowledge of it that ye have.

note.gloss: .i. amal as hiress ronóib abracham nitatgníma rechto issí dano robnóibsi
note.note: i.e. as it is faith that has sanctified Abraham and not deeds of the Law, it also has sanctified you.

note.gloss: .i. rafirianigestar ahiress quasi in nouo testamento
note.note: i.e. his faith has justified him quasi etc.

note.gloss: .i. isdo assindetsom inso dothaidbsiu asniress nóibas et non opera legis
note.note: i.e. it is for this (purpose) he declares this, to manifest that it is faith that sanctifies et non opera Legis.

note.gloss: .i. indí ata hiressig ataella indbendacht doratad for abracham
note.note: i.e. they that are faithful, the blessing which has been bestowed on Abraham passes to them.
i.e. through transgression of the Law.
in Habakkuk.
it is in no wise the same.
i.e. he will not be guilty of the Law.

note.gloss: .i. niáil dún buith fomáam legis iár tíchte crist
note.note: i.e. it is not proper for us to be under the yoke Legis after Christ’s coming.

note.gloss: .i. immolatum .i. tar cenn peccati et maladicti [benedictio]
note.note: i.e. for.
i.e. so that what had been promised to Abraham might be fulfilled.

note.gloss: .i. ni óentorbe doraricc dún crux christi
note.note: i.e. not (merely) one profit hath crux Christi procured for us.

note.gloss: .i. ismóith aforcital .i. anasbiur sís imchosmulius indfíadnissi
note.note: i.e. tender is the teaching, that is, what I say below about the likeness of the testimony.
i.e. even.
i.e. the Law has been made after the promise.
i.e. but this were its annulment, not to fulfil it.

note.gloss: .i. dorairngred do abracham quod in semine tuo hereditas omnis rl.
note.note: i.e. which had been promised to Abraham, quod etc.
i.e. yet from this it has been given.
i.e. it is He, then, that is true.
i.e. unto what profit has it been imparted?
i.e. to correct every one.

note.gloss: .i. amal sodin et non ex repromisione arniↄchoimnucuir rect firíanugud
note.note: i e. in that case et non ex repromissione, for (the) Law could not justify.

note.gloss: .i. doárbith rect pecthu cáich ut non est qui faciat bonum ɫ. doárbuid ɫ. doetarrid
note.note: i.e. the Law has displayed every one’s sins ut etc., or it has bound or grasped.
i.e. through belief in Jesus Christ.
i.e. we have been cared for to receive the faith.

note.gloss: .i. non saluati fuimus acht immurgu torbe recto custodia tantum et reuelatio peccatorum
note.note: i.e. non saluati fuimus, but however custodia etc. is the Law’s profit.
i.e. as there is a guardian with children who cannot take care of themselves.
i.e. from belief in Jesus Christ.
i.e. through belief in Jesus.
i.e. ye are united in Christ.

note.gloss: .i. nisain cach hæ hicrist ni mó bríg cach he alailiu
note.note: i.e. not different is each of them in Christ; one of them is not of more account than another.

note.gloss: .i. ma nudubfeil inellug coirp crist adibcland abrache amal sodin et itsib atachomarpi abracham
note.note: i.e. if ye are in the union of Christ’s Body, ye are Abraham’s children in this wise, and it is ye that are Abraham’s heirs.
i.e. it is correction and castigation on each of the twain.
i.e. until it is time for him to take the land.
i.e. it is ... (?).

note.gloss: .i. apgitrib .i. sub mandatís legis ɫ. sub doctoribus legis
note.note: i.e. rudiments.
i.e. we have not remained.
i.e. when it seemed time to the heavenly Father.

note.gloss: .i. maic ni dosom adobtione non natura
note.note: i.e. we (are) sons of His adoptione non natura.
i.e. for it is He that is wise as to the recognition of the Father.
i.e. what impels you to it?

note.gloss: .i. ciddianepirsom anísiu noch ni rabatar indfirso riam fo recht fetarlicce nianse ariscumme lessom tect fosmachtu rechto et fognam doídlaib
note.note: i.e. why saith he this although these men never have been under the law of the Old Testament? Easy (to answer): because he deems it the same to go under the rules of the Law as to serve idols.
sabbaths.
i.e. calends.
i.e. quarters, uel scenopegia.
i.e. in vain.
i.e. in your conversion, if what I preach be useless for me.

note.gloss: .i. sum .i. homo .i. nipa anse dúib mo intsamil quia ego homo sum
note.note: i.e. it will not be hard for you to imitate me, quia etc.
i.e. that ye may be ut sum.

note.gloss: .i. forrodamar ocprecept dúib ab incredulís uestrís ɫ. si non passi estis corpore tamen mente conpassi estis mihi
note.note: i.e. which I have endured in preaching to you ab etc.
i.e. this is nobler then.

note.gloss: catte didiu farfailtesin frinn ollim nobis facta
note.note: i.e. what, then, is your welcome unto us olim etc.?
i.e. this is the extent of the welcome.
i.e. though I had asked for your eyes, ye would have given them to me.
i.e. when I enjoin righteousness upon you.

note.gloss: .i. ni nachcin aile no taid dom
note.note: i.e. it is not any other fault that ails you at me.
i.e. they are jealous of you, i.e. pseudoapostoli, i.e. they envy you, it is not for love of you.

note.gloss: .i. niarmaith frib non ut ego zelus domus tuae rl.
note.note: i.e. it is not for good to you, non etc.
i.e. but be ye thus even in my absence.
i.e. if it were possible for me.
i.e. to reprimand you.
i.e. when I am glorying for you.
i.e. if this is what ye have chosen.
i.e. do ye not remember this story?

note.gloss: .i. non secundum uoluntatem carnis arni robatar accobra colna leosom issuidiu cétach abracham noíchtech sarra
note.note: for they had not desires of the flesh in this, Abraham (being) a centenarian, Sarah a nonagenarian.

note.gloss: .i. dogníther cosmulius indrechto fripersana et luccu
note.note: i.e. (here) is made a comparison of the Law to persons and places.
i.e. thou shalt have cause of joy.
i.e. it is no one else that saith it.

note.gloss: .i. nib íccfither trechroich crist mafogneith dorecht
note.note: i.e. ye will not be saved through Christ’s Cross if ye serve the Law.

note.gloss: .i. intí téte forecht nimdibi dlegair docomalnad ind huili rechto
note.note: i.e. he that goes under the law of circumcision is bound to fulfil the whole Law.
i.e. ye believe not in Christ.
i.e. according to your opinion.
i.e. ye have cut off.
i.e. from the course whereon ye were.
i.e. though any one tempt you.
i.e. you in Domino.
i.e. save what I have preached unto you.
i.e. whoever he be.
i.e. from the course whereon ye are.
i.e. punishment, i.e. there will be retribution to him.

note.gloss: .i. massu ní imdibe nítorbe césad crist
note.note: i.e. if circumcision is anything, Christ’s Passion is no profit.
i.e. I should wish, that is, I should think it a lighter thing than that you should be circumcised.
i.e. ye should not desert your freedom for service.
i.e. let every one serve another.

note.gloss: .i. ma beith míduthracht etdígal lacách uáib dialailiu
note.note: i.e. if each of you have ill-will and punishment for the other.

note.gloss: .i. beith formenme and arnafoircnea forcrabud and .i. hibarpeccad cenaithirgi
note.note: i.e. let your mind be there, lest it should put an end to your piety therein, i.e. in your sin without repentance.
i.e. this is my advice.
i.e. take ye heed of that.
i.e. if ye are subject to the Spirit.

note.gloss: .i. rofitir cách ni fiú comitecht doib 19 .i. sant
note.note: i.e. every one knows it is not right to indulge them.

note.gloss: .i. coir cid caritas no bed itossuch sine qua uirtutes cæterae non reputantur
note.note: i.e. (it is) proper that caritas should be first, sine qua etc.

note.gloss: .i. conafil dualchi na accobra colnidi leu
note.note: i.e. so that they have no vices nor carnal desires.

note.gloss: .i. massu spirtide armbethu bat spirtidi arṅgnímæ
note.note: i.e. if our life is spiritual, let our deeds be spiritual.
i.e. meet is gentleness in teaching them.
i.e. lest thou sin.
i.e. support ye.

note.gloss: .i. mad cumme imned ácheli et aimned fessin
note.note: i.e. if his fellow’s tribulation and his own tribulation be the same.
i.e. that he be somewhat.
i.e. let it concern his own conscience.

note.gloss: [in marg.] Hieronymus: forrochongart itossuch spiritalibus ut indoctos bene instruerent ut alter alterius honera portaret híc e contra praecipit ut inbicelliores instructi magistrís benefaciant
note.note: he first has given orders spiritualibus ut etc.
i.e. what every one shall do, that will be an aid to him.
i.e. in everything that he may need.
i.e. the recompense is poena perpetua.
i.e. this will be his reward.

note.gloss: .i. fide operæ naanam didénum maith condonroib uita aeterna ut dicitur qui perseuerauerit rl.
note.note: i.e. fide operae let us not rest from doing good, so that we may have uita aeterna etc.
i.e. when it shall be time.
or life.
i.e. to do good to every one.
i.e. see what I have written to you.
i.e. it is no other.
i.e. it is the will of the flesh which they teach.

note.gloss: .i. isdo dágniat maith leu indocbál apstal doib et ní fodmat ingreimm archroich crist
note.note: i.e. it is for this they do it: they like to have the glory of apostles, and they endure not persecution for the Cross of Christ.
i.e. even they themselves fulfil not the Law.
i.e. they desire that ye should be circumcised.

note.gloss: .i. condartar ainm napstil doib treprecept nimdibi dúibsi
note.note: i.e. so that the name of ‘apostle’ be given to them through preaching circumcision unto you.
i.e. I am not the same as they.

note.gloss: .i. amal damarb inadnacul marb cechtar nathar dialailiu ego et mundus
note.note: i.e. like two corpses in a grave, dead is each of us twain to the other, ego et mundus.

note.gloss: .i. ropcoræ doib fridia et doíni .i. forsnahí comalnatar toil dǽ
note.note: i.e. peace be with them towards God and men, that is, on those who fulfil God’s will.

note.gloss: .i. sanctos uidentes deum et comalnatar toil dǽ
note.note: i.e. sanctos uidentes Deum et who fulfil God’s will.
i.e. though ye have done it hitherto.
i.e. do not goad me to punish you.
the stigmata.

note.gloss: .i. mind nabstalacte .i. conicimm dígail et cosc neich
note.note: i.e. the mark of apostleship, that is, I am able to punish and to correct any one.
i.e. the Godhead.
i.e. that is, the Father.
i.e. it is to this we have been called.

note.gloss: .i. isdicheín immunrordad condanmaicc togu non naturae
note.note: i.e. from afar we have been considered so that we are sons by election, non naturae.
i.e. He has gifted us and has filled us with the grace of the Spirit.
i.e. for it is in slavery we have been.

note.gloss: .i. tresinfuil storidi doresset assathóib intain rombói fricroich et tresinfuil spirtáldi adoparar cachdia forsindaltoir
note.note: i.e. through the literal blood which had been poured out of His side when He was on the Cross, and through the spiritual blood which is offered every day up on the altar.
i.e. for we have deserved nought save punishment.
i.e. abundantly it has been bestowed upon us.
i.e. perfection of well-doing.
i.e. so that we might understand it.
i.e. the mystery of our salvation.
i.e. according to the good will.
i.e. till the time had so come that was fitting to Him.
i.e. it is long since he destined(?) that to us.
i.e. per prophetas that He would come to us.
i.e. a sign is upon you.

note.gloss: .i. comarde artaidchrecce et ar nícce insin
note.note: i.e. that is a sign of our redemption and our salvation.
i.e. not for any other operation.

note.gloss: .i. ished inso noguidimm .i. conducaid etargne ṅ dǽ et conaroib temel innatol domunde tarrosc fornanme
note.note: i.e. this is what I pray, even that you may understand the knowledge of God, and that the darkness of the worldly desires may not be over the eye of your soul.
i.e. that your soul’s eye may be keen.
i.e. glory to us like God’s glory.
i.e. it were not just that He should be in that household, i.e. mortuorum.
i.e. not on a diocesan visitation hath he gone.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. dobeir inso anrab uilib cumactib dichoissin inim ettalam arailiu isarnaib grádib nemdib tantum et nibo decming rombed imthanad hisuidib combad uáisliu cachgrád alailiu ut est in gradibus terrenís
note.note: i.e. he puts this for all the powers which exist in heaven and earth. Otherwise, it is for (the) heavenly ranks only; and it were not impossible (to suppose) that there might be alternation in these, so that one rank should be nobler than another, ut etc.
i.e. over every name that is named.

note.gloss: .i. sancti et iusti ithé aschorp dosom christus aschenn ind nóib aschorp
note.note: i.e. sancti et iusti, they are a body to Him: (it is) Christus who is the head, the saints who are the body.

note.gloss: .i. nítat ildáni do óenfiur et ní óen dán dosochuidi
note.note: i.e. it is not many gifts to one man, and it is not one gift to a multitude.
i.e. ye deserved it not.

note.gloss: amirisse ɫ. deirchóintea derochóinet anícc trechesad crist
note.note: i.e. of unfaith, or of the despair wherewith they despair of their salvation through Christ’s Passion.

note.gloss: .i. amal gnís tra crist in iustis ut paulus dicit qui operatur in nobís issamlid dano gniith demun in filiís defidentiae maic inso tra ógním et non filii natura
note.note: i.e. as Christ, then, worketh in iustis etc., thus, too worketh the Devil in filiis diffidentiae: sons are these, then, by deed, et non filii natura.
i.e. our freedom has not brought us to good.

note.gloss: .i. ni ó aicniud nacétne tuisten act is oaicniud pectho doforchosalsam ó adam
note.note: i.e. it is not from the nature of (our) original creation, but it is from (our) sinful nature that we have transgressed since Adam.
i.e. he has pitied our being under (the) yoke of sin.
i.e. as Christ has been raised from the dead.
i.e. it is in Christ we shall be after going yonder.
i.e. it is His grace that has saved us, et non merita.

note.gloss: .i. itrédiu .i. rospridach roscomalnastar rosdánigestar dún codos gnem
note.note: i.e. in three things, to wit, He has preached them, He has fulfilled them, He has granted them to us that we may do them.
i.e. Israelitish.

note.gloss: .i. niimdibe dualche robói lasuidib act is imdibe colno
note.note: i.e. it is not a circumcision of vices that had been with them, but it is a circumcision of flesh.
i.e. it was not folk of (the) household.
i.e. of the Law and of the Prophets.

note.gloss: .i. nidad óegid na æchtrinn in fechtso
note.note: i.e. ye are not guests nor outsiders now.

note.gloss: .i. conascrad didiu iártíchte crist inmaceries robói eter dia et duine .i. peccatum et robói eter corpu et anmana
note.note: i.e. so then, after Christ’s coming the maceries, which had been between God and man, i.e. peccatum, and had been between bodies and souls, has been broken down.
i.e. so long as He had been in carne.
i.e. superstitions of (the) Law.
i.e. through bestowal of the gifts of the Spirit on every one.
i.e. (the) Spirit has been given to the whole of us to unite us.
i.e. ye are folk of (the) household now.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. apstil didiu cetathuidchetar issacumtach etfáithi sissi iarum crist didiu issí inchathir indnóib ata ellachti hicrist ithé ciues
note.note: i.e. the apostles, then, first have come into the building, and the prophets; ye afterwards. Christ, then, is the city: the saints who are united in Christ they are the citizens.

note.gloss: .i. anaslie uilnech and ísu crist .i. congaibther tóib et airchinn and rl.
note.note: i.e. when Jesus Christ is the corner-stone therein, that is, side and front are held together in Him.

note.gloss: .i. comthinól innanóib asberr tempul doib hóre atreba crist indib
note.note: i.e. the congregation of the saints, they are called ‘a temple,’ since Christ dwelleth in them.
i.e. that God may dwell therein.
i.e. ye are a dwelling for God now.

note.gloss: hóre nopridchim dúibsi ished dathar dom
note.note: because I preach to you, therefore am I in evil plight.
i.e. in such wise that ye may understand it.

note.gloss: ɫ. cid beicc daucbaid si aprudentia mea
note.note: or though it be of little worth, ye will understand it, (i.e.) the prudentia mea.
i.e. in teaching (the) Gospel Christi.
i.e. to teachers.
i.e. this is what has been manifested to them.
i.e. united into Christ’s Body.

note.gloss: .i. misteriorum hóre adiellachti icorp crist robiasi indindocbál doratad dosuidiu
note.note: since ye are united into Christ’s Body, ye shall have the glory which has been given to Him.
i.e. through fulfilling the gospel.
i.e. it is teaching (the) Gospel I am.
i.e. it is God’s grace that has caused it to me, not my merit.
i.e. so that they might understand it.

note.gloss: .i. rún ícce incheneli dóine et dánigthea inspirito nóib doib ropoinfolgithe irrúnaib diuinitatis et ní fitir cid muntar nime ↄidrofoilsigsetar apstil doib .i. dochretmechaib noui testamenti et domuntir nime
note.note: i.e. the mystery of the salvation of the race of men and of the dispensation of the Holy Spirit to them, which had been hidden in the mysteries Diuinitatis; and not even heaven’s household knew it until the apostles had manifested it to them, that is, to the believers Noui Testamenti, and to heaven’s household.
i.e. in the Godhead.

note.gloss: [in marg. sup.] .i. tuicsom inda nainmso tantum pro omnibus gradibus caelestibus arnietetár muntar nime misteria incarnationis donec reuelata sunt per apostolos ut dictum est quis est iste rex gloriae Aliter is pro omnibus gradibus aeclesiae noui testamenti quibus apostoli praedicauerunt ataat sidi
note.note: i.e. he has put these two names tantum etc. for heaven’s household knew it not (i.e.) mysteria Incarnationis donec etc. Aliter it is pro omnibus gradibus etc., that these are.

note.gloss: .i. acomairbert biuth ut nostra conuersatio rl. ɫ. in donís caelestibus
note.note: that is, their way of life.
i.e. it is from long ago He has called.

note.gloss: .i. nibadimicthese libsi cia beo hifochidib arngloria duibsi ón
note.note: i.e. I should not be despised by you though I be in sufferings: for this is gloria to you.

note.gloss: .i. cachdúil dianeperr ainm nathar inim et italam isóndathir dó
