note.note: i.e. every creature which is called by the name of father, in heaven and on earth, it is from the Father.
i.e. so that the form of the Spirit may be on you.

note.gloss: .i. rob clandad et robfothiged dosunt [in marg.] clantai
note.note: i.e. ye have been planted and ye have been founded for this: [in marg.] planted.
i.e. as they understand it.

note.gloss: .i. irrúnaib diuinitatis acethardeso et in cruce christi ɫ. quattuor uirtutes anime. [in marg.] .i. scientiae incarnationis christi uel diuinitatis eius. dextera christi saluauit sinistram mundi laeua eius saluauit dexteram partem capud orientem redemit plante occidentem
note.note: i.e. in mysteries Divinitatis (is) this tetrad, et etc.
i.e. He does it more than we ask it.
i.e. even what we do not pray for.

note.gloss: .i. oadcuaid ruín ícce incheneli dóine et andorigeni dia airriu demaid asber iarum dano arandathidisom dimaith
note.note: i.e. when he has declared the mystery of the salvation of the race of men, and what of good God had done for them, he then says also that they should requite it with good.
i.e. patience to every one contra alium.
i.e. though the dipping is a threeness.
i.e. as seemed to God of right measure for every one.
i.e. this is what he aims at.
i.e. that ascendit should be said of him.
even.
i.e. therefore ascendit is said of him.
it is even he.
i.e. over the many spaces.
i.e. soulfriends.

note.gloss: .i. dofoirbthigud .i. corropfoirbthe cách in operibus ministerii æclesiae
note.note: i.e. to make perfect, i.e. so that every one may be perfect in operibus etc.

note.gloss: .i. ished dotheít de treilar nandáne inilur napersan
note.note: i.e. it is this that comes therefrom through the multitude of the gifts in the multitude of the persons.
i.e. so that we may do what He has done.

note.gloss: .i. óis foirbthe arnialind inball nádchometig donchorp
note.note: i.e. perfect folk; for not pleasant is the member that is not indulgent to the body.
i.e. from blasts pseudoapostolorum.
i.e. from every blast.

note.gloss: .i. remedium .i. isamre leu cách icomrorcuin ut dicant niansu dúnni oldaas dochách
note.note: i.e. they marvel that every one (should be) in error, ut dicant ‘not harder to us than to others.’
i.e. it is proper for the members to grow from the head.
i.e. of every member to another.
i.e. gratiae which has been given to every one.
i.e. I testify, that is, I pray.
i.e. it is Est indeed.
i.e. their salvation.
i.e. although ye have heard that it is He.

note.gloss: .i. badífiriáinsi hóre adibellachti in christo amal asfiríansom
note.note: i.e. be ye righteous, because ye are united in Christo, as He is righteous.

note.gloss: .i. dluimm innasenpecthe ɫ. adam cum actibus
note.note: i.e. the mass of the old sins.
i.e. because ye indulge them.

note.gloss: .i. dluim innasualche ɫ. christus cum operibus
note.note: i.e. the mass of the virtues.

note.gloss: .i. per spiritum sanctum isspiritide induine hísiu
note.note: i.e. per Spiritum Sanctum this man is spiritual.
i.e. this is his raiment. i.e. because ye are new men.
.... not cast you down ... because ye are members.
i.e. against your sins, that they continue not with you.

note.gloss: .i. aliter is hed iarum torad forferce buid cenpeccad
note.note: i.e. aliter, this, then, is the fruit of your anger, to be without sin.

note.gloss: .i. christus .i. arnibísom illestur ferce ɫ. discritionis
note.note: i.e. Christus, for he abides not in a vessel of wrath.
i.e. his coming into the heart in place of God.

note.gloss: .i. nagatad dia nairi esé á deo ɫ. sempliciter
note.note: i.e. let him (the Devil) not steal God from him (the sinner) and him a Deo.

note.gloss: .i. madudéll ní taibred ní taraéssi dobochtaib de labore suo
note.note: i.e. if he has stolen aught, let him give something in lieu thereof to the poor de labore suo.

note.gloss: .i. ar amal forcomnucuir homo ad imaginem dei itossug síc forcomnucuir do deilb spir(to) infechtso
note.note: i.e. for as homo has been made ad imaginem Dei originally, sic he has now been made in the image of the Spirit.
i.e. what each may commit against another.

note.gloss: .i. hore adiboill crist et adibcorp do
note.note: i.e. since ye are members of Christ, and ye are a body to Him.

note.gloss: .i. mór intserc condechuith in crucem pro nobís ut dicit tradidit rl.
note.note: i.e. great (was) the love in that He went in Crucem etc.
i.e. a drink-offering.

note.gloss: .i. rolín inbith nuile et caelum bolad inna idbairtesin
note.note: i.e. the odour of that offering has filled the whole world et caelum.
i.e. let it not be only that it is not (but let it not even be named).

note.gloss: .i. cremina non cogitare iscomarde óisa foirbthi insin
note.note: that is a sign of the perfect folk.
filthiness(?).
i.e. those are not ... of perfect folk.
i.e. to profit.
i.e. every kind of lust.

note.gloss: .i. arméit inpectho et ar chosmili infognama dogníther doib
note.note: i.e. because of the greatness of the sin and the similarity of the service which is done to them (idols).
i.e. that (is) ....

note.gloss: .i. ciasbera nech ropia nem ciadugneid narétusa nipafír
note.note: i.e. though any one say ye shall have heaven though ye do these things, it will not be true.
when ye prove.

note.gloss: .i. nabith icobadlus doib aratá torad lagnímu soilse .i. praemia aeterna nifil immurgu acht infructuosa
note.note: i.e. be ye not in fellowship with them, for there is fruit with works of light, i.e. praemia aeterna. There is nought, however, save infructuosa (with works of darkness).
i.e. He who has called them understands them.

note.gloss: .i. intí adeirrig treprecept do ispreceptóirside iarnaithirgi
note.note: i.e. he whom he brings to repentance through teaching him, he is a teacher after repentance.
i.e. so that thou mayest be a light sicut etc.
i.e. ye should not walk without circumspection.

note.gloss: .i. cen pennit et non facere bonum
note.note: i.e. without penitence.
i.e. drink ye a great draught of this.

note.gloss: .i. forcanad cách alaile ɫ. irnigdid dilegenter
note.note: i.e. let every one teach the other, or pray ye diligenter.

note.gloss: .i. arisball dicrist infer et isball dindfiur inben
note.note: i.e. for the husband is a member of Christ and the wife is a member of the husband.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. isbés tra dosom anisiu cosc innamban (ito)ssug et atabairt fochumacte (a)feir armbat (i)rlamude indfir fochumacte dǽi combí iarum coscitir indfir et doairbertar foréir dǽ síc in seruís et in dominis et in filiis et in patribus facit
note.note: i.e. this, then, is a custom of his, to correct the wives at first, and to bring them under the power of their husbands, in order that the husbands may be the readier under God’s power, so that usually afterwards the husbands are corrected and reduced under God’s will: sic etc.

note.gloss: .i. niéilnithe didiu accomol crist et naæcilso istacair arṅdip samlid dochách
note.note: i.e. not defiled, then, is the junction of Christ and the Church: it is meet that it be thus to every one.

note.gloss: .i. subiecire mulieres uiro dilegere donfiur immurgu mulieres
note.note: to the husband, however, diligere mulieres.

note.gloss: .i. amal ascorp do crist æclesia iscorp mulier uiro
note.note: i.e. as Ecclesia is a body to Christ, mulier is a body uiro.
as they are.
i.e. no thanks to him: (she) is his body.
i.e. manifest in us is that fouere.

note.gloss: .i. hore isdocrist et dondeclis is immaircide
note.note: i.e. because it is fitted to Christ and to the Church.
i.e. for of the body is the member.

note.gloss: carad uir mulierem timiat mulier uirum
note.note: let uir love mulier: let mulier fear uir.

note.gloss: .i. ↄsechtar inmuntar uile arnaroib naeícmailt inellug inna æcaillse
note.note: i.e. the whole household is corrected, lest there be aught unquiet in the communion of the Church.

note.gloss: .i. armbat irlithiu dé domini mandatís dei
note.note: i.e. so that domini may be the more obedient mandatis Dei.

note.gloss: .i. arisfrecṅdircside diamogaib nidernat sidi ní nadfiastar side
note.note: i.e. since He is present with his servants, they can do nothing that He does not know.
i.e. with desire.
i.e. let the service be from will.
i.e. do not trust then in your power.
i.e. one Lord have ye.
from henceforth.

note.gloss: .i. in exemplo et in uirtute domini arcongéna dia frib
note.note: for God will work together with you.
weapons.

note.gloss: .i. gaibid armma dǽ foirib dochathugud fridiabol
note.note: i.e. take God’s arms upon you to fight against the Devil.

note.gloss: .i. nibécen naaill act resistere tantum ut est resistite diabulo et fugiet a uobís
note.note: i.e. nought else should be needful save resistere tantum.
i.e. so that the arms of (the) flesh should be with them.

note.gloss: .i. hóre ataad icath ɫ. eo quod non est uobís conluctatio aduersus carnem bad armatura dei bess lib nábat nacha arm aili
note.note: i.e. since ye are in battle, vel eo etc. Let armatura Dei be with you; let it not be any other arms.
i.e. provided God’s arms be on you.
i.e. a girdle of truth round you.

note.gloss: .i. córe eter dia et duine rl.
note.note: i.e. peace between God and man, etc.
i.e. that you may ward off, that is, a warding off.
i.e. this will be salvation to you.
i.e. that ye may obtain that sword.
i.e. let the prayer be spiritual.
i.e. in every steadfastness.
in continuance.
i.e. that ye may obtain that spiritual thing.
i.e. let it not be for you yourselves alone.
i.e. this I deem dearest, the grace of teaching.
i.e. to the opening (of the mouth) ad praedicandum.
i.e. without connivance.
i.e. it is for teaching it that I am (now) in chains.
i.e. as it hath been preached best.
i.e. so that ye may know that there are bonds upon me.
i.e. whether it be protection to me or no.
i.e. it is for this he has been sent.

note.gloss: .i. hóre cretes sochuide deo per praedicationem meam
note.note: i.e. because a multitude believe Deo etc.
i.e. they are (the) treasures of pious sons.

note.gloss: ni tuicsom sunt tra ainm nabstil arisfoirbthe incách diaroscribad et ni ecen acairigud
note.note: here, then, he has not put the name of apostle, for perfect is every one to whom (this epistle) hath been written, and it is not necessary to reprove them.
he (was) a pupil of his.
i.e. in the unity of Christ’s Body.

note.gloss: .i. doadbadar nanetrantach áirnigdesom et asniressach pro fidelibus
note.note: i.e. it is shown that his prayer is not intermittent and that he is faithful pro fidelibus.
i.e. no one is to me dearer than another.

note.gloss: .i. hore nocomalnid et nopridchid soscéle sicut ego
note.note: i.e. because ye fulfil and preach (the) gospel sicut ego.
i.e. that it has been preached to you.
i.e. unto this day.
i.e. of this I am confident.
i.e. He will bear it with Him to the end.

note.gloss: .i. etarscartha coirp et anme ɫ. iudicii
note.note: i.e. of the separation of body and soul.
i.e. as is meet for me.
i.e. a fair opinion of you.
i.e. I have a wish (to have) good testimony of you.
i.e. this is why I have been in evil plight.

note.gloss: .i. achomalnad et aprecept ishé deimnigud soscéli
note.note: i.e. fulfilling it and teaching it, this is confirming (the) gospel.
so that ye may be joined with me.
i.e. it is God that knoweth my love for you.
i.e. this to me is dearest.

note.gloss: .i. corrop mooassamoo et corrop ferrassaferr donimdigid desseirc dé et comnessim
note.note: i.e. so that more and more, and so that better and better, ye may abound in love of God and of neighbour.
i.e. in every perfect sense.
i.e. simple [i.e.] desirous to fulfil (the) Gospel.
i.e. through which is life eternal.

note.gloss: .i. hore amessaminse precepte asmochuimriug islia de creitfess
note.note: i.e. since I am fearless in teaching out of my captivity, the more will believe.

note.gloss: .i. rofess cid itaig ríg amal rofess itaig cáich
note.note: i.e. it is known even in the king’s house as it is known in every one’s house.

note.gloss: .i. istarissiu leu precept soscéli infecht so
note.note: i.e. more confident are they to teach the gospel now.
i.e. because I preach out of my bonds.

note.gloss: .i. itessamnu de arrofitetar is arnach nindocbáil móir fodaimim se inso
note.note: i.e. they are the more fearless, for they know that it is for some great glory that I endure this.
i.e. they are jealous that I preach rather than they.
i.e. these are good.
for good will.
i.e. these are the same as qui etc.
i.e. therefore I endure tribulations.

note.gloss: .i. contra mé amal bid ǽet limsa moort dogabál darmchenn ceín rongabus icarcair
note.note: as if I were jealous that my rank should be taken for me so long as I am in prison.
i.e. not from good will to me is it done.

note.gloss: .i. combad imned foraraill domsa .i. mobuith icarcair et moort dogabál
note.note: i.e. so that it should be trouble upon trouble to me, to wit, that I should be in prison and that my rank should be taken.
whatever way.
i.e. whether through hatred of me, ut pseudoapostoli.

note.gloss: .i. ni imned lim act rop crist pridches et immerada cách
note.note: i.e. I deem it no tribulation provided that every one preaches and meditates on Christ.

note.gloss: .i. significat humiliter folilussa na fochidi per uestram orationem
note.note: I will endure the sufferings per uestram orationem.
i.e. through the disposition of the Spirit.
i.e. according to the expectation wherewith I expect.
i.e. through fulfilling and preaching (the) Gospel.
i.e. though I live, it will be to preach (the) name of Christ.
sanctification of a multitude through me.
i.e. even that is profit.
i.e. whether it will be death or life.
i.e. which of them I shall choose.
i.e. it is this, in the first place, that I myself desire.
i.e. this I should prefer.
i.e. this is one of the two straits that constrain me.
i.e. need of saving you by instruction and teaching.
i.e. it is this that will be there.
i.e. but only.
i.e. so that ye may fulfil and so that ye may preach the gospel.

note.gloss: .i. imb icéin fa inaccus beosa niↄchloor act forcaínscél
note.note: i.e. whether I be far or near, may I hear nothing but good of you!

note.gloss: .i. ishedón asmaith lessom dochluas sicut scriptum est erat illis corpus unum et anima una
note.note: i.e. it is this that he likes to hear sicut etc.
i.e. both fulfilling and teaching.
i.e. yield ye not pseudoapostolis.
i.e. it causes perdition to them.

note.gloss: .i. isfochunn ícce dúibsi foditiu nan ingremmen
note.note: i.e. a cause of salvation to you is the enduring of the persecutions.

note.gloss: .i. nihed améit nonchretidsi act fodaimid fochidi airi
note.note: i.e. not only do ye believe it, but ye endure sufferings therefor.

note.gloss: .i. sit in christo .i. bad didnad deserce
note.note: i.e. (si qua consolatio) let it be consolation of love.
(si quod solacium) let it be (caritatis)
i.e. let it be bowels of compassion.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (Alit)er...tria...har forsintestiminso .i. abrith frisandliged remeperthe et is fripol berir amal sodin .i. ished inso sís rochlos et adchess innabésaib et agnímaib. Aliter saigid inplete gaudium rl. issí mofailte inso sí qua rl. in christo bad hícrist mabeith nachfaílte dúibsi et ni frissom amal sodin. Aliter foraláim dogníther .i. in christo bad ícrist rl. ɫ. manudtectid nahuilise inplete .i. dénid anasberar frib
.i. biid amal rongabussa ingním et bésib
note.note: i.e. be ye as I am in deed and morals.

note.gloss: .i. amal nondubcairimse carad cách uaibsi alaile
note.note: i.e. as I love you, let each of you love the other.
i.e. let not every one procure glory for himself.
i.e. let him procure it for another.

note.gloss: .i. bad uaísliu cách lialaile oldaas fessin
note.note: i.e. let each esteem another better than himself.

note.gloss: .i. nadecad indán doradad dó fessin acht dán ácheli
note.note: i.e. let him not regard the gift that has been given to himself, but the gift of his fellow.

note.gloss: .i. ni do fessin doratside indocbáil sed patri
note.note: i.e. not to Himself has He given glory, sed Patri.
i.e. in God’s might and majesty.

note.gloss: .i. etarcne quod est super omne nomen .i. indocbál patri
note.note: i.e. knowledge quod etc. i.e. glory Patri.
it is not easy to conceal it: most of them know it.
i.e. I prefer it.

note.gloss: .i. omnia bona .i. ished dosaig anúas arnibu anse duibsi deus enim. Gregorius hominis ergo est per diabulum quod peccat: dei uero quod potest uitare peccatum
note.note: i.e. this extends from above, for it were not hard to you: Deus enim etc.
i.e. Dei, not for your merit.
i.e. ye shall have (the) reward of your labour.
i.e. without doubts.
i.e. be ye like the Father.
i.e. for it is among false friends that ye are.
i.e. in providing glory for me on Doomsday.
i.e. it is manifest in you.
i.e. though I should go to martyrdom.

note.gloss: .i. ississi indidbart .i. post fidem uestram a mé deo immolatum
note.note: i.e. ye are the offering.
i.e. that I may send.

note.gloss: .i. bidmaith momenmese act rocloor forcáinscéil si
note.note: i.e. my mind will be glad, provided I hear good news of you.
i.e. not for jewels or treasures hath Timothy loved you.

note.gloss: .i. isaindocbál fessin condieig cách act tiamthe
note.note: i.e. every one save Timothy seeks his own glory.
i.e. a-teaching.
i.e. for the present.
in fighting against (the) Devil.
i.e. of whatever I need.
i.e. he used to love you.

note.gloss: .i. robói som ingalar et roposáith libsi ón ansu lessom immurgu fo barmbíd si quam dolor suus proprius
note.note: i.e. he lay in sickness, and this has been a grief to you: he was, however, more troubled on account of you quam etc.
i.e. death has been near to him.
i.e. of his death.
i.e. of your grief.
i.e. as you had had joy before his sickness.
i.e. through your joy.
i.e. what has been wanting of your perfection.
i.e. what I have preached.
i.e. let the joy be in God.
i.e. it irks me not: it is profit to you.
because they do it for earthly glory.
recutting carnis.

note.gloss: .i. tobe asbersom arimp áigthidiude arnifíu moidem and arcidsnissni nínmóidem and ciadodchommar foi innaaimsir téchti sed in christo iesu
note.note: i.e. concision he says, that it may be the more dreaded; for unworthy is boasting therein; for even we boast not therein, although we have undergone it at its legal time, sed etc.

note.gloss: .i. arnaeperthe isairi ro bóisom octatháir imdibi hóre niroimdibed
note.note: i.e. lest it should be said, that therefore he has been blaming circumcision because he had not been circumcised.
i.e. therefore he says this.
and it will not be in circumcision.

note.gloss: .i. ní ba in imdibu et sóiri ciabo asse dom
note.note: i.e. it will not be in circumcision and nobility, though it were easy to me.

note.gloss: .i. massu issóiri et imdibu móiti nech
note.note: i.e. if any one boasteth him in nobility and circumcision.
i.e. it is well known that I am a true Israelite: at the proper time I have been circumcised.
i.e. one of the two pillars of the kingdom.
racial this.
i.e. legal righteousness, that is, legal commands.
i.e. against law.
i.e. I have fought for it hitherto.
i.e. that I should part with them.
i.e. not more than this I esteem them.
i.e. so that Christ might be my gain.

note.gloss: .i. daadbatsom híc asfírinne crist nóibas et nifírinne rechto
note.note: i.e. here he shows that it is Christ’s righteousness that sanctifies and not the righteousness of (the) Law.
i.e. form and shape of His death on me.
in what way.
i.e. for if we be in death with Him, we shall be in common glory with Him.

note.gloss: .i. commin inricc dó .i. ad ↄresurrectionem christo
note.note: i.e. so that I may be worthy thereunto.

note.gloss: .i. comprechendi ished ambeccsin nammá dogníu dimaith
note.note: it is only that little which I do of good.
i.e. I look not behind me.
i.e. the things I have not done hitherto.
i.e. what is before me.

note.gloss: (frat)res ego rl. (cosmui)lius lessom inso frimílid rethess dochum (lainn)e buade (.i. ishé) a bés ade ní aírmi ambís iarnachúul dindséit (act a)mbis arachiunn ↄdidtar(la se)chæ et conrí (alain)n isinchruthsin (robó)i pol et isamlid isbuithi dochách (.i. im)bithphennit (conco)muir fris(sinlain)n .i. frisinfochricc nemdi
note.note: i.e. this is a similitude which he has to a soldier who runs unto the crown of victory, that is, this is his custom, he counteth not what (part) of the way lies behind him, but (only) what is before him, until he comes past it, and reaches the crown. In that wise hath Paul been, and thus ought every one to be, that is, in constant penance till he attains to the crown, that is, to the heavenly reward.
i.e. besides this.
i.e. what I say.
i.e. let our part be in it.
i.e. to that.
i.e. so that we may all understand it equally.
i.e. do ye what I do.
i.e. be ye cautious as to that set.

note.gloss: .i. ecosc nabstal forib et niténat ambésu
note.note: i.e. a semblance of apostles on them, and they practise not their customs.
i.e. I have verily denounced them to you.
i.e. it is a grief to me.

note.gloss: .i. intain asmberat isrecht nóibas et ní croch crist
note.note: i.e. when they say it is the Law that sanctifies, and not Christ’s cross.
i.e. for it is for the sake of food they preach.

note.gloss: .i. bidrucce et mebul doib aní indammóidet
note.note: i.e. that in which they boast will be a shame and disgrace to them.
i.e. it is not so with us.

note.gloss: .i. araroéit a nobís ɫ. nostrum corpus
note.note: i.e. which He has received a nobis.

note.gloss: .i. conidfil inindocbáil post resurrectionem amal indocbaíl áchoirpsom
note.note: i.e. so that it is in glory post resurrectionem like the glory of His body.
i.e. the might of (the) Godhead has caused it.

note.gloss: proprium uiri ɫ. mulieris ɫ. derbráthir
note.note: or own brother.
i.e. in fulfilling, not in teaching.
i.e. Peter’s pupil: he, too, had fulfilled it.
I say not their names here.
i.e. be ye gentle to every one.
i.e. to give you whatsoever ye may need.
i.e. let not what ye pray for be contrary to your salvation.
i.e. peace is nobler than every feeling.

note.gloss: .i. nicumme cachcáinchomrac arisirchride utmall cach caínchomrac condid ticci
note.note: i.e. not equal is every benevolence, for perishable and unstable is every benevolence until thou comest to it.
i.e. from this onwards
i.e. being without sin.
i.e. liberality.
i.e. let it be godly if there be.
i.e. (si qua laus) let it be of morality.
i.e. it is not hard for you.
i.e. all the (things) that I have done in your presence do ye them.
i.e. if ye be in that wise.
i.e. not for seeking sustenance of you.

note.gloss: .i. améula ɫ. issuail romfera sicut scio
note.note: i.e. I am knowing; or it is little that suffices me.
i.e. I am sufficient as to every thing.
i.e. I have learned loss.
I have learned abundance.
i.e. when ye share, [i.e.] ye give offerings to us.

note.gloss: .i. nitartsat idbarta dúnni .i. nirogabsamni anidparta hóre narbolour linn afoirbthetu sechnithartsatsom ní comtachtmarni
note.note: i.e. they have given us no offerings, that is, we have not accepted their offerings, because we have not deemed their perfection sufficient. They have given nothing, we have asked for nothing.

note.gloss: .i. nirobe cach reít innadlígud daratsidsi immurgu ar farfoirbthetu
note.note: i.e. all this was not as a due: ye, however, have given them because of your perfection.
twice only.
when I was therein.
i.e. it is not now of seeking.
i.e. what he has brought from you.
i.e. because it has been brought with joy.
i.e. he hath abundance.
i.e. a sign of peace and good will.
i.e. a salutation to you from them all.

note.gloss: far nimchomarc ó chách nádfil and
note.note: a salutation to you from every one who is not there.
i.e. he of Caesar’s household who has believed.
a taper-bearer.
i.e. because ye are faithful.

note.gloss: .i. airde serce móre insin aforaidmetsom cenchumsanad issindirnigdi cenchumsanad
note.note: i.e. that is a sign of great love, his remembering them without ceasing in the prayer without ceasing.
i.e. He sees it.
i.e. whereby ye have been called, so that ye are in Christ’s Body.

note.gloss: .i. nirbochuit eperte tantum act robatar cidferte dia imthrenugud
note.note: i.e. it was not tantum as to speech, but there have been even miracles to confirm it.

note.gloss: .i. in perfectione iustitiae conuersationis et uitae ɫ. illáni etargni deachte et doinechte crist
note.note: or in the fulness of knowledge of Christ’s Godhead and Manhood.
i.e. it is not proper to recount it to you.
i.e. that ye might take ensample from us.
i.e. in teaching and fulfilling the gospel.

note.gloss: .i. emitatores roart lessom epert friusom intsamli dæ statim act cid amall ished dodechuid de
note.note: he deems it too high to tell them to imitate God statim, but though slowly this is what has come of it.
waiting on.
i.e. in abundant sufferings.
i.e. ye are joyous through grace of the Spirit in receiving it.

note.gloss: .i. exemplum .i. ↄdid diib rogab cách deissemrecht
note.note: i.e. so that from you every one has taken example.
i.e. conspicuous is your faith in every place.

note.gloss: .i. niáil dún tabart testassa dínn nadiibsi daberidsi féissne cene
note.note: i.e. not proper to us to bear testimony of us or of you: ye yourselves give it without that.

note.gloss: .i. iscucci alére ropridchissid doibsom coneícdid doib cruth ropridchissem et dondechommar cucuib si itossogod
note.note: i.e. so great is the industry with which ye have preached to them that ye have declared to them how we have preached and have come to you in the beginning.

note.gloss: hóre ronsoír dipeccad isderb linn nonsoírfea in futuro
note.note: since He has saved us from sin we are sure He will save us in futuro.
i.e. it was not without sufferings and tribulations.
i.e. insults from every one.
i.e. in Philippi.

note.gloss: .i. ro bo dúibsi cinirbo etruib robammarni
note.note: i.e. it was to you, though we have not been among you.

note.gloss: niarlóg na aithi pridchim ut seodoapostoli
note.note: I preach not for pay or reward, ut pseudoapostoli.
i.e. we have not taken earthly pay.
not for praise is what we have done.

note.gloss: .i. ni amal rombothol dodóinib ropridchissem ut sí hominibus placens seruus christi non essem
note.note: i.e. not as men desired have we preached, ut etc.
i.e. it is He that knows how we preach.
i.e. we have not earned thanks from any one.
i.e. it was not for sake of asking your treasures.
God knows it.
we are messengers of a high Person.

note.gloss: amal dongní ade cachsián domunud adalti dicachgním for(bthu) darigi . . dínn oc(mu)nud d(alte)
note.note: as she makes every sound(?) to instruct her fosterling to every perfect deed ... of us instructing fosterlings.

note.gloss: [in marg.] Ceist in innonn less parbulus et nutrix náde ǽm isinnon arisbésad nammuimme dogní deidbleán di ocmunud ádalti horbi accobur lǽ nebud dó innoidenacht nachgeín síc fuimus uobis ol pol
note.note: Question, does he deem paruulus and nutrix the same? Verily it is the same: for it is the custom of the nurse to make a weakling of herself teaching her fosterling, since she hath a desire that he should not be in infancy for any long time: ‘sic fuimus uobis’ saith Paul.
i.e. in teaching it and in fulfilling it.

note.gloss: .i. combad innonn indocbál diar nanmanaib ɫ. darfarcenn immartri
note.note: i.e. so that it might be the same glory to our souls; or for your sake into martyrdom.

note.gloss: suánemuin dodénum inaidchi doreicc arbiad et ǽitach diamuntir precept fridei do ícc anman sochuide
note.note: to make ropes at night to be sold for food and raiment for his household: to preach by day to save the souls of a multitude.
i.e. without causing loss to you.
i.e. as we have recounted it.
i.e. ye are sure.
how worthily.
i.e. as a father entreats his son.
i.e. we have entreated you.

note.gloss: .i. praedicatio euangelii amal bid o dia rachlóithe
note.note: as if ye had beard it from God.
i.e. it is not a false opinion of yours: it is God’s very word.
who have believed in the teaching of Jesus and the apostles.
i.e. (forbidding) us.
i.e. so that they may fulfil.
i.e. we have parted from you for a little while.
i.e. if we had been able.
or every adversary.

note.gloss: .i. tacco issíi bid dibarnágsi ronbiani corona gloriae in die iudicii
note.note: i.e. I declare it is: it will be from your battle that we shall have corona etc.
i.e. your perfection causes gloria to us.
i.e. without tidings from you.
i.e. until our household (Silas and Timothy) came with tidings from you.
i.e. a teacher.
i.e. it is for this (purpose) he is sent.
i.e. that it may be stable sicut est.

note.gloss: .i. nipimned libsi mofochidise ɫ. ciacheste aririss crist
note.note: i.e. let not my sufferings grieve you; or though ye should suffer for Christ’s faith.
i.e. ye are not ignorant of it.

note.gloss: .i. isarchenn focheda dodechommar ɫ. positi sumus .i. in solicitudine pro uobís
note.note: i.e. it is to meet suffering that we have come.
i.e. that we were to be in suffering.

note.gloss: .i. ut christus passus est et ut praedixit apostolis suís antequam pateretur combad tressa de hiress apstal dofulung tribulationum
note.note: so that the apostles’ faith might be the stronger to endure tribulationes.
beyond every one.
or if perchance he provoke(?) you.
i.e. if perchance your labour is vain.
or a good testimony of us.
i.e. if it be the same with you.
i.e. it is like for like to you.

note.gloss: .i. propter praedicta hóre dunnánic fius scél uáib et ismaith forniress et forṅdeserc rl.
note.note: because tidings of you have come to us, and good is your faith and your charity etc.
i.e. because it is perfect.
i.e. your perfection is our life.
i.e. He perceives you.
i.e. so great is our love for you.
beyond every prayer.
i.e. it will not be a sight without profit then.

note.gloss: madudesta ní dibar niris íccfidir per aduentum nostrum ad uós
note.note: if aught is lacking in your faith, it will be made good per etc.
may God grant it to us indeed!
i.e. another prayer.
against our coming.
i.e. each of you contra alium.

note.gloss: .i. abundauimus caritate amal rondobcarsamni carad cách uáib achéile samlid
note.note: as we have loved you, let each of you likewise love the other.
if aught is lacking in your faith, it will be made good per etc.
i.e. because He perceives it.
i.e. it will not be with a few that He will come.
i.e. we have a prayer to you(?).
i.e. as has been preached to you.
i.e. quam has been preached to you.
fulfil them because ye have knowledge.
i.e. this is the sanctification.
i.e. subject to it.
i.e. for it is thus they are.
i.e. he should not defraud him in every dealing.
i.e. God will repay punishment for them.
i.e. of the fraternal charity.
i.e. quam mendicancy.

note.gloss: .i. araill tra cairigedarsom sunda .i. utmuille et déess et foigde nosṅguidsom didiu arnarobat leu inpecthisi
note.note: i.e. (there are) other things now which he blames here, namely, unsteadiness and indolence and mendicancy; he beseeches them, then, that these sins may not be with them.
i.e. an exhortation.
i.e. that ye be not a-begging.
i.e. that is the honeste.
i.e. an answer to some who had denied the resurrection mortuarum.

note.gloss: ished inso afrecre donaib eriteccaib niasse tacre natairissem friss
note.note: this is his answer to the heretics: not easy is it to gainsay or withstand it.

note.gloss: Pelagius: facit apostolus diem domini habere susceptum quasi eos in corpore inueniret .i. atcomlasom híc lasnahí dofuircifea bráth imbethu et bebté etasseírset isind óinuáir
note.note: i.e. he joins himself híc with those whom the Judgment will find alive, and who will die and arise in the same hour.

note.gloss: Pelagius: tam uelox erit eorum resurrectio quam nostra assumptio .i. atalat rabad assu atodiusgud ade
note.note: i.e. it seems to thee their awakening would be easier.
i.e. it will be impossible for any one to sleep there.

note.gloss: .i. ifogur dǽ fessin ut in monte sina
note.note: i.e. in the sound of God Himself ut etc.
i.e. their resurrection will be prior.
i.e. with the dead.
i.e. into the clouds.
i.e. into the air.

note.gloss: .i. bad nertad dúib inso asneírsid et folnibthe lassincoimdid
note.note: i.e. let this be an encouragement to you, that ye will arise and reign with the Lord.

note.gloss: .i. diei iudicii .i. niba aimser bid brothad
note.note: i.e. it will not be a time: it will be (but) a moment.

note.gloss: frecre inso do menmanib innaní asbertis cipadadéne indhesséirgi
note.note: an answer, this, to the minds of those that used to say what would be the swiftness of the resurrection.

note.gloss: .i. amal dotéitside dogabáil báiguil intan nádnacastar et nádforchluinter isamlid dorriga dia dobráth intain nádtomnibther athíchtu
note.note: i.e. as he comes to seize (his) opportunity, when he is not seen and is not heard, even so God will come to judgment when His coming will not be expected.

note.gloss: [in l. marg.].....bera ade....duin síc.....rb do...ni derb cuin....
note.note: ..... to us .... not certain when ....
i.e. it will be impossible for them.
i.e. this is a consolation and an encouragement.
i.e. without your knowing (it).
i.e. without sins.

note.gloss: .i. hóre ammimaicc lai etsoilse naseichem na hí siu
note.note: i.e. since we are children of day and of light, let us not follow these (sleep and drunkenness).
i.e. that is spes.
i.e. to us.
i.e. it is in our power.
i.e. so that we may do works that effect salvation to us.
i.e. this, then, is through God’s appointment.

note.gloss: .i. imbem imbethu imbem imbaás bad lessom Aliter isdodiuchtrad corporum et dochotlud corporum arnatomnitisom biddoirgairiu cotulta quando dixit non dormiamus
note.note: i.e. whether we be in life, whether we be in death, let it be with Him. Aliter: it is of the waking corporum and of the sleeping corporum, lest they should suppose that it is to prohibit sleep quando etc.

note.gloss: .i. hóre atá hesséirge et flaithemnas dúib
note.note: i.e. because ye have resurrection and princedom.

note.gloss: .i. ished dogniith ɫ. nataít forculu sicut facitis
note.note: i.e. it is this that ye do. Or go not back sicut facitis.
i.e. they are before.
beyond every one, for they are benefiting you.
i.e. do what they say to you.
all this below is a recapitulation.
i.e. the lazy folk that love to beg of every one.
i.e. this is the toleration which he has mentioned before.
i.e. forgiveness.
i.e. for evil is the retaliation, good is the forgiveness.

note.gloss: [in marg.] Ceist cate indirnig(d)e cen chumsanad nianse dicunt alii combad (c)elebrad trátha (quod) non est uerum Ceist cate (nianse) intain donairber(ta)r inboill uili fri (c)aíngnimu et bertar drogními essib arneigdet iarum fridia quando bonum faciunt .i. tairbertar súili frideícsin maith (ut i)ob dicit pepigi fedus (cum) occulís meis rl.
note.note: Question: what is prayer without ceasing? Easy (to answer): dicunt alii that it is celebration of the canonical hour, quod non est uerum. Question, what is it? Easy to answer: when all the members (of the body) are subdued to good deeds, and evil deeds are put away from them; they pray, then, to God quando honum faciunt, that is, their eyes are inclined to see (the) good, ut Iob dicit etc.
every good thing which he preaches fulfil ye it.
i.e. namely, in the teaching.

note.gloss: .i. rann airegde innaanme quo intellegamus ɫ. spiritus sanctus .i. amal donecomnacht duún
note.note: i.e. the superior part of the mind quo inlellegamus, uel Spiritus sanctus i.e. as it hath been imparted to us.
i.e. without ... vices.
i.e. God is faithful; what He has promised will be true.

note.gloss: .i. non sanctum osculum uigelat alias aeclesias non in deo collectas

note.note: i.e. that it be read out.
i.e. that they may not all be ignorant of it.
i.e. without exception.
i.e. how long (it will be) until Antichrist’s coming.
i.e. a man who carries a taper.

note.gloss: [in marg.] niepir som ainm napstalacte híc aris foirbthe in cách diarroscribad
note.note: he saith not híc (the) name of apostolate, for every one to whom it has been written is perfect.
i.e. each of you loves the other inuicem.

note.gloss: ibarfoirbthetusi in fide et caritate et in patientia
note.note: in your perfection in fide etc.
i.e. strong is your faith in the sufferings.

note.gloss: [in marg.] foditiu fochide duib si tresindippiat fochricci gním pectho do bar célib tresindabia pían ished andédesin didiu bias in die iudicii praemium iustís páena peccatoribus adib dessimrecht si tra dosin tre foditin ingremmen
note.note: endurance of sufferings by you, through which ye will have rewards: commission of sin by your fellows, through which they will have punishment: it is those two things, then, that will be in die iudicii etc. Ye are an ensample, then, thereunto through endurance of persecutions.
i.e. ye will not regret to support them.
i.e. it is certain, it is just.
i.e. O righteous ones!

note.gloss: .i. uitam aeternam amal dombérthar dúnni apstalaib
note.note: i.e. uitam aeternam as will be given to us apostles.
i.e. it will not be like unto the first coming.

note.gloss: .i. dosnaidlibea uili niain nechtar náii indí nachidchualatar et tremitíagat
note.note: i.e. He will visit them all, He will not protect either of them, (namely) those who heard it not and those who transgress it.
i.e. who will endure.
i.e. without remission of tribulation from His presence(?), but destruction.
i.e. from God’s face (is) their destruction.
i.e. through giving reward to them.

note.gloss: .i. intain dombéra dígail forpecthachu et praemia iustís
note.note: i.e. when He will inflict punishment on sinners and (bestow) praemia iustis.

note.gloss: .i. rocreitsidsi aforcell forrogelsamni dúib dilaithiu brátho ɫ. roerbad dúnni forcell dothabirt díbsi illaithiu bratho
note.note: i.e. ye have believed the testimony which we have testified unto you of doomsday. Or we have been entrusted to bear testimony of you on doomsday.
i.e. we pray that the testimony which we give you may be good.

note.gloss: .i. ↄdip atholsom dognedsi ɫ. ↄdibmaith fartolsi
note.note: i.e. that it may be His will which ye do, or that your will may be good.

note.gloss: .i. ↄroib gním irisse lib inneurt hirisse
note.note: i.e. so that ye may have the work of faith in the power of faith.
i.e. for sake of, if ye expect Christ.

note.gloss: .i. hóre aruntáa uili techt archenn crist domess fornn
note.note: i.e. because it remains for us all to go before Christ to have judgment upon us.

note.gloss: níarmad maith lessom incumscugud mall act isarnabǽ étir
note.note: it is not that he liked the slow movement, but that it may not be at all.

note.gloss: .i. uento falsae doctrinae condéirsid aforcital sosceligthide
note.note: so that ye should forsake the evangelical doctrine.
i.e. though they say that Doomsday is at hand.
i.e. this is dearest to me that ye escape.
i.e. of all that he has said.
i.e. of full sin.

note.gloss: .i. christo et membris eius [in marg.] cotí irchre fla(tho) román .i. tóiniud flatho óróma(nib) ɫ. tóiniud niressach inamiriss ɫ. cotí intí diantainm discessio .i. diabul arisainm dosuidiu discessio et refuga
note.note: until the fall of the Romans’ realm shall come, even the coming down of the realm from the Romans; or the coming down of the faithful into unfaith; or until he whose name is Discessio shall come, even the Devil, for Discessio et Refuga is a name for him.
i.e. he will say he possesses every power that belongs to God.
i.e. as if he were God.

note.gloss: seiss itempul amal donessid crist ɫ. dogéntar aidchumtach tempuil less et pridchibid smactu rechto fetarlicce etgebtit iudei inapid et ↄscéra rect núiadnissi
note.note: he will sit in the Temple as Christ sat. Or rebuilding of the Temple will be wrought by him, and he will preach the institutes of the law of the Old Testament, and Iudaei will receive him as lord, and he will destroy the law of the New Testament.
i.e. something which ye do not remember.
i.e. destruction of the Romans’ realm (will take place) before.

note.gloss: .i. rofitid cid aridfuirig afoilsigud .i. ↄtí indaimser doarchet dó
note.note: i.e. ye know what delays his manifestation, till the time come which has been foretold of him.

note.gloss: .i. cinidaccastar ni nachthised agním arandogenadsom iártichte dagní amuntar et dagniat abaill ished inso fodrig
note.note: i.e. though he be not seen. Not that his work has not come, for what he would do after coming his household doth it and his members do it: it is this that delays him.
i.e. while he holds.
on the spot, so that he may not be for long.
provided all this be fulfilled.
Antichrist.
i.e. by the brightness of Christ’s Godhead.
he will be opposed to God with His Gospel.
i.e. they (the prodigia) all will be lying.

note.gloss: dogéna sáibfirtu et sáibairde amal dondrigénsat druid triitsom
note.note: he (Antichrist) will perform false miracles and false signs, as wizards have done it through him.
i.e. they will be perverted into iniquity.
i.e. if they should receive it.

note.gloss: [in marg.] nitellfea doib irchoimted in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos cúr non credidistis christo nianse quia non agnouimus illum et celauit homanitas diuinitatem eius sechrocreitsidsi dodémun ciarudbói colinn imbi immaircide didiu indhí nád arróimsat buith in gloria christi cerubet ipéin ladiabul
note.note: it will be impossible for them to excuse (themselves) in hora iudicii quando dicetur ad illos: Cur non credidistis Christo? “Easy (to answer), quia non agnouimus Illum, et celauit humanitas diuinitatem eius.” “Yet ye have believed in the Devil though he (also) had flesh around him.” It is meet then, that they who have not accepted existence in gloria Christi should be in punishment with the Devil.
i.e. God has elected you.
i.e. into the apostolate, so that ye have taken example from us.
i.e. which ye have.
i.e. through our teaching.
i.e. so that ye be in glory with Christ.

note.gloss: [in marg.] ostendit hic intreodatid filium quando dicit dominus noster patrem quando dicit deus spiritum sanctum quando dicit consulatorem
note.note: ostendit híc the Threeness, Filium etc.

note.gloss: .i. badmaith forṅgnim et formbriathar arbid loor dobar niráil
note.note: i.e. let your deed and your word be good, for it will be enough to commend you.
i.e. from here onwards.
i.e. it is due discipulis etc.
i.e. into every one’s heart.
pray ye for nothing else but the gift of teaching.
i.e. who wish ill to us.
all are not perfect.
i.e. it is manifest that they all are not perfect.
i.e. He is able to protect you.
i.e. it is we trustful.
i.e. ye have fulfilled what we have preached to you.

note.gloss: .i. ↄrogbaid desemrecht dicrist amal rombo ainmnetach oc fulung fochide ɫ. combad ainmn(etich) ocindn(idiu) laithi (brá)th(a)
note.note: i.e. so that ye may take example from Christ, as He was patient in enduring sufferings. Or so that ye should be patient in awaiting Doomsday.
i.e. we beseech of you.
to beg.

note.gloss: .i. ni uainn raucsat ní accatar linn
note.note: i.e. it is not from us they have taken it, they have not seen it with us.
ye are knowing therein.

note.gloss: .i. nongabthe desemrecht diínn nínchruth hí thall .i. non inquiete
note.note: i.e. that ye should take example from us, not in that manner.

note.gloss: .i. nírbommar utmuill ocfoigdi inter uos ɫ. nírbommar tromdi
note.note: i.e. we have not been restless in begging inter uos, or we have not been oppressive.
unless we had bought it with the fruit of our hands.
to make ropes by night, to preach by day.

note.gloss: .i. commimmis angraib dúibsi dogabaal desimrechta díinni
note.note: i.e. so that we may be a pattern to you to take example from us.
we used to say it to you.
i.e. this is its penance for it.

note.gloss: [in marg.] ↄammadarsa andígail forru .i. bot(h doib) cen biad ma(ni)... irgn...
note.note: I have adjudged their punishment on them, that is, for them to be without food, unless they ...

note.gloss: .i. nip arirlami far cúrsagtha manicloimmis forndrogscéla
note.note: i.e. it was not on account of readiness to reproach you unless we should have heard evil tidings of you.

note.gloss: .i. iarfigid dús cia port indib maith óigedacht
note.note: i.e. a seeking to know in what place guesting is good.
i.e. without asking aught of any one.
i.e. blame ye.

note.gloss: .i. duús indip fochunn ícce do aindarpe aoentu fratrum arisrucce dó
note.note: i.e. if perchance his expulsion from the unity of the brethren may be cause of salvation to him, for it is a shame to him.
i.e. let not the correction be hostile.
i.e. correct him.

note.gloss: .i. ↄroib core dúib fricách et dochach fribsi
note.note: i.e. so that there may be peace to you from every one and to every one from you.

note.gloss: .i. commad in so sís roscribad som combad suaíchnid leosom ataa icach epistil asainchomarde sin
note.note: i.e. it would be this below that he wrote: it would be well known to them: in every epistle is this special sign.
i.e. this below.

note.gloss: .i. tadbatsom híc nomen apostoli huare (con)secha alaill indib
note.note: i.e. he manifests híc nomen apostoli because he corrects another thing in them.

note.gloss: isóentu doathir et macc oc mothoóitse for apstalact cucuibsi
note.note: Father and Son are at one in sending me on (the) apostolate unto you.
as it increases and fructifies in you.
i.e. it is he who has first preached to you.
i.e. of knowledge of the Godhead.
i.e. ἀναγωγή.
i.e. the knowledge of the divine mysteries.
so that your good deeds may be abundant.
i.e. of knowledge of God.
i.e. so that we may be in the Kingdom with Christ.
i.e. it is through Him that our sins have been forgiven to us.

note.gloss: fírdelb dei caeli ɫ. per ipsum cognoscitur deus pater
note.note: the very image Dei caeli, uel etc.
i.e. for He is ever existent.
i.e. so that it may be He who is a unique leader.
i.e. the whole fulness Diuinitatis that has dwelt in Christ.
i.e. crux is a name for the act of crucifying.

note.gloss: .i. dorronad síid etermuntir nime et talman
note.note: i.e. peace has been made between the household of heaven and (that) of earth.

note.gloss: .i. spe future glorie bias dúib innim et pridchabthar hisoscélu
note.note: i.e. spe futurae gloriae that ye will have in heaven and which will be preached in the gospel.
i.e. (in hope) that ye might take example from us.

note.gloss: .i. aní dodesta dichomalnad cæsta crist domsa isocca attóo ishéd didiu desta disudiu dul martre tarfarcennsi
note.note: i.e. that which was lacking of the fulfilment of Christ’s Passion by me, at that I am. This, then, is what is wanting of it, to go to martyrdom for your sake.
i.e. the seven things that have been prophesied of Christ.
i.e. in the mysteries of the Godhead till I have uplifted them gentibus.
i.e. that mystery has appeared.
i.e. so that it might be known to them.
i.e. of the salvation of the race of men.
i.e. for not even heaven’s household knows it.
i.e. of science and knowledge of God.

note.gloss: .i. amal rombo foirbthe crist condib foirbthe intí bess inna ellug
note.note: i.e. as Christ was perfect, so that he who is in union with Him may be perfect.

note.gloss: .i. ató occombáig friss imsechim agníme et imgabáil desimrechte de ↄroissinn cutrummus friss et ↄgní som frimsa ocsuidiu
note.note: i.e. I am contending with Him as to imitating His deeds and as to taking example from Him, so that I might attain equality with Him; and He works with me in this.
i.e. good is His share in it.
i.e. great is the solicitude that I have for you.
i.e. Colossians then, in Laodicea they are.
i.e. that they may console (them) lest they be sad for my bonds.
i.e. so that they may have charity towards every one.

note.gloss: .i. confesatar imbed indraith tecomnacht dia doib et condip maith anintliucht
note.note: i.e. that they may know the abundance of the grace that God has imparted to them, and that their understanding may be good.
i.e. the mystery of the salvation of the race of men.

note.gloss: [in marg.] arisand isecne et isfissid cách iar netarcnu crist
note.note: for therein is every one wise and a knower according to knowledge of Christ.

note.gloss: .i. filosophi .i. arnipagliccu felsub olambieidsi sí in christo estis
note.note: i.e. for no philosopher will be acuter than ye will be si etc.
i.e. through thinking of you on account of your perfection.
i.e. in belief in Jesus.
as hath been preached to you, observe.
in the unity of His body.
apostles at first, you afterwards.
be ye strenuous in faith.

note.gloss: .i. denid attlugud buide dodia dicachmaith dogní frib
note.note: i.e. give thanks to God for every good that He does to you.
i.e. though he be acute and eloquent in declaration.
i.e. which perverts into vain-glory.

note.gloss: arishe besad felsub etarcert didúlib etsaigid forru et nebchretem anadiadar dicrist
note.note: for this is (the) usage of philosophers, to dissertate concerning the elements, and to dispute over them, and not to believe what is declared of Christ.

note.gloss: .i. niarcrist pridchit .i. nifitetar amal rongab arissamlid atá quia in ipso habitat rl.
note.note: i.e. not for Christ do they preach, that is, they know Him not as He is, for thus He is, quia etc.

note.gloss: Pelagius: omnis plenitudo diuine naturæ in corpore eius inhabitat .i. ueraciter ɫ. inchorpdid .i. adrothreb láne deachte innachorpsom
note.note: or corporeally, i.e. the fulness of the Godhead has dwelt in His body.

note.gloss: .i. Ceist cate imdibe crist nianse bás etadnacul itheside immafolnget imdibe ódúalchib
note.note: i.e. question, what is Christ’s circumcision? Easy (to answer): death and burial, it is they that effect circumcision from vices.

note.gloss: .i. teora tonna torunni in babitsmo trédenus dosom in sepulcro
note.note: i.e. three waves over us in baptismo; a space of three days to Him in sepulcro.

note.gloss: amal rongab comadnacul duún atá comeisseírge actrocretem oipred dǽ
note.note: as there is co-sepulture to us, (so) there is co-resurrection, provided we believe in God’s working.
there was somewhat there to be given.
whereby death has been decreed to us.
it is not our advantage that has been therein.
He has taken away.
so that it is not at all.
so that it was drowned in sanguine.
i.e. He has won a victory from them.
i.e. through death of His own Body.

note.gloss: .i. nachib mided .i. nachib berar ismachtu rechta fetarlicce innandig et ambiad innallíthu et assapati act bad foirbthe farniress
note.note: i.e. let him not judge you, that is, be ye not borne into the institutions of the Law of the Old Testament, into their drink and their food, into their festivals and their sabbaths; but let your faith be perfect.
i.e. all that has been in the Old Law is a shadow of the New Testament.

note.gloss: quasi dixiset ni dír dúib ní disund act homaldóit docrist
note.note: quasi dixisset: nothing of this is meet for you, but service unto Christ.

note.gloss: .i. ciasberat doaidbdetar físi doib etdotiagat angil andochum nichretidsi
note.note: i.e. though they say that visions are shown to them, and that angels come to them, believe ye it not.
i.e. restlessness causes not benefits.
not in spiritual senses does he boast him.

note.gloss: .i. marudscarsid fritola tre bás crist cid arandluthid caratrad friu iterum Pelagius: elimenta mundi auaritia luxoria et cætera hís similia
note.note: i.e. if ye have separated from the desires (of the flesh) through Christ’s death, why do ye make close a friendship with them iterum?
i.e. because they decay, i.e. there was a perishing.
i.e. it is not without labour to body.

note.gloss: .i. nec carnem in saturitate honorandam ɫ. nibi ifledaib nalígaib frisgní
note.note: or it is not in banquets nor in ... that he practises.
i.e. in the happiness of the glory.
i.e. in the glory.

note.gloss: .i. madhǽ farmbethusi crist robia indocbál less
note.note: i.e. if Christ be your life, ye will have glory with Him.
i.e. in the place wherein He is.

note.gloss: .i. ithé inso boill indsenduini et ishé insenduine fessin .i. uilidetu nandúalche isball didiu cachhæ som et iscorp ati(nól)
note.note: i.e. these are the members of the old man, and this is the old man himself, even the sum of the vices. Each of them, then, is a member, and the collection of them is (the) body.

note.gloss: .i. amal fongníter ídil síc fogníther donaib ánib
note.note: i.e. as idols are served, so service is rendered to riches.
i.e. meditation on sin.
i.e. put from you this burden uitiorum.
i.e. let not one of you deceive another.
i.e. so that we shall be in Jesu’s form, to wit in unity of His Body.
i.e. he deems none of them more distinguished than another.

note.gloss: .i. hominibus .i. actrocretea deacht etdóinecht crist bitless indhuili dáni etnahu(ili) timn(e)
note.note: i.e. provided he believe in Christ’s Godhead and Manhood, all the gifts and all the testaments will be his.

note.gloss: .i. gaibid immib anetach macc cóimsa amal no ndad maicc cóima .i. uiscera ishé i(nde)chellt (as)beir (som)
note.note: i.e. put on you this raiment of dear sons as ye are dear sons, i.e. uiscera, this is the garment that he mentions.
i.e. forbearance to every one towards his fellow.
what ye commit among you.
mutual forgiveness.
i.e. above them, or beyond all the praedicta.

note.gloss: .i. óentad etruib immanetar ɫ. etruib et dia
note.note: i.e. of unity among you mutually, or between you and God.
i.e. to you towards God and to God towards you.
i.e. to be in unity of Christ’s Body.
i.e. give ye thanks to God.

note.gloss: badatrab nábad cuit tadill ished aatrab didiu aprecept et acomal(nad)
note.note: let it be a residence: let it not be a passing visit: this, then, is its residence, teaching it and fulfilling it.
i.e. of knowledge of God.

note.gloss: ished tra forchain som híc aratucca cách acanas condibréil less indinne bess and et ari(n)réla dochách rodchluinethar
note.note: this then is what he teaches Me, that every one should understand what he recites, so that the sense which is in it may be clear to him and that he may make it clear to every one who hears it.

note.gloss: .i. icomalnad timne ísu et itogarmaim aanme
note.note: i.e. in fulfilling Jesu’s commandments and in calling on His name.
giving thanks unto God for your salvation through Him.
let the obedience be in Domino.
i.e. because they are subditae.
i.e. through correction with bitterness (and) without faults (on their part).
i.e. mournful.

note.gloss: .i. (for)cain som híc seruos obidire et seruire dominis arnaérbarat domini robtar irlithi ar(mog)e dúun resíu tised hiress robtar anirlithi iarum níáil tra insin doepirt olsesom ar nidoforcitul an(irl)atad dodechuid
note.note: i.e. híc he teaches seruos oboedire et seruire dominis, lest domini should say ‘our servants were obedient to us before the Faith had come: they afterwards became disobedient.’ ‘It is not proper, then, that that should be said,’ saith he, ‘for not to teach disobedience hath it come.’

note.gloss: .i. nibo intain nombeid arsúil tantum dogneith toil far coimded
note.note: i.e. it must not be when ye are before (His) eye tantum that ye should do your master’s will.
i.e. in desire, that is, let it be for a divine reward.

note.gloss: .i. (a)dígail forib ma(nba)d irlaithi arrofitir side imbo hochridiu fanacc
note.note: i.e. His punishment on you if ye be not obedient, for He knows whether it be from (your) heart or not.
i.e. ye will have the heavenly heritage in reward of your prayers.
i.e. he will suffer punishment for his ill-doing.

note.gloss: .i. (int)í bes anirlithe ɫ. nád chomalnathar anasberar friss rambia dígal tara ǽssi .i. cid incoimdiu dodgné friamug (cid) inmug friachoimdid
note.note: i.e. he who is disobedient, or who does not fulfil what is said to him, shall suffer punishment therefor, that is, whether the lord do it to his servant, or the servant to his lord.

note.gloss: sed operum eter sóir et dóir eter mug etcoimdid
note.note: both free and unfree, both servant and lord.

note.gloss: cosc innacoimded inso arnápforóil acumachte foramogaib
note.note: the correction of the lords, this, that their power over their servants be not excessive.

note.gloss: .i. quasi dixisset abi mogasi dano atá far cóimdiu innim
note.note: ye are servants, then: your lord is in heaven.

note.gloss: .i. ishæ inso infognam donchoimdid nemdu et isfriu huili atbeirsom ón Pelagius: negligentis enim et dormientis oratio nihil impetrare ualet
note.note: i.e. this is the service (due) to the heavenly Lord, and it is to them all that he says this.
i.e. with prayer for you yourselves.

note.gloss: .i. conroib búaid precepte duun tresaníccatar híli
note.note: i.e. so that we may have the gift of teaching, through which many may be saved.

note.gloss: .i. euangelium .i. cororélam rúna incholnigthea et geine crist et achésta
note.note: i.e. so that we might manifest (the) mysteries of (the) Incarnation and Birth of Christ and of His Passion.
i.e. therefore am I a captive, because I preach that mystery.
i.e. without connivance.

note.gloss: .i. ipricept narrún diade doib et innanebthórtrommad dochuingid neich cuccu
note.note: i.e. in the teaching of the divine mysteries to them and in not pestering them by asking aught of them.
i.e. the laity.
the time that ye have wasted(?) through your evil deeds, redeem ye through your deeds in the time Noui (Testamenti).

note.gloss: .i. taibred formbríathar ráth spirito dochách trefoirbthetith farprecepte
note.note: i.e. let your word give the grace of the Spirit to every one through the perfection of your teaching.

note.gloss: .i. conirmissid taithesc coir do cachgrád et do cach aís
note.note: i.e. so that you may attain the answer proper to every grade and to every age.
his service is faithful.
i.e. in serving God.
i.e. so that ye may know tidings of us.

note.gloss: .i. ↄfessid dano fiss scél uáimse etarnábadtoirsig dimchuimriugsa
note.note: i.e. so that ye may also know tidings of me, and that you may not be mournful at my captivity.
i.e. it is together that they have been sent.
i.e. both my bonds and those to whom I preach.
your salutation from them.
i.e. which he has preached to you.
i.e. of the Jews are they.
in teaching.
i.e. of yourselves is his race.
i.e. he prays God for you constantly.
i.e. I bear witness that he hath a great love for you.
i.e. he loves you all.

note.gloss: dicit híc ainm dáno dorigeni itossug
note.note: dicit híc the name of the profession which he practised at first.
have peace towards them, love ye good men.
i.e. all their household.

note.gloss: .i. act arroilgither ind epistilse dúibsi berthir uáib laudocensibus etdoberthar indæpistil scríbther dosuidib ↄárlægthar duibsi doadbadar híc nádroscribad dosuidib cedacht etarrobe scribent doiib
note.note: i.e. provided that this epistle has been read out to you it shall be carried from you Laodicensibus, and the epistle which is being written to them shall be brought so that it may be read out to you. It is shown híc that it had not been written to these, yet it contained a writing to them.
i.e. so that ye may read out.
to teaching every one.
it would have been a notary who had written it hitherto.

note.gloss: .i. sainred do daltu anisiu quia asper fuit
note.note: i.e. this is special to a pupil quia, etc.

note.gloss: .i. precor multifarie sicut rogaui .i. islerithir inso nonguidimse dia nerutsu amal rotgádsa imanad inephis sechropo léirsón. Aliter adit ubi dicit hoc praeceptum tibi commendo filii timothe et ismedóntestimin áfil etarru
note.note: i.e. I beseech God for thee as urgently as I have besought thee about staying in Ephesus, though this was urgently. Aliter etc. what is between them is the middle of a period.
i.e. it is for this that thou wouldst have remained.
i.e. genealogies and origins of tales.
i.e. an end is not brought out of them.
which every man ... about another.
i.e. they produce not edification of faith.
i.e. this is better than everything.
i.e. this is the place wherein it dwells.
i.e. from the three things which he has mentioned before.
i.e. so that they may be making law with kings.
i.e. not meet is what they say.

note.gloss: .i. ní dodígail forfírianu tuccad recht acht isdochosc cintach
note.note: i.e. the Law was not given to punish the righteous, but it is to correct the guilty.
one who slays his kindred.
i.e. to the torturers.
i.e. that I might preach His glory.
i.e. I was reviling them.
i.e. so that I have been healed de peccato.

note.gloss: .i. beim foris inso ɫ. istitul indí archiunn
note.note: i.e. a recapitulation this, or it is the title of that which is ahead.
i.e. it is manifest in that He has saved me.
i.e. so that it might be an example of every one’s salvation.
i.e. patience towards my sin, and afterwards my salvation.
i.e. it is just to praise Him.
i.e. without any end; for it is unlimitedly that He bestows His benefits.
as hath been preached to thee at first.

note.gloss: habens fidem .i. isamlid bid maith domílte
note.note: i.e. thus will thy warfare be good.

note.gloss: .i. roscarsat friæ .i. asbertar ananman arnagaba nech desimrecht diib intalaxander hí sin robochert ut ipse dicit alaxander ærarius multa mala mihi fecit
note.note: i.e. they have separated from it: i.e. their names are mentioned that no one may take example from them. That Alexander had been an artizan ut etc.

note.gloss: .i. pænitentiæ ɫ. dodásacht .i. nibí indásachtach friǽicṅdar arni irmadadar
note.note: i.e. poenitentiae or to madness, i.e. the madman does not blaspheme for he does not attain it.
i.e. general love (is) that.

note.gloss: .i. act robǽ quies et tranquilitas regibus bieid dano dúnni andedesin et pietas et castitas lasodin
note.note: i.e. provided there be quies et tranquillitas regibus we too shall have those two things and pietas et castitas therewith.

note.gloss: Ceist cid natat sláin indhuli mátchobra quia omnia quaecumque uoluit dominus fecit nianse hóre nád comeicnigther nech fritoil ɫ. is pars pro toto arnifil ceneel nabelre isinbiuth dinadrícthe nech ɫ. indíi adchobrasom dohícc ithé ronícc tantum .i. qui uult omnes homines saluos fieri salui ut augustinus dicit. Augustinus Tamquam diceretur nullum hominem fieri saluum posse nisi is quem ipse fieri uoluerit
note.note: Question, why are not all saved if He desires it quia etc. Not hard (to say): because no one is constrained against (his) will. Or it is pars pro toto, for there is neither race nor nation in the world of which some one shall not have been saved. Or those whom He desires to save, it is they whom He has saved tantum.

note.gloss: amal asnóindia omnium adcobra ícc omnium
note.note: as He is the one God omnium He desires the salvation omnium.
i.e. between Himself and men.
He hath given Himself on the Cross.
i.e. for salvation of every one.

note.gloss: .i. dorratad teist de isindaimsir sin hiforcomnucuir intaidchric per crucem
note.note: i.e. a testimony of Him had been given in that time at which the redemption per crucem came to pass.
i.e. this is the mystery of that testimony which I preach.
i.e. without division.
i.e. an adornment which is proper for faith.
i.e. braided.
i.e. what is becoming, to wit, modesty and chastity.

note.gloss: .i. na imchomarcad ní in æclesia sed uiros interrogat domi
note.note: i.e. let her not ask aught in ecclesia, sed etc.
i.e. unless it be her (own) children.
i.e. let it not be her who is leader.
for the man is enough to speak for her.

note.gloss: .i. issiniu infer et istairismechu quam mulier
note.note: i.e. the man is elder and is stabler quam mulier.

note.gloss: .i. issamlid sin dano bid ícc disi tuistiu claindde
note.note: i.e. it is thus then that the bearing of children will be salvation to her.
which he says below.

note.gloss: .i. marterium ante omnes ɫ. dénad gnímu epsc(uip)
note.note: or let him do a bishop’s deeds.
i.e. these are a bishop’s deeds which he mentions below.
before receiving orders, (and) after baptism.
in receiving every one.
i.e. so that he be skilled in knowledge and wisdom.
i.e. he drinks not wine until he is drunk.

note.gloss: .i. ní bii debuith do fri nech
note.note: i.e. he has no quarrel with any one.
i.e. he is not avaricious.
i.e. his children in subjection to him.

note.gloss: .i. manirochoscasom amuntir intain biís cengrád ni uisse toisigecht sochuide do
note.note: i.e. if he cannot correct his household when he is without orders, not proper for him is the leadership of a multitude.
i.e. not a novice.

note.gloss: .i. indígal dochoid for diabul iar nimmarmus ar nadecha foir
note.note: i.e. lest the punishment which came upon the Devil after sin should come upon him.

note.gloss: .i. ↄdarta cách teist foir asnuisse grad foir
note.note: i.e. so that every one may bear witness concerning him that orders are meet upon him.

note.gloss: .i. ondáes tuaithe eterarrobæ cindas abésse [in marg. inf.] arndip maith nairlethar amuntir ritecht gráid foir is irdorcu epirt iarum
note.note: i.e. from the lay-folk amongst whom he has been (as to) what sort are his morals. (Oportet) that he care well for his house- hold before taking orders; it is needless to say afterwards (i.e. after taking orders).

note.gloss: .i. nipsain anasberat et immarádat ɫ. nadulburiu
note.note: i.e. let not what they say and what they think be different: or (bilingues means) the slow of speech.
i.e. they shall not sell the divine gifts for worldly gain.
i.e. for they are teachers of (the) faith.

note.gloss: .i. doberr teist diib ritecht gráid forib
note.note: i.e. let testimony concerning them be given before they are ordained.
i.e. for there were deaconesses there at that time.
i.e. before ordination.

note.gloss: .i. machomalnit angrád ɫ. apud plebiles marudchoiscset ammuintir
note.note: i.e. if they fulfil their orders: or apud plebiles if they have corrected their household.

note.gloss: .i. praemium in regno caelesti ɫ. isuisse grad nepscuip dothabirt forru
note.note: or it is proper to confer a bishop’s rank upon them.
i.e. take heed of my coming. I shall soon come.
i.e. I know not my goings as regards this.
i.e. that thou shouldst teach and live.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (.i.) isisin rafetar (a)ngil arrobói i(fla)ith arsuidib (fé)ssin ɫ. roardrigestar dúnni óan(g)lib inaidchi ingene
note.note: i.e. it is therein that angels know Him, for He was in the kingdom before them; or it had appeared to us from angels on the night of the Nativity.
i.e. through unfaith.

note.gloss: .i. ciaso demnithir so forcomnucuir bieid aimser nad creitfider et dosluinfider
note.note: i.e. though it is so certainly that it has happened, there will be a time when it will be disbelieved and denied.
i.e. it is this which separates them from it.

note.gloss: .i. is seichti issain aní forchanat etdogniat
note.note: i.e. in hypocrisy. Different are what they teach and what they do.
i.e. branded or burnt.

note.gloss: .i. conrobad adtlugud buide dodia treu a fidelibus
note.note: i.e. so that there might be rendering of thanks unto God through them a fidelibus.

note.gloss: .i. mad cofoirbthetu hirisse arfemthar et attlugud ṁbuide
note.note: i.e. if it be received with perfection of faith and thanksgiving.
i.e. through the blessing that is recited before a meal.
i.e. if these be the words that thou teachest.
i.e. which thou hast heard from me.
i.e. old tales of the Law which false apostles declare.
i.e. not for long is the beauty of the body.
i.e. it is good here and there.
i.e. which he says below.
i.e. it is worth keeping.
i.e. therefore we are in evil plight.
i.e. these are the special favourites of the king.
i.e. so that every one may take example from thee.
i.e. that thou mayst understand what thou hast read, that is, in fulfilling it and in teaching it.
i.e. encouraging a multitude in faith.
i.e. when orders have been conferred upon thee.
i.e. in fulfilling it.

note.gloss: .i. ↄfestar cách dofoirbthetu ↄrogba cách desimrecht díit
note.note: i.e. so that every one may know thy perfection, so that eyery one may take example from thee
i.e. to fulfil it.
i.e. so that thou mayst teach it.
i.e. it will be salvation to thyself.
i.e. whosoever shall hear thee a-teaching.
i.e. as it were (a father).
i.e. the elder women.

note.gloss: .i. amal dorígensat sidi aaltramsi dénadsi goiri doibsem
note.note: i.e as they have nurtured her (so) let her maintain them.
i.e. so that she may be perfect.
i.e. of their own household.

note.gloss: .i. mabeid ní aratechta uidua maccu ɫ. tuistidi it cairigthi inmaicsi et intuistidi cendethidin dissi 23 .i. creitmech sin asmessa ancreitmech
note.note: i.e. if it be that uidua has children or parents, these children and the parents are to be blamed when they do not take care of her.

note.gloss: .i. is sí inso fedb asuisse dogoiri inæclis archuit óisa et bésa
note.note: i.e. this is the widow whom it is just to maintain in the Church as regards age and morals.
i.e. when she was among lay-folk.
i.e. these are the morals that bring her into the Church.
i.e. quando fuit among lay-folk.
if she has received guests.
if she has had so much humility.

note.gloss: .i. madudrimthirid óis carcre ministrauit .i. cibo et uestæ
note.note: i.e. if she has attended prisoners.

note.gloss: .i. manidtesarbi ní dimaith assagnímaib intain rombói etirtuáith isuisse a airitiu inæclis
note.note: i.e. if nothing of good has been wanting to her actions while she was among the lay-folk, it is just to receive her into the Church.
i.e. (when) they are wanton.
i.e. if they marry.

note.gloss: .i. ithæ inso bésse inna fedb asluat hiris
note.note: i.e. these are the manners of the widows who evade the faith.
i.e. visiting and being without doing aught.
i.e. women’s talk.
i.e. it seems to me better than to receive them into the Church.

note.gloss: .i. arnaroib eícndag indraith diadi trea peccad som ɫ. maledicti gratia
note.note: i.e. that there be no blasphemy of the divine grace through their sin.
i.e. they have gone again to worldly desires.
i.e. so that they may provide their livelihood.
i.e. lest their maintenance in the Church be necessary.

note.gloss: .i. comalnad neich forchanat et biad et éitach doib
note.note: i.e. fulfilling what they teach, and food and raiment to them.

note.gloss: .i. indhí pridchite et forchanat brethir dǽ
note.note: i.e. they that preach and teach God’s word.

note.gloss: .i. desimrecht fetarlicci inso do imthrenugud asnuisse tasgid et æítiud ind áisso gráid etlegind
note.note: i.e. this is an example from the Old Law to confirm (the doctrine) that it is just to victual and clothe the clergy and students.
i.e. just is the reward of his labour to every one.
i.e. to fasten a sin or transgression upon him.

note.gloss: .i. maniastat indarecht peccad foir uetus et nouum ɫ. natrirecte .i. naturae rl. isiarum iscomainsidi maniscomalnadar
note.note: i.e. unless the two laws–Vetus et Nouum–fasten a sin upon him, or the three laws, to wit, naturae, etc. he is then to be reproached unless he fulfils them.
i.e. let as many as know their sin know their reprimanding.
i.e. as many as have heard it.
i.e. I beseech.

note.gloss: .i. cogitatione ɫ. consilio ɫ. nitoibre grád fornech cena ætarcne riam
note.note: or thou shalt not confer orders on any one without knowing him previously.

note.gloss: .i. fadess nofathuaith manip tre dagcomairli dognether
note.note: i.e. to south or to north, unless it be done by good counsel.

note.gloss: .i. nitaibre grád fornech ↄfeser ainruccus dongrádsin
note.note: i.e. thou shalt not confer orders on any one until thou knowest his fitness for those orders.

note.gloss: .i. armad pecthaid intí forataibre grád lenit apecthe dindí dobeir angrád
note.note: i.e. for if he on whom thou conferrest orders is a sinner, his sins cleave to him who confers the orders.
i.e. that it might not be an accession of illness to thee.
for the gastric disease abides on thee.
for thy infirmity continually.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. nitaibre grád fornech causa apectha ɫ. achaingníma arbiit alaili and rofinnatar apecthe rosíu docói grád forru, alaili isiarum rofinnatar berir dano frilaa brátha
note.note: i.e. thou shouldst not confer orders on any one causa of his sin or of his good deed: for there are some whose sins are found out before their ordination, others (whose sins) are (first) known afterwards. Reference is made, then, to Doomsday.
i.e. there are virtues there that are manifest.
i.e. it is after a time that the other good deeds are discovered.
i.e. it is very difficult to conceal the good.
i.e. the correction of the slaves this below.

note.gloss: .i. arnaǽrbarthar roptar irlithi armoge dún ↄtanicc hiress et itanirlithi iarum
note.note: i.e. lest it be said our slaves were obedient to us until the faith came, and they are disobedient afterwards.
i.e. which I preach.
i.e. he is haughty and he is ignorant.

note.gloss: .i. dobeir cesti dochách et ni maith less cia gabthar do
note.note: i.e. he puts questions to every one and he likes not that (an answer) should be given(?) to him.
i.e. mutual contests with bitterness.
i.e. to each against the other.
i.e. mutual questions.
i.e. each gives judgment on the other.
i.e. mutual complaints and reproaches.
i.e. no one who does that has sense.

note.gloss: .i. asberat isar indeb isdénti tol dǽ
note.note: i.e. who say that God’s will is to be done for sake of gain.

note.gloss: .i. coimsetu biid et ǽtich ní rofera tantum
note.note: i.e. a pittance of food and raiment, just what is sufficient.
i.e. we brought no provision into this world with us.
i.e. we shall not carry it out then.
i.e. the way that He supplies us.
i.e. let us be thankful, this is our good counsel.

note.gloss: .i. iscor lame ardodced buith ocairbiathad sainte
note.note: i.e. it is giving a hand to(?) unhappiness to be feeding covetousness.

note.gloss: .i. ished insin allínn ingaib diabul peccatores
note.note: i.e. that is the net wherein the Devil takes peccatores.
i.e. constant craving semper.
i.e. to death.
i.e. they have separated from (the) faith.
i.e. perpetual languishing to them.
i.e. it is juster for thee.
i.e. which there is for thee in heaven.
i.e. so that thou mayst deliver it on the day of death or of doom.
as hath been prophesied.

note.gloss: .i. doadbadar híc bríg inna persine dodiccfa asmó de focíaltar
note.note: i.e. híc is shown the might of the Person that will so come, who is the more expected.
i.e. it is a fitting triad to Him.
i.e. with an apostle’s power.
i.e. it is He who is the well of the treasures.

note.gloss: .i. condipmaith afuirec innim etↄrobat inhellug coirp crist innim
note.note: i.e. so that their provision in heaven may be good, and that they may be in union with Christ’s Body in heaven.
i.e. thus is its preservation.
i.e. a dissertation concerning sins and worldly conversation.
i.e. imperfect mutual questions.
or beyond faith.
i.e. who have fallen away.
i.e. it is not without God’s counsel though.
i.e. my deeds are not at variance with my rank and my calling.
of the whole of my pupils.
i.e. Dei et to him to every one.
I myself.

note.gloss: .i. hóbói mochland et mochenéel isocfrecur céill dæ atáa isocca dano attósa
note.note: i.e. since my clan and my kindred came into being, it has been engaged in worshipping God; I too am at it.
i.e. praying God for thee continually.
it were much to me that thou hadst not separated from me.

note.gloss: .i. intain ronanissiu domhéisse nírbo accur lat
note.note: i.e. when thou hast remained after me it was no joy to thee.
i.e. provided we converse together.
i.e. in thy grandmother.
i.e. this is her name.

note.gloss: .i. rofetarsa isfoirbthe do hiresso batoich deit dano arbafoirbthe hires domathar etdosenmathar
note.note: i.e. I know thy faith is perfect: it were natural for thee, moreover, for the faith of thy mother and of thy grandmother was perfect.
i.e. I am sure that thou hast it.
i.e. if it has slept a little through fear of tribulations.
i.e. that we should be timid in sufferings.
i.e. that is the triad which sustains (power, love, discipline).

note.gloss: .i. nabad mebul lat precept crist crochthi
note.note: i.e. be not ashamed to teach Christ crucified.
i.e. be not mournful though I be in prison.
i.e. both fulfilling it and teaching it.

note.gloss: .i. niba anse duit iar neurt inspirito nóib
note.note: i.e. it will not be hard for thee according to the strength of the Holy Ghost.

note.gloss: .i. hóre arinrobe buith inelluch coirp crist
note.note: i.e. because it had remained for us to be in union with Christ’s Body.

note.gloss: .i. fo besad fir trebuir crenas tíir diachlainnd cidrisíu robǽ cland les issamlid arrobertsom arnícc ni cidrisíu robeimmis etir
note.note: i.e. after the manner of a prudent man who buys land for his children even before he has children, it is thus that He has designed our salvation even before we existed at all.
i.e. how life and immortality are to be pursued.
this is my rank.
i.e. because I am the teacher of the gentiles.
i.e. I am not ashamed that I suffer it.
i.e. that he is a supreme being.

note.gloss: .i. rodbodia adroni etↄnói arrad file andsom ɫ. ishésom adroni dodia infochricc file do innim etisdia cota óeiade treagnímosom
note.note: i.e. either God has committed and preserves the grace that there is in him; or it is he that has committed to God the reward that there is for him in heaven, and it is God who preserves that through his deeds.
i.e. fulfil them sicut audisti.
i.e. which heal (both) body and soul.
i.e. their names are mentioned that it may be a shame to them.
i.e. to the household.
i.e. before my captivity and in my captivity.
i.e. he has not been ashamed of my friendship although I have been a captive.
i.e. because it was sollicite (that he sought me).

note.gloss: .i. ismó afius deitsiu andorigeni dimaith frimsa
note.note: i.e. thou knowest better what good he has done unto me.
i.e. strengthen thyself.
i.e. may it not escape thee.

note.gloss: .i. ind hí rochualatar inprecept et inmairb atathestis donuccussa do deimnigud moprecepte
note.note: i.e. they who have heard the doctrine and the dead, are the testes which I have brought to assure my doctrine.
i.e. preach to them.
i.e. they will be faithful through that teaching.
i.e. in teaching and fulfilling.
i.e. because, then, thou art bonus miles.
i.e. provided there be nothing on (his) conscience.

note.gloss: .i. dobeirsom tra cosmulius inmílti domundi híc
note.note: i.e. he puts, then, a similitude of the worldly warfare híc.

note.gloss: .i. ished didiu alligitime scarad fri indeb indomuin ettol dǽ do dénum
note.note: i.e. this, then, is the legitime, to separate from the gain of the world and to do God’s will.
i.e. that thou mayst understand it.
i.e. to answer those who deny (the) resurrection.
i.e. as I preach it.
i.e. so that I abide in bonds and in prisons.
i.e. though I be in a prison and in a bond.
i.e. that they may take example from me.
i.e. through imitating me.
i.e. salvation with glory following it.
i.e. in sovranty.

note.gloss: .i. hifírad neich dorairngert .i. dígal fornn mani cretem
note.note: i.e. in making true what He has promised, even punishment upon us unless we believe.
i.e. so that what He has promised is untrue.
i.e. when thou beseechest every one for its fulfilment.
i.e. quarrels and questions.
i.e. it is no profit for good.
i.e. it is, however, good for this.
i.e. so that there may be no vices in thee.
i.e. let not thy deeds make void what thou sayest.
i.e. philosophy and dialectic.
i.e. they effect nothing else.

note.gloss: .i. amal tuthle ɫ. ailsin Pelagius: cancer esse dicitur uulnus quod in mammellís feminarum nascitur, quibus nissi cito subentum fuerit cum ad cór uirus serpendo peruenerit nullum ulltra remedium est. Ita hereticorum uitanda sunt eloquia
note.note: i.e. like a swelling or gangrene.

note.gloss: .i. ished anesséirge leu maic indegaid anathre ɫ. tuáth dǽ adóiri
note.note: i.e. this they deem the resurrection: sons succeeding their fathers, or God’s people (coming) out of bondage.
i.e. it can never be moved.

note.gloss: .i. stabilitatis ɫ. fiuss do amuntire ut dicit nouit rl.
