note.note: or knowledge to Him of His household.

note.note: i.e. teaching repentance lest the heretics say, ‘because it is in contumeliam to us we will not be at repentance.’
i.e. the Lord will abide therein.
i.e. provided he cleanse himself by repentance.
i.e. of pride and restlessness.
i.e. this is better.

note.gloss: .i. amal ata cáinchumracig side armbacháinchomraccachso ɫ. cáinchomracc deit friu
note.note: i.e. as these are benevolent, that thou mayst be benevolent, or have thou benevolence towards them.
i.e. as heretics and false apostles do.
i.e. therefore it is to be avoided.
i.e. it is not proper for a bondslave of God to be at strife.

note.gloss: .i. cense fricách eter carit etescarit ut beati mítes
note.note: i.e. gentleness to every one, both friend and foe, ut ‘Beati mites.’
i.e. easy to teach.
i.e. for not becoming is harshness(?) in reproaching.
i.e. if perchance they may repent it.
i.e. to satisfaction(?).
i.e. take heed of this.
i.e. to body and soul.

note.gloss: .i. ni ↄchechrat act ní bas tol doib
note.note: i.e. they will love nothing but what is their will.
towards God and man.
i.e. slandering every one.
on everything.
i.e. bitter to every one.
i.e. towards any one.

note.gloss: .i. móa léu sercc atuile quam dei
note.note: i.e. they prefer love of their will to (love) of God.

note.gloss: .i. asberat istol dǽ forchanat et nisí dongníat
note.note: i.e. they say it is God’s will that they teach, and it is not it that they do.

note.gloss: .i. consoibat cách treu aritmathi side ocaslug
note.note: i.e. they deceive every one through them, for these are good at seduction.
i.e. who commit every sin through their seduction.
i.e. continual learning to them.
for each contends with the other.

note.note: i.e. two Egyptian wizards who had been contending with Moses; and the Law records them not, but his own tradition, for he was skilled in the whole Old Testament.
i.e. corrupted (is) their mind.
i.e. false their faith.
i.e. they shall deceive no further.

note.gloss: .i. rofitir cách angnímu etacomroircnea amal rombátar
note.note: i.e. every one knows their deeds and their errors as they have been.
i.e. all from this onwards is of taking an example.

i.e. they will become worse and worse.
i.e. evil them selves

by His kingdom.

i.e. to fables and stories of the Old Law.

who shall care for (His coming) in bonis operibus.
without separation.
to come with thee hither.

i.e. it is best for thee that he come not with thee; avoid him!

note.note: i.e. in my first teaching, i.e. by which I defended the Gospel.
i.e. may God forgive it to them!

note.note: i.e. He will receive me into His kingdom.

note.note: i.e. my faith does not contravene the faith of those who have best believed in Christ.

note.note: the life which He has promised, that is the Word, and He has manifested it when it seemed to him seasonable.

note.note: i.e. it has been entrusted to me according to His will.
which is between us.
i.e. to our faith.
i.e. arranging the conferment of orders.

note.gloss: .i. nípsartholach achland ɫ. né ab aliis accussetur pro luxsoria
note.note: i.e. let not his children be lustful.

for it is a fault of his if his household be evil.
for not proper is sin with him.
fond of drink.

note.note: that he may scrutinise what he may teach to save every one.

i.e. which saves body and soul.

that is of the Jews.
i.e. from faith into unfaith.
i.e. not proper for sanctification is what they teach.
i.e. so that they may get the world’s lucre.

note.note: look at the testimony which their own poet has given, so that it is meet to beware of them and to teach them.
i.e. they follow falsehoods from covetousness.
i.e. evil beasts who pour forth blood from cruelty.
i.e. gorged or greedy.

note.gloss: leiscc .i. fri fognam gréssich foigde napronn

i.e. on account of these four things.
they are corrected that they may be good.
tales and old stories and superstitious commands.

note.gloss: .i. membra .i. menme corp animm imbráti gnímæ
note.note: i.e. mind, body, soul, thoughts, deeds.
i.e. unless their mens be pure et etc.
their mind and their conscience are defiled.
their deeds conflict with their words.
i.e. because they do not fulfil quod praedicant.
which is fitting to God.
after fulfilling it.
i.e. which saves body and soul.
i.e. delightful is a sober old man.
i.e. without sin.
uigelat that which is not holy.

in loaning (commodare) and lending (mutuo dare).
i.e. in every lowly service.

note.gloss: .i. arnaérbarthar o chretsit nintá airli armban
note.note: i.e. lest it should be said, since they have believed we have not the management(?) of our wives.
i.e. that every one may take ensample from thy works.
these are bona opera.
i.e. that he may revere.

note.gloss: madinchrudso bemmi .i. cocomalnammar apridchimme et commandessimrecht dochach
note.note: if we be in this wise, to wit, that we fulfil what we preach and that we be an example to every one.
i.e. let them not take away what is entrusted to them.
i.e. let them be faithful as to everything.
i.e. that every grade may fulfil it.

note.gloss: comtangad cách forcital crist arnicol do attá adeolid iarcúul caích

when we expect.

in union with Christ’s Body.
with an apostle’s command.
i.e. be not indulgent in proclaiming his sin to every one.
whether they deserve it, or deserve it not.

note.gloss: tacair cense ocinforcitul eramus enim rl.
note.note: meet is gentleness in the teaching.
i.e. for the Law forbade us not.
i.e. we folk of the Law mutually.
i.e. it is for great affection that there has come the taking of flesh by Christ.
the taking of flesh by Him.
i.e. not by works of (the) righteousness of (the) Law.
yet we supposed it was righteousness.

note.gloss: .i. ni arfírinni rechto immurgu ronnhícc sed misericordia eius
note.note: i.e. not, however, for (the) righteousness of (the) Law has He saved us, sed, etc.
to every one.
i.e. because they are in fide.
i.e. they are not utilia.

i.e. let him not wear thee out in admonishing him any longer.
who does nothing for the admonition given to him.

note.gloss: .i. doanad dartéssi siu arnafarcabtis cen forcitlaid
note.note: i.e. to remain in thy stead lest they should be left without a teacher.
i.e. I have determined to be there this winter.
of their instruction that they may be versed in teaching.

note.gloss: .i. amal astoisc fribiathad naforcitlaide ɫ. amal astoisc frifoirbthetid caingníme naforcitlaide fadesine
note.note: i.e. as it is need to support the teachers, or, as it is need for the perfecting of the good deeds of the teachers themselves.
a salutation to thee is brought from them.

note.gloss: .i. robói debuid dophilomóin frisuide etdocoid onessimus iarum dochum poil forlongis roscrib pol iarum hanc æpistolam ut susciperetur onessimus.
note.note: i.e. Philemon had had a quarrel with him, and Onesimus then had gone to Paul into exile. Paul then had written hanc epistolam ut etc.
i.e. in teaching and fulfilling (the) gospel.
to all thy household.
that it may be clear and that every one may take example from it.
that ye may understand and that ye may fulfil every good (thing).
that which I need.
I have this peculiarity.
for it is thus he is.
i.e. .... faithful.
as it were my soul.
I could wish that he were with myself because of his faithfulness.
in which I am (now) for the sake of the gospel.

note.gloss: acht niainfed liumsa mainbed maith latsu
note.note: but he would not remain with me unless it should seem good to thee.

note.gloss: conabad éicen doberad ní domsa huaitsu act combadtol
note.note: that it should not be necessity which should give me aught from thee, but that it should be free will.

note.gloss: bieid bes ferr de tra .i. ut aeternum illum rl.
note.note: there will be something better therefore then, i.e. ut, etc.

note.gloss: .i. dofognam duit ɫ. in fide aeternus
note.note: i.e. to serve thee.

note.gloss: frater brathir infectso isbrathir deit iarcolinn et in fide domini

as if it were I myself that had gone to thee.

note.note: i.e. from what I shall be able: uel in orationibus meis: or that I may not say to thee I have a claim upon thee, i.e. I will not say it and I will not reproach thee with it.

note.gloss: .i. atfechem dom etdalugub són pro suscipione eius uiri
note.note: i.e. thou art a debtor to me, and I will forgive it pro etc.

note.gloss: attá immurgu asbéer ego té rl.

note.gloss: act dorronai cori frissom dogné quod dico

note.gloss: bid mó dongenaesiu oldaas rofoided cucut

at receiving Onesimus.
i.e. I know it will be granted to you so that I shall come unto you.
we twain are (now) in bonds for Christ’s sake.

i.e. not through many Persons, sed, etc.

a very son by nature, not from adoption.

i.e. His, then, are the angels.
for breathing salvation to every one.

note.gloss: [in marg.] (is)deacht asrubart inso fridóinecht isand didiu bieit anamait foachossaibsom intain neidfider carcar ifirnn fordemnib etpecthachaib

under the power of the Manhood.
because it is the Son of the Godhead who has ministered unto it.
that we may not lapse into perdition in the manner of a swift stream.
so that its fulfilment became necessary.
present death.
through miracles.

i.e. that He should be made perfect.

who used to command death to every one.

note.note: i.e. it is from them He has received flesh, and it is they whom He hath redeemed etc.

note.gloss: .i. amal ronsóir fesin sóirfed cách cretfes and
note.note: i.e. as He has delivered Himself (in His temptation), He will deliver every one who shall believe in him.

note.gloss: quem confitemur ba apstal cidmoysi hore baó dia dofoided act nitat cosmili
note.note: Moses too was an apostle, because he was sent from God, but they are not alike.
he has not been a betrayer.
i.e. how much!

note.gloss: leissom atech didiu ⁊ ishe ↄidrotig fer imr̃ diamuintirsom inti moysi
note.note: His is the house, then, and it is He that has built it: a ... man of his household was this Moses.
i.e. the whole house, i.e. plebs.

note.gloss: ceith cenmathá integdais nucut ishé dia
note.note: (omnia) even besides yonder house, it is God.

note.gloss: rubu fersom muintere maith dano dul humal nirbuchoimdiu imurgu [in marg.] Aliter isclí darach moysi (i)sintegdais (i)shé som immurgu ↄrotaig integdais .i. fidelis totius terrae .i. in populo israhel
note.note: he had been a man of (the) household: good then .... humble: he had not been a lord however. Aliter. Moses is an oaken pillar in the house: it is He, however, that has built the house.
He is a son in His Father’s house and He is a Lord.
it is we righteous.
of the gift of a reward to us.
so that we may attain to our reward.
provocation.

note.gloss: .i. rupu accubur leu etergne muchumachti ⁊ rusmbói dano
note.note: i.e. they had a desire to know my power, and they had it (i.e. that knowledge) accordingly.

note.gloss: .i. friscomurtsa fodiuscartach ɫ. fuchésad rupsa frithortæse fritumchomartsa arin cheinélugud hisin .i. pro israhel
note.note: i.e. I have hurt, deponentially, or, passively, I have been offended. I have been offended for that generation.

note.gloss: .i. uindic. inbarain ɫ in uero iudicio
note.note: in my wrath.

note.gloss: .i. genus iuramenti fortius est quam non niinotsat
note.note: they shall not enter.

note.gloss: fomnidsi aphopul nuiednissi arceddurónath ní di maith fri maccu israhel
note.note: take heed, O people of the New Testament! for some good has been even done to the children of Israel.
into (the) Old Law.
i.e. so long as the New Testament abides, do ye every good work.
Joshua and Caleb (excepted).
because he had been the leader of the expedition.
i.e. a gloss on the [of]fensus fui above.
it had been their burial-ground.

note.gloss: hitír tairngeri ɫ. in noum per fidem euangelii
note.note: into (the) land of promise.
because it is thus that he has been.
i.e. land of promise.
they had not what had been promised to them.
because their faith was not perfect.

note.gloss: amal rumbói nephinotacht doibsom treamairis atá inotacht dunni tri hiris ɫ. non profuit rl. quemadmodum rl.
note.note: as they had non-entrance through unfaith, (so) we have entrance through faith.

note.gloss: cumsanad dudia iartuiste duile cumsanad duphopul israhel hitír tairngeri cumsanad duphopul nuiednisi in regno cælorum
note.note: a rest to God after creating the elements; a rest to the people of Israel in (the) land of promise; a rest to the people of the New Testament in regno caelorum.
so that he mentions (the) name of rest there.

note.gloss: [in marg.] ni derlaichta apecdæ doib acht duratad dígal forru cenotad maicsi raith dano maimroimsid nidílgibther duib
note.note: their sins have not been forgiven them, but punishment has been inflicted upon them. Though ye, then, are sons of grace, if ye should sin, ye will not be forgiven.

note.gloss: saini laa sain aimser a requiem futuram aeternam
note.note: different days, a different time, the requiem etc.
after Moses.
this is the supradictum.
Nαυή (LXX.).

note.gloss: arnibuthacair madhé infírchumsanad fuerad iessu macc nún
note.note: for it were not fitting if it were the true rest that Joshua son of Nun had afforded.
after this rest then.
whether to them or to us.

note.gloss: arnaérbarthar frinn anasrobrad friarceiliu .i. si intrabunt rl.
note.note: that what has been said to our fellows may not be said to us.

note.gloss: accumul adéachte ⁊ adoenachte uel incarnatio uocatio passio rl. .i. a principio accepti temporis
note.note: junction of His Godhead and His Manhood.

note.gloss: in anima ut dominus scit cogitationes

note.note: as far as the difference which is between them.

note.gloss: [in marg.] anima et spiritus una pars et caro altera diuisio autem earum sermo dei intelligitur. Aliter diuisio animæ et spiritus anima ipsa est uita carnalis spiritus uero ratio spiritalis in anima inchruth didiu fundailter anima et gratia dei sermo dei scit
note.note: how, then, anima et gratia Dei are divided sermo Dei scit.

note.gloss: banchossmaili friartuissech ⁊ friarsacart confiteamur pecata nostra
note.note: let us be like unto our leader, and to our priest confiteamur etc.
who would not be skilled in our faults.

note.gloss: doini nodnoirdnet ɫ. de hominibus elegitur
note.note: men ordain him.
because he is infirm like every one.

note.gloss: sacerdotis nihe fessin dobeir grad fair
note.note: it is not he himself that confers orders upon him.
it is he who is a priest.

note.gloss: ni adoenacht fesine rudanordan acht deacht
note.note: not His own Manhood has dignified Him, but (the) Godhead.
because He was God’s Son.
His obedience has been known by His suffering.
in every fair deed.
i.e. this is the kind of the man.

note.gloss: de melchisedech de christo .i. adechur frisacartu fetarlicce
note.note: i.e. His difference from priests of the Old Law.

note.gloss: reuertentes in legem et desserentes gratiam .i. ised fuddera
note.note: i.e. it is this that causes it.

note.gloss: .i. initium fidei abgitir crabaith et fidei .i. ruda documenta fidei .i. ataid inhiris
note.note: the alphabet of piety et fidei i.e. ruda documenta fidei i.e. ye are in faith.
this is your kind.

note.gloss: [in marg.] .i. brothchán aschóir duib ní biad bes (so)nairt
note.note: i.e. (it is) pottage that is meet for you, not strong meat.
(it is) reasonable for him that he be ignorant.
solid doctrine.
good (is) their discernment: perfect their senses.

note.gloss: ad altiorem doctrinam adib eolaig and cene
note.note: ye are knowing therein already.
ye should not preach faith.
of the washings.
i.e. of conferring orders.
i.e. your likening to earth.
i.e. let Him be mindful of the good deeds ye have done.
i.e. the brotherly love that ye had.
’tis at that ye are still.
which he has imparted hitherto.
i.e. than Himself.

note.gloss: intan durairngert dia du abracham amaithsin ducuitig tarais fadeissin arnirobe nech bad huaisliu taratoissed
note.note: when God had promised to Abraham that good, He sware by Himself, for there was no one more exalted by whom He could swear.
shall I bless thee?

note.gloss: .i. derb genus iuramenti ut est si intrabunt rl.
note.note: i.e. surely (I will).
i.e. land of promise.
His oath.

note.gloss: submisa enim anchora nauis moueri non potest sic ⁊ mentis intensio sís fucertar cechingor suas fuscerdam ni
note.note: down every anchor is cast: up let us cast it (i.e. our spiritual anchor).

note.gloss: teist inso tra de melchisedech sacerdotes gentium praeter hunc idulorum cultores erant
note.note: this is a testimony de Melchisedech; sacerdotes, etc.

note.gloss: [in marg.] ↄrabad cech brathair post alium .i. ishuisse cerusamaltar fricrist pro longitudine temporis quia neque finis ministerii eius discribitur
note.note: so that each brother should be post alium, i.e. it is right that he be compared to Christ, pro etc.
how much older in age he was quam Abracham.

note.gloss: is uambraithrib arfoemat decimas ni cumme ⁊ melchisedech
note.note: it is from their brethren they receive tithes, not the same as Melchizedek.
